title: U.S.S. Augusta at sea

Carlson, Associate Professor of Economics who is the United Nations' economic consultant on Latin America; Alexander Marchant, Associate Professor of History, born and raised in Rio de Janeiro and Publication Officer of the American Embassy in Rio de Janeiro in 1945-1947.

title: Senior Class Photo, Independence High School, 1901
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace, and Charles Ross, among others, posing for high school graduating class photo, Independence, Missouri, 1901.  Back row: Henry Chiles; Elmer Twyman; William Lloyd Garrett; Harry Truman; Will Long; Myrtle Cronkhite; Laura Ford; Mary Anderson; Gertrude Dixon; Laura Kingsbury.  Third row: Crawford Compton; Leura Walters; Katie Krey; Gertrude Reyner.  Second row: Tasker P. Taylor; Louretta Meador; Minnie Carpenter; Grace Crandall; Mary Taylor; James T. Brown; Mary Chinn; Itaska Atkinson; Bertha Roberts; Bess Wallace.  Front row: Charles Ross; Nellie Caldwell; Emily Witschie; Faith Slichter; Lizzie Gossett; Minnie Robinson; Ruth Knapp; Agnes Roberts; Mary Womack. Original version of this photo is 71-2401.  Donor: Mrs. H. W. Jefferson.

title: Harry S. Truman and friends in his haberdashery store, ca. 1920
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman as a young man in the clothing store he and Eddie Jacobson owned. The name of the store was the Truman and Jacobson Haberdashery, located at l2th and Baltimore (104 West 12th) Kansas City, Missouri The store was opened in l919 and it failed in 1921.  L to R: Harry Truman, Francis Berry, Mike Flynn, and Kelsey Cravens.  This photograph was donated from the files of the Kansas City Star, but they did not originate the photograph.

title: Judge Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman uses a machine to sign multiple checks at once. This photograph was taken when Truman was the presiding Judge of Jackson County, Missouri. See also 64-1514 for better version of this photo.

title: Truman at the helm of U.S.S. Paducah
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman at the helm of the U.S.S. Paducah.  The picture appeared in an article in the Washington Post.  Truman was taking a cruise with the Eighth Naval Reserve Battalion.  Truman left Kansas City by train and boarded the U.S.S. Paducah in Chicago and sailed on the Great Lakes for two weeks.

title: Harry S. Truman being sworn in as Jackson County presiding judge, Missouri

Beeman, and Jackson County Deputy Sherriff Clark "Tiny" Johnson.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Senator Samuel Jackson at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: This is a signed photograph of Senator Samuel Jackson (left side) holding Senator Harry S. Truman's (right side) hand high after Mr. Truman was chosen as Vice-President at the Chicago Convention.  The photo is autographed by Truman: "Best wishes to the greatest chairman the Democrats ever had, from Harry S Truman, U.S.S. Missouri."  Original photo has been transferred to the museum collection.

title: Truman at dinner
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman at a dinner in Lamar, Missouri.  Senator Truman is fifth from the left. Senator Tom Connally of Texas is fourth from the left.  Senator Truman is going to make his acceptance speech for the vice presidential nomination from his hometown of Lamar.

title: Truman with W. M. Earp
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) standing with W. M. Earp drinking water from the well at his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.

title: Harry S. Truman Attends a Breakfast at the Connor Hotel
Scopenote: Senator and Vice-Presidential candidate Harry S. Truman attending a breakfast at the Connor Hotel in Joplin, MO, with supporters from Washington, DC. Pictured left to right are: unidentified, Senator Tom Connally (TX), Senate Majority Leader Alben Barkley (KY) (standing), Senator Harry S. Truman (MO), unidentified (standing), Senator Carl Hatch (NM), and two unidentified men. The picture was taken the morning after Truman made his acceptance speech for the Democratic Vice-Presidential nomination in Lamar, Missouri. Donor: Thomas Korn, Joplin, Missouri.

title: Truman and Others at Breakfast in Connor Hotel
Scopenote: Senator and Vice-Presidential candidate Harry S. Truman (fourth from the right) attending a breakfast at the Connor Hotel in Joplin, MO, with supporters from Washington, DC. Senator Tom Connally is seated to the left of Truman, and Senator Carl Hatch is to the right. The picture was taken the morning after Truman made his acceptance speech for the Democratic Vice-Presidential nomination in Lamar, Missouri. Donor: Thomas Korn, Joplin, Missouri.

title: Truman in a Lamar, Missouri
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (to the left of Senator Tom Connally of Texas) gathered with a crowd of people near an official car in Lamar, Missouri. Senator Truman is going to make his official acceptance speech for the vice presidential nomination in his hometown of Lamar.

title: Truman in Lamar, Missouri
Scopenote: Senator and Vice-Presidential candidate Harry S. Truman talking with Senator Tom Connally of Texas (at left) in Lamar, Missouri. Senator Truman is going to make his acceptance speech for the vice presidential nomination in his hometown of Lamar.

title: Vice Presidential Candidate Truman in parade in Lamar, Missouri
Scopenote: Vice Presidential candidate Harry S. Truman riding in a parade in Lamar, Missouri, with Senator Tom Connally at his side.

title: Dewey sign
Scopenote: A photograph of a Thomas E. Dewey sign used during his presidential campaign against President Franklin D. Roosevelt.  The sign says "Vote for Dewey and do What Hoover Did", and shows a woman and child standing next to a garbage can.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers: Papers as U.S. Senator and Vice President

title: Senator Truman Greets the Managers of the St. Louis Cardinals and the St. Louis Browns at the 1944 World Series
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman, Democratic party candidate for Vice-President of the United States, at the 1944 World Series in St. Louis, Missouri, between the St. Louis Browns and the St. Louis Cardinals. Pictured from left to right: Donald Lee Barnes, owner of the Browns; Luke Sewell, manager of the Browns; Senator Harry S. Truman, D-MO; Billy Southworth, manager of the Cardinals; and Sam Breadon, owner of the Cardinals.

Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman (left) walks at Fort Belvoir with Brigadier General Gordon Young, Commander of Fort Belvoir (center), and Colonel Harry H. Vaughan, Aide to the Vice President (right). Soldier in the background is unidentified.

title: Brig. General Dwight Johns speaking

Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman speaking during the graduation exercises at Fort Belvoir 76th OCS Engineer School.  General Harry Vaughan is seated in the background (far right).

title: Close-up of Truman being sworn in
Scopenote: Front row, left to right: President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, and Margaret Truman, as Mr. Truman is being sworn in as President of the United States after the death of Franklin D. Roosevelt.    Donor: Dorothy Girton.

title: President Truman being sworn is as President
Scopenote: President Truman being sworn is as President.  Others in photo, from left to right are:  Philip B. Fleming, Public Works Administrator; John B. Blandford, Jr., Housing Administrator; Leo Crowley, Chairman, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation; Frances Perkins, Secretary of Labor; Henry Stimson, Secretary of War; Henry Wallace, Secretary of Commerce; Julius Krug, War Production Board Administrator; James Forrestal, Secretary of the Navy; Claude Wickard, Secretary of Agriculture; Francis McNamee, Department Chairman, War Manpower Commission; Francis Biddle, Attorney General; Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of the Treasury; Edward Stettinius, Secretary of State; Harry S. Truman;  Bess Wallace Truman; Harold Ickes, Secretary of the Interior; Margaret Truman; Harlan Stone, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court; Sam Rayburn, Speaker of the House; Fred Vinson, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; Representative Joseph Martin, House Minority Leader; Representative Robert Ramspeck, House Democratic Whip; Representative John McCormack, House Majority Leader.

title: President Truman taking oath of office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman taking the oath of office after President Franklin D. Roosevelt's death in the Cabinet Room, Executive Offices, at the White House. Left to Right: Francis Biddle, Attorney General; Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of the Treasury (behind Biddle); Edward Stettinius, Secretary of State; Harry S. Truman; Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman; Harold Ickes, Secretary of the Interior; Margaret Truman; Harlan Stone, Chief Justice, United States Supreme Court; Sam Rayburn, Speaker, House of Representatives.

title: Portrait of President Truman sitting at desk
Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman, seated at a desk. This photo was copied by a lithograph process (color) and sent out to Post Offices, lodges, libraries, and public buildings during President Truman's term in office.

title: Mary Jane Truman exiting a car in Dallas
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (right) stepping out of a car in Dallas, Texas, with three unidentified men around her.  The event is unknown.

title: Mary Jane Truman and women in Dallas
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (second from the left) standing with three unidentified women in Dallas, Texas.  The event is unknown, but is probably related to the Order of the Eastern Star, with which Miss Truman was involved.

title: Mary Jane Truman greeted in Dallas
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (right) greeting unidentified men while in Dallas, Texas.  The man on the left may be the mayor of Dallas, James Woodall Rodgers.

title: Mary Jane Truman arrives in Dallas
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman being greeted by Edna (Mrs. James Woodall) Rodgers and the Mayor of Dallas, Texas, James Woodall Rodgers, upon exiting the train in Dallas.  The event is unknown.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Woodall Rogers with Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: From left to right, Edna (Mrs. James) Woodall Rodgers and Mary Jane Truman carry a bouquet.  Ms. Truman is descending steps from the train and Mr. James Woodall Rodgers, Mayor of Dallas, Texas, is at the foot of the steps.  In the bottom corner, the photo is autographed: "Woodall Rodgers, Mayor of Dallas, Mrs. Woodall Rodgers, May 28th , 1945".

Scopenote: Two unidentified women with Mary Jane Truman (right) in a car in Dallas, Texas.  The event is unknown.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing on the speakers platform in a cap and gown at the University of Kansas City's graduation ceremony. Truman received an honorary degree. The flags of various nations stand in the background.

title: President Truman addresses crowd, University of Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses a large outdoor crowd at the University of Kansas City, commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law.

title: Truman attending ceremony at University of Kansas City
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaking at the ceremony celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law at the University of Kansas City.  President Harry S. Truman is seated on the front row, in the white hat, behind the podium.

title: Outdoor crowd to hear Truman at University of Kansas City
Scopenote: A large outdoor crowd assembled to listen to President Harry S. Truman give a speech commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law at the University of Kansas City.

title: President Truman shaking hands with officer
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with an exchange student from Peru studying at the University of Kansas City during a picnic. Truman made a speech at the University and would receive an honorary degree that day at the Municipal Auditorium. Col. Harry Vaughan is standing in the background.

title: Crowd at University of Kansas City
Scopenote: A large outdoor crowd assembled to listen to President Harry S. Truman give a speech commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law at the University of Kansas City.  Truman also received an Honorary Degree from the university while he was in town.

Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at the commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law at the University of Kansas City.  President Harry S. Truman is seated on the front row, directly behind the podium, in the white hat.

title: President Truman attending ceremony, University of Kansas City
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at the commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law at the University of Kansas City.  President Harry S. Truman is seated on the front row, directly behind the podium, in the white hat.

title: President Truman and others at the University of Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in light suit) and others on campus of the University of Kansas City.

title: Cordell Hull signs a charter
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State, Cordell Hull, as member of the American delegation to the United Nations Conference at San Francisco, signs the charter at the State Department in Washington, D. C.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of State James Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) stands with others as James Byrnes (center, holding Bible) is sworn in as Secretary of State. Visible in the background are outgoing Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (between Mr. and Mrs. Byrnes), and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson (to the left of Mr. Truman). All others are unidentified.

title: U.S. Flag Raised over Adolph Hitler Barracks in Berlin
Scopenote: United States flag raised for the first time over Berlin, Germany at the Adolf Hitler Barracks.  Soviet Honor Guard in foreground.

title: Clement R. Attlee, Harry S. Truman, and Josef Stalin at Potsdam
Scopenote: The "Big Three" at the Potsdam Conference in Germany.  Enjoying a brief respite during the last day of the conference are, left to right, Prime Minister Clement R. Attlee, Great Britain; President Harry S. Truman, United States; and Generalissimo Josef Stalin, Russia.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.

title: Truman and Cabinet after Japanese Surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with his Cabinet to discuss the Japanese Surrender to end World War II. Around the table, left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach; National Housing Agency Chairman John B. Blandford, Jr.; War Production Board Chairman Julius Krug; War Mobilization Director John W. Snyder; Office of Economic Stabilization Director William H. Davis; Foreign Economics Administrator Leo Crowley; Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace; Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; Secretary of State James Byrnes; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson; Attorney General Tom Clark; Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. Photograph is signed by all.

title: President Truman announcing Japanese surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a press conference at the White House announcing Japanese surrender. Seated on the couch, second from the left, is First Lady Bess Truman.  President Harry S. Truman is found standing behind his desk.  Also in the photo are John W. Snyder, Director, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion (seated on the couch, right); Attorney General Tom Clark (standing, second from the right); and Secretary of State James Byrnes (seated behind President Truman).

title: President Truman Signing Proclamation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) signing Proclamation 2660:  Victory in the East-Day of Prayer.  James Byrnes, Secretary of State, looks on.

title: President Truman and General DeGaulle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) greeting General Charles DeGaulle.  Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and Admiral William D. Leahy stand in the background.

title: President Truman and DeGaulle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and French General Charles DeGaulle (left) saluting.  Admiral William Leahy stands in the background.

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz Signs Japanese Surrender on USS Missouri
Scopenote: A peace treaty effecting the end of the second World War is being signed aboard the USS Missouri. Admiral Chester Nimitz of the United States Navy is shown signing the Treaty. The ship is in Tokyo Bay, Japan.

title: Japan surrenders on the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Japanese representative General Yoshijiro signs the instrument of unconditional surrender on the U.S.S. Missouri, as General Douglas MacArthur watches.   Same as 68-537.

title: President Truman in Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) descending a staircase with Tom Evans (second from right) and Fred Canfil (right).  A crowd of unidentified men is also present.

Scopenote: The Swimming pool at Franklin D. Roosevelt's Shangri-La retreat.

Scopenote: Franklin D. Roosevelt's bedroom at the Shangri-La retreat.

Scopenote: Living Room at Franklin D. Roosevelt's Shangri-La retreat.

title: President Truman at Kentucky Dam dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shaking hands with George Marshall at the dedication of the Kentucky (TVA) Dam in Marshall County, Kentucky. In the background are: unidentified man, Dean Acheson and Averell Harriman, and unidentified man.

title: President Harry S. Truman and General George C. Marshall at ROA banquet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General George C. Marshall shake hands at an ROA banquet. President Truman is presenting General Marshall with permanent membership in the Reserve Officers Association at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D. C.  Same as 78-694, but better print.

title: President Truman speaks to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses a joint session of Congress advocating a program for Universal Military Training.  Seated behind President Truman is President Pro Tempore of the Senate, Senator Kenneth McKellar (left) and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (right).  Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Maury Maverick, Artemus Gates, and Mayor Lapham of San Francisco
Scopenote: From left to right: Maury Maverick, Chairman of Smaller War Plan Corporation; Artemus Gates, Assistant Secretary of Navy; and Mayor Lapham of San Francisco holding a flag.

title: President Truman and sailors, Navy Day Celebrations, New York
Scopenote: President Truman on Navy Day in New York Harbor aboard the U.S.S Missouri.

title: Ships on Navy Day with Navy blimp over fleet, showing Midway, Enterprise, Missouri, New York, and others
Scopenote: Ships on Navy Day with Navy blimp over fleet, showing Midway, Enterprise, Missouri, New York, and others.

title: Margaret Truman aboard the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Margaret Truman signing a document aboard the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day in New York. Also pictured is Admiral Jonas H. Ingram  (far left), Drucie Snyder (second from the left), and Rear Admiral Monroe Kelly (far right). Other people in the picture are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman at Navy Day
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (third from the left) aboard the deck of the U.S.S. Missouri with Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (center) and Drucie Snyder (second from the right). The other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Ships in New York Harbor
Scopenote: Ships take part in the celebrations held on Navy Day in New York Harbor.

title: President Truman dedicating the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech on the dedication of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt on Navy Day.

title: President Truman and Navy Day celebrations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (farthest right) watches an aerial display from the deck of the destroyer Renshaw. Behind the President is, from left to right, Commodore James K. Vardaman and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram.

title: President Truman attends Navy Day on U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (first row, right side) is seated next to Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (second from the right on the first row) on the deck of the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day in New York Harbor. Others are unidentified.

title: Naval ships on Navy Day
Scopenote: This picture was taken from the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day in New York Harbor. Also pictured is the destroyer Renshaw (left of the U.S.S. Missouri) which is passing in front of the battleship New York, while in the background smoke clouds can be seen coming from the cruiser Helena.

title: Navy Day Celebrations in New York Harbor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on Navy Day in New York Harbor aboard the U.S.S Missouri.

title: President Truman on U. S. S. Missouri during Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left)watching the Navy Day celebrations aboard the U.S.S. Missouri.

title: President Truman aboard the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman aboard the deck of the U.S.S. Missouri watching the celebrations of Navy Day in New York.

title: Navy Day, New York City
Scopenote: A photograph of the New York City skyline, including Sheep Meadow of Central Park where a crowd gathers to hear the President's principal address on Navy Day.

title: President Truman aboard U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) looks out over the New York Harbor from the destroyer Renshaw on Navy Day. In the background is the U.S.S. Missouri giving off a salute to the President. Also pictured is First Lady Bess Truman (to the right of her husband). Other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: President Truman reading plaque on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left), Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (second from left), and Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy (third from left) read a plaque aboard the U.S.S. Missouri where the signing of the Japanese treaty took place.  Truman was on board the U.S.S. Missouri during Navy Day celebrations.

title: President Truman at City Hall, New York City, Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center of the window) stands in a window at City Hall with Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (left of President Truman) while serenaded by a choir of Midshipmen. The plaque below him commemorates the fact that George Washington had stood near that spot while the Declaration of Independence was read to the Continental Army.

title: President Truman in salute on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left) stands in salute along with New York Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (center) and Admiral William D. Leahy (in front of Mayor La Guardia) on Navy Day in New York City.

title: President Truman speaking
Scopenote: President Truman speaking in Central Park, New York City, New York in tribute to its victorious fleet in the first peacetime Navy Day since the start of World War II.

title: President Truman aboard the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing a document aboard the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day in New York Harbor.

title: President Truman signing visitor's log
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated behind the desk) is shown signing the visitor's log aboard the U.S.S. Missouri.  Standing behind the President are, from left to right, Admiral Jonas H. Ingram, Captain Stuart S. Murray, Mr. Grover Whalen, Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, Mayor Fiorello LaGuardia (partially obscured), and Commodore James K. Vardaman, Jr.

title: President Truman conversing on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (to the right of Truman), talking to New York Governor Thomas Dewey (left) on the deck of the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day. Other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Ships on Navy Day, New York Harbor
Scopenote: Ships on Navy Day, New York Harbor.

title: The Renshaw passes the Midway, Navy Day, New York Harbor

title: Navy Planes over the fleet on Navy Day, New York Harbor
Scopenote: Navy Planes over the fleet on Navy Day, New York Harbor.

Scopenote: Navy Day and the fleet in New York harbor.

title: Navy Blimp flying over U.S.S. Boise
Scopenote: A United States Navy Blimp soars over the U.S.S. Boise, with the U.S.S. Midway on the left.

title: U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt on Navy Day
Scopenote: The aircraft carrier Franklin D. Roosevelt in New York Harbor on Navy Day.

title: President Truman on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) takes an inspection tour of the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day. Left to right:  Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, President Truman, and Captain Stuart S. Murray.

title: President Truman on U.S.S. Missouri stairwell
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (top of the stairs) and Commodore James K. Vardaman (left of President Harry S. Truman) follow Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (bottom of stairs) after a luncheon on the U.S.S. Missouri on Navy Day. Other people shown in the picture are unidentified.

title: President Truman in motorcade on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seen waving from the first car) waves to a crowd while he is driven down Broadway in New York City on Navy Day.

title: Ships on Navy Day, New York Harbor
Scopenote: Ships sailing through the New York Harbor on Navy Day.

title: President Truman dedicating the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right) is shown giving a speech dedicating the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt on Navy Day.  Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receiving honorary membership in the Alumni Association of the University of Missouri from Maurice P. Murphy (left).

Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman. See also 58-486.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Dean Canterbury, Rev. Hewlett Johnson, in President Truman's office in the White House.

Scopenote: Banquet photo from the Bicentennial Anniversary of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in Washington, D. C. at the Mayflower Hotel, at which President Harry S. Truman spoke. Original photograph oversized.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) preparing to press button to illuminate the National Community Christmas with unidentified others looking on.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on speakers platform with unidentified others, South Grounds of White House, for the lighting of the National community Christmas tree.

title: Truman Waving Before he Flies Home to Independence for the Holidays

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of Mary Conclave, No. 5, Knights of the Red Cross of Constantine and Appendant Orders, in Kansas City, Missouri. (L-R, back row) George C. Marquis, Milton Fly Hill, Samuel A. Gilliland, Perry N. Lingren, George M. Saunders. (L-R, Front Row) N.D. Jackson, President Harry S. Truman, Harry C. Johnston.
Institutional Creator: Anderson Photo Co., Kansas City, MO

Scopenote: Scene outside of the White House with a group of unidentified people.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving a copy of sheet music by Chopin that has been autographed by Sergeant Eugene List in the Oval Office.  Sergeant List played piano for President Truman while the President was in Potsdam.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards General Henry Arnold a Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is giving Major General Henry "Hap" Arnold (right), commander of the U.S. Army Air Forces, the Distinguished Service Medal.

title: President Truman and Gen. William J. Donovan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presenting Major General William J. Donovan, commander of the Office of Strategic Services, with a Distinguished Service Medal Oak Leaf cluster.

title: President Truman with Mr. and Mrs. John Oeser
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with John Oeser, as Mrs. Oeser looks on.  Mr. Oeser won the title of being, "Typical Midwest Farmer" of 1945.

title: Harry S. Truman with national officers of Future Farmers of America
Scopenote: President Truman greeted the national officers of the Future Farmers of America for 1945-1946 at the White House. (L-R) Virgil Getto of Fallon, Nebraska; Eugene Starkey of Orlan, California; President Truman; J. Glyndon Stuff of Polo, Illinois; Joseph E. Espey of Maryville, Missouri; and Marion Baumgardner of Wellington, Texas. Donor: Dorothy Girton.

title: Harry S. Truman meets with Future Farmers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with five members of the Future Farmers of America. (L-R) Virgil Getto of Fallon, Nebraska; Eugene Starkey of Orlan, California; President Truman; J. Glyndon Stuff of Polo, Illinois; Joseph E. Espey of Maryville, Missouri; and Marion Baumgardner of Wellington, Texas.

title: President Truman presenting medals to others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Selective Service Medal to fifty-four members of local Selective Service boards, at the White House.  President Truman is in the back, under the second chandelier.

title: President Truman giving medal to Major General Hershey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Major General Lewis B. Hershey (right) after the President gave him the Distinguished Service Medal.

title: President Truman being presented a medal
Scopenote: Major General Lewis B. Hershey (right) pins the Selective Service medal on President Harry S. Truman (left).

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with A.R. McKee, Local Selective Service Board 1, Jefferson County, Missouri, after the President gave him the Selective Service Medal.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presenting the Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Chaplain Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan after Truman gave O'Callahan the Congressional Medal of Honor.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving a gift of two anthracite coal bookends from Cub Scout Robert Todd, of Plymouth, Pennsylvania.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with the leaders of the Air Force Association in the Oval Office.  (L-R) General James H. Doolittle, Colonel Willis S. Fitch, Technical Sergeant Forrest Vosler, President Truman, Lieutenant Colonel Thomas G. Lanphier, Jr., Sergeant Merryl Frost, and Colonel James M. Stewart (also the actor).

title: President Truman and Roosevelt Memorial Stamps
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving the first sheet of Franklin D. Roosevelt memorial stamps from Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan.

title: Truman Family and Margaret O'Brien
Scopenote: The Trumans sitting with Margaret O'Brien.  (L-R) Margaret Truman, Margaret O'Brien, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman.

title: President Truman giving an address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving an address at the White House for the Infantile Paralysis drive.

title: President Truman sampling bread
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson sampling new bread for America.

title: Margaret Truman's 22nd Birthday Party
Scopenote: Margaret Truman sitting at her 22nd Birthday Party with Drucie Snyder, Malcolm Von Behren, and Madame Helle Bonnet, wife of the French Ambassador to the United States.  Margaret is giving Mme. Bonnet a piece from the cake on the table.  (L-R) Margaret Truman, Drucie Snyder, Malcolm Von Behren, and Mme. Bonnet.

title: President Truman at a banquet with officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a dinner sponsored by the Forty-Eight State Wing Command of the Civil Aeronautic Patrol at the Statler Hotel in Washington.  He is sitting with several officers at a long table.  (L-R) Major General Fred L. Anderson; Assistant Secretary of War for Air Stuart Symington; President Truman; Colonel Earl Johnson; Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn; General Carl Spaatz; and Brigadier General Bill Hall.

title: Churchill, Truman, and others at Westminster College
Scopenote: From left to right, Governor Phil Donnelly, Winston Churchill, President Harry S. Truman, and Dr. Franc L. McCluer at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri.  Credit: Terry Savage.

title: President Truman endorses British Loan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman endorses a loan to the United Kingdom. From left to right: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, President Truman, unidentified man, possibly O. Max Gardner.

title: Military aides and Truman on train en route to Fulton, Missouri
Scopenote: General Harry Vaughan (partially obscured), Clark Clifford, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman and others stand at the rear of a train during Winston Churchill's visit to Fulton, Missouri where Churchill made his famous "Iron Curtain" speech.

title: President Truman at Churchill's "Iron Curtain" Speech
Scopenote: From left to right: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William D. Leahy, Captain Clark Clifford, Major General Harry Vaughan, and Winston Churchill at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri the day Churchill gave the "Iron Curtain" speech. From left to right: Winston Churchill, William Leahy (behind Churchill), Clark Clifford, Harry Vaughan, and President Truman. Credit: Terry Savage.

title: Harry Truman and Winston Churchill in Jefferson City, Missouri, en route to Fulton
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Prime Minister Winston Churchill in car in parade in Jefferson City, Missouri.  It was on this day that Churchill made his famous "Iron Curtain" speech at Westminster College in Fulton.  Secret Service men are on the running boards of the car.

title: President Truman and Aides on the platform of a train to Fulton, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and staff members on the rear platform of the train taking them to Fulton, Missouri with Winston Churchill, where Churchill gave his famous "Iron Curtain" speech. From left to right: Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, President Truman, Charles Ross (partly obscured behind Truman), Wallace Graham, and an unidentified man.

title: Truman on train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the rear of a train during Winston Churchill's visit to Fulton, Missouri.

title: President Truman aboard the a train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman aboard the "Presidential Special" train as it neared Columbus, Ohio.  Behind him is a unidentified military officer.

title: President Truman with others in White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) meeting with Senator Harley Kilgore of West Virginia (second from the right) and unidentified African American men.  They are presenting an issue of "Color" magazine to President Truman.

title: President Truman with Sons of St. Patrick
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right)looking at a mug with three unidentified men who belonged to the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick.

title: President Truman with Sons of St. Patrick
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) looking at a mug with three unidentified men who belong to the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick.

title: President Truman at the annual Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the annual Jackson Day Dinner with Henry A. Wallace, Robert Hannegan, and Joseph E. Davies. (L-R) President Truman, Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, and Joseph E. Davies.

title: President Truman with Congresswoman Mankin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Congresswoman Helen Douglas Mankin of Georgia.  Similar to 90-18.

title: President Truman on the White House Lawn
Scopenote: Full length photograph of President Harry S. Truman in front of the White House in Washington, D. C. Same as 58-30, only 58-30 is more cropped.

title: Truman smelling blossoms at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, on the White House lawn, smelling blossoms in the spring of 1946.

title: President Truman and members of B'Nai Brith

title: The Truman Family and others walking
Scopenote: From left to right, Admiral William D. Leahy (in background, behind President Truman) President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, General Harry Vaughan, and Margaret Truman leaving for Chicago.

title: Mrs. Truman's Bridge Club

From left to right: Mrs. Leslie (Mary) Shaw, Mrs. Thomas (Adelaide) Twyman, Mrs. Frank (Natalie) Wallace, Mrs. Mize (Lucy) Peters, Margaret Truman, Mrs. James H. (Anne) Boyle (mostly obscured behind Margaret), Mrs. George (May) Wallace, Mrs. E. K. (Helena) Crow, Bess Wallace Truman, Mrs. Melvin (Thelma) Pollette, Mrs. James C. (Mag) Noel, Mrs. John (Edna) Hutchison, and Mrs. Oscar (Linda) King.

title: President Truman, James Byrnes, and George Messersmith
Scopenote: President Truman meeting with Secretary of State James Byrnes and George S. Messersmith, United States Ambassador to Argentina in the Oval Office.  (L-R) President Truman, Secretary of State Byrnes, and Ambassador Messersmith.

title: President Truman at Roosevelt Home dedication
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified, Eleanor Roosevelt, General Harry Vaughan, and President Harry S. Truman attending the dedication of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt home as a National Historic Site. President Roosevelt's dog, Fala, is by President Truman.

title: President Truman and the Ambassador of Nicaragua
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and the Ambassador of Nicaragua Senor Dr. Guillermo Sevilla Sacasa talking at a meeting of the Pan American Union Board.

title: President Truman addressing the Pan American Union
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing members of the board of governors of the Pan American Union who had assembled in the Great Hall of the Americas at the Pan American Union building in Washington, D. C.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman confers with the Reconversion Advisory Board on the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion. From left to right, front row: John Snyder, Anna M. Rosenberg, President Truman, Eric A. Johnston, Albert Goss. Back row, left to right: Edward P. Felker, T.C. Cashen, Edward A. O'Neal, Chester Davis, and Nathaniel Dyke, Jr.

title: Pan American Day luncheon
Scopenote: Mrs. Mary (George) Allen, Mrs. Mamie (Dwight D.) Eisenhower, Mrs. Margaret (Robert P.) Patterson, and Mrs. Maryon (Lester B.) Pearson in a little Spanish store gathering ingredients for a Pan American Day Luncheon.

title: President Truman and others on the quarter deck
Scopenote: Admiral Marc A. Mitscher (left), Herbert E. Regan, Captain Taylor, President Harry S. Truman (center), and unidentified others standing on the quarter deck while aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman during a review of the 8th Fleet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in front row, center), Admiral William Leahy (front row, right), Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (back row, right), and unidentified others on the bridge of the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during a review of the 8th fleet.  Truman was aboard the ship for fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Mitscher and Forrestal aboard U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Admiral Marc A. Mitscher (left) and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (right) standing together during President Harry S. Truman's trip aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Mitscher, Forrestal, and Snowden on U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: President Truman and others watch planes take-off
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in tweed cap), Admiral Chester Nimitz (in white hat beside President Truman), Charles T. Mauro (in white hat behind the President) and other unidentified men watch planes take-off. Truman was aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt for fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman looking at electrical system
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with Commander David F. Kinert looking over the electrical system of the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman on board the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right, Brig. General Harry Vaughan, Admiral Chester Nimitz, President Harry S. Truman, and an unidentified man aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and others on bridge
Scopenote: An unidentified man, President Harry S. Truman, and Admiral Marc A. Mitscher on the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Admiral M.A. Mitscher and Herbert E. Regan on a Ship
Scopenote: Admiral Marc A. Mitscher and Herbert E. Regan aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes. They are awaiting the arrival of Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.

title: Admiral Mitscher and Lt. Commander Remington
Scopenote: Admiral Marc A. Mitscher and Lt. Commander Remington aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman greeted by Forrestal and Nimitz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the right) shaking hands with Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.  Admiral Chester Nimitz is standing with Secretary Forrestal; Admiral William Leahy is standing behind President Truman.  Truman was aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt for fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman watching fleet maneuvers
Scopenote: From left to right, an unidentified man, Admiral Chester Nimitz, and President Harry S. Truman watching fleet maneuvers from aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during a set of fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman being saluted
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) being saluted by Naval personnel while aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt, flagship of the U.S. Navy 6th Fleet, during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Admiral Mitscher and President Truman on a ship
Scopenote: Admiral Marc A. Mitscher (left, in white hat) and President Harry S. Truman inspecting a Marine detachment aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Truman and others aboard U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right, Admiral Marc A. Mitscher, President Harry S. Truman, Commander Robert E. C. Jones, and Commander David F. Kinert aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman being welcomed on the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman being welcomed by Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal and Admiral Chester Nimitz aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Officers on board the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified, Commodore Arleigh A. Burke, Admiral Marc. M. Mitscher, and Herbert E. Regan aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Truman and navy personnel aboard U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right: Captain Griffin, Captain Clark M. Clifford, Commander Snowden, President Harry S. Truman (in tweed cap, hidden behind Admiral Nimitz) and Admiral Chester Nimitz on the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman reviewing fleet operations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands reviewing fleet operations from the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and others talking
Scopenote: Charles T. Mauro, Clark Clifford, General Harry Vaughan, Admiral Marc A. Mitscher, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (right) , and other unidentified men aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Commander Jones and Secretary Forrestal on Flight Deck
Scopenote: Commander Robert E. C. Jones (left) and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (in baseball cap) on the primary flight deck of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman viewing a fleet operation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman wearing one of the Navy's leather flight jackets and a baseball cap given to him by Admiral Marc A. Mitscher. Truman is viewing a fleet operation from the bridge of the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and party on U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right, front row: Captain Taylor; Admiral Marc A. Mitscher, Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, Admiral William D. Leahy, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman and Brigadier General Harry H. Vaughan. Remaining men are unidentified. They are aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman viewing fleet maneuvers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Admiral Marc A. Mitscher viewing fleet maneuvers from aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during a series of fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and Admiral Nimitz on a Bridge
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (left) and President Harry S. Truman on the bridge of the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt aircraft carrier.

title: Admiral Nimitz and Commander Fluckey on a Bridge
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz and Commander Fluckey standing on the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and party on U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right: Captain Taylor, unidentified, Captain Clark Clifford, Admiral William Leahy, Press Secretary Charles Ross, unidentified, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, William Hassett, President Harry S. Truman, unidentified, John Steelman, Brigadier General Harry Vaughan, and unidentified. They are aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman on bridge
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the bridge of the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt. Truman was aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt for fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman thanking M.R. Conway
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman thanking M. R. Conway, Bkr/1/c who made the "Welcome Aboard" cake sitting on the table.  President Truman was aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman Leaving the U.S.S. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt on the Admiral's Barge after a visit during a set of fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman on U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: An unidentified man and Harry S. Truman standing on the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt watching the pre-drawn launching of aircraft during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and party on board U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in hat) and unidentified men aboard the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.  Admiral William Leahy is standing in the background, to the right of President Truman.  Behind President Truman is Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (wearing hat with dark band) and Press Secretary Charles Ross (holding hat).

title: President Truman on throttle watch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Harry O. Brewer, MM 3/c on throttle watch aboard the U. S. S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman and others observe aircraft
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the left), Admiral Chester Nimitz (right), and unidentified others looking up to observe aircraft from the bridge of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: President Truman visits the Sick Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman chats with Robert G. Schmidt, 52/c in the sick bay of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt during fleet maneuvers off the Virginia Capes.

title: Poppy Presentation to President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is presented a poppy by Mrs. Walter G. Craven on Poppy Day.  Mrs. Craven is National President of the American Legion Auxiliary.

title: President Truman presenting pens
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presenting pens used to sign a bill to give veterans the highest priority for surplus purchases.  The group around Truman include Senator Joseph C. O'Mahoney (D-WY), Lt. General Edmund S. Gregory, Senator Burnet R. Maybank (D-SC), Mrs. Edith Nourse Rogers (R-MA), and Representative Carter Manasco (D-AL).

title: The old State Department building
Scopenote: The old State Department building in Washington, D. C.

title: President Truman speaking at a highway safety conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) speaking at a Highway Safety Conference at the State Department Auditorium.

title: President Truman speaks to Highway Safety Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing at a podium, addressing the opening session of the President's Highway Safety Conference.  The session was held in the State Department Auditorium.

title: President Truman with Hank Greenberg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Hank Greenberg of the Detroit Tigers.

title: President Truman receives report
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, fourth from the right) receives a report from movie industry representatives on their annual Red Cross fund drive.  Basil O'Connor, Chairman of the Red Cross, is also present.  See also 78-843 and 78-844.

title: A picket line in front of the White House
Scopenote: Relatives of conscientious objectors still in prison picketing in front of the White House.

title: General MacArthur and others leaving Tokyo headquarters
Scopenote: From left to right, General Douglas MacArthur, Edwin W. Pauley and Lieutenant Colonel H.S. Wheeler leaving Tokyo headquarters.

title: President Harry S. Truman leaving to visit his mother
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving Bolling Army Air Field to visit his mother in Grandview, Missouri.

title: President Truman and Walter Pope Binns at William Jewell College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Walter Pope Binns (middle row, left to right) walking behind flag bearers at the graduation ceremonies of William Jewell College.  Walking behind President Truman is (from left to right) General Harry Vaughan and Captain Clark Clifford.

title: President Truman receives vase
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a 900-year-old vase from Dr. E. W. Chang, head of the Coseoul Normal College of Korea.  The vase is a gift to the American People.

title: President Harry S. Truman signs the postal pay raise bill
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan (third from the left) and other unidentified men watch as President Harry S. Truman signs the postal pay raise bill.

title: Mrs. Truman and Rep. Jessie Sumner
Scopenote: Bess Wallace Truman and Representative Jessie Sumner at the Spanish Club Luncheon held at the Canadian Embassy.

title: President Truman Signs Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the Government Workers Pay Raise Bill.  Standing, left to right: Representative Edward H. Rees; James B. Burns, National President of the American Federation of Government Employees; Senator Harry F. Byrd; Representative Jennings Randolph; Senator Bourke B. Hickenlooper; Luther C. Steward, President of the National Federation of Federal Employees; Senator Sheridan Downey; Harry B. Mitchell, President of the United States Civil Service Commission; Representative Henry M. Jackson; and Arthur S. Flemming, United States Civil Service Commissioner.  Same as photo 59-1124.

title: President Harry S. Truman signs the Government Workers Pay Raise Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the Government Workers Pay Raise Bill.  Standing, left to right: Representative Edward H. Rees; James B. Burns, National President of the American Federation of Government Employees; Senator Harry F. Byrd; Representative Jennings Randolph; Senator Bourke B. Hickenlooper; Luther C. Steward, President of the National Federation of Federal Employees; Senator Sheridan Downey; Harry B. Mitchell, President of the United States Civil Service Commission; Representative Henry M. Jackson; and Arthur S. Flemming, United States Civil Service Commissioner.  Same as photo 59-1184.

title: President Harry S. Truman addresses the nation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the nation from Capitol Hill regarding the Railroad strike.  (left to right) Senator Walter F. George and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn sit in the background.

title: Perry Barnes Class
Scopenote: Perry Barnes Class, apparently a school in Kansas City.  Original photograph oversized
Institutional Creator: Anderson Photo Co., Kansas City, MO

title: The White House "gym."
Scopenote: The White House "gym."

title: President Truman with Brazilian Ambassador and Minister
Scopenote: (Left to right) President Harry S. Truman with Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins and Vice Admiral Jorge Dodsworth Martins, Minister of the Brazilian Navy.

title: President Truman signs National School Lunch Act
Scopenote: President Truman, seated, signed the National School Lunch Act, which authorizes the U.S. Department of Agriculture to assume half the expenses for school lunches in any state assuming the other half.  Thus, for the first time, this program, which has run for 11 years on a year-to-year basis with no financial participation by the states, becomes a permanent part of the Department's activities.  Standing left to right:  Clinton P. Anderson, Secretary of Agriculture; Rep. Malcolm C. Tarver, Georgia, member of House Appropriations Committee; Sen. Richard B. Russell, Georgia, member of the Senate Agriculture Committee; Sen. Allen Ellender, Louisiana, member of the Senate Agriculture Committee; Rep. Clifford R. Hope, Kansas, member of the House Agriculture Committee; Sen. George D. Aiken, Vermont, member of the Senate Agriculture Committee; Rep. John W. Flannagan, Virginia, Chairman of the House Agriculture Committee.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.

title: President Harry S. Truman signs the school lunch act
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs the School Lunch Act.  Present are (standing, from left to right) Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson, Senator Allen J. Ellender, and Senator George D. Aiken.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the White House
Scopenote: From left to right, Fred Vinson, President Harry S. Truman and John Snyder at the White House.  Truman had announced that Vinson was his nominee for Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, and Snyder was his nominee to replace Vinson as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Warren R. Austin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman appointing Senator Warren R. Austin (right) to represent the United States on the United Nations Security Council.

title: President Truman signs Administrative Procedure Act
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs the Administrative Procedure Act. Left to right: Congressman John Gwynne (R-Iowa); Counsel for the House Judiciary Committee, Charles E. Long, Jr.; Representative of the Attorney General, Ashley Sellers; Representative of the American Bar Association, Carl McFarland; Senator Pat McCarran (D-Nevada); Chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, Congressman Hatton W. Sumners (D-Texas); Congressman Francis E. Walter (D-Pennsylvania).

title: White House Record clerk Herbert L. Miller
Scopenote: Herbert L. Miller, White House Record clerk leaving the White House with the Anti-Strike Bill that President Harry S. Truman vetoed.

title: President Truman with Byrnes and Vandenberg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) speaks with Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg (center) on an airport tarmac.  A crowd of unidentified men and women stands in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Officials Leaving for Paris
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right, wearing hat) with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left, without hat), just before Secretary Byrnes leaves for the Paris Peace Conference. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman receiving Hungarian Prime Minister, Ferenc Nagy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving Hungarian Prime Minister as others of the Hungarian Mission look on.  Front row, left to right: Hungarian Prime Minister Ferenc Nagy; President Truman; Deputy Prime Minister Mathais Rakosli, Deputy Prime Minister.

title: President Truman and Eugene Meyer
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Eugene Meyer, President of International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (right).

title: President Truman and former President Hoover
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and former President Hoover at the White House, after Hoover's South American Food Mission trip.

title: President Truman during a horseshoe pitching demonstration
Scopenote: From left to right, Admiral Chester Nimitz, President Harry S. Truman and Jimmie Risk during a horseshoe pitching demonstration.  The bottom of the photograph has President Truman's signature.

title: Fred Vinson takes oath of office as Chief Justice
Scopenote: Chief Justice D. Lawrence Groner administers the oath of office to Fred Vinson.  In the background are Captain Clark Clifford, White House Naval Aide, Mrs. Roberta Dixon Vinson, and Vinson's aunt, Mrs. Belle Vinson Hughes.  Vinson is being sworn in as Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court.

title: President Truman with Annabel Cribb
Scopenote: Palmetto Peach Queen Annabel Cribb presents President Harry S. Truman with Golden Jubilee Peaches.

title: John Snyder speaking
Scopenote: John Snyder speaking, with President Harry S. Truman in the background.  Snyder had just been sworn in as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Fred Vinson shaking hands with John Snyder
Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred Vinson shaking hands with John Snyder, with President Harry S. Truman in the background.  Snyder had just been sworn in as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: President Truman signs bankruptcy legislation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs a bill amending an act regarding bankruptcy laws in the Oval Office of the White House.  Among those standing behind President Truman are Senator James Huffman (fifth from the right) and Representative Martin Gorski (right).  Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman signs the draft bill
Scopenote: (left to right) Brigadier General Carlton S. Dargusch, Major General Lewis B. Hershey, Colonel Louis Renfrow watch as President Harry S. Truman signs the draft bill.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Philippine Immigration Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs a bill regarding immigration and naturalization for Filipinos and East Indians in the Oval Office of the White House.  Standing behind President Truman are (left to right): Representative John Lesinski of Michigan; Antonio Gonzalez, President of the Philippine Inter Community of the Western States; J. C. Dionisio; Joseph R. Farrington, Delegate from Hawaii; Representative Emanuel Celler from New York; M. O. A. Baig, First Secretary of the Indian Agency General; J. J. Singh, President, India League of America; Dr. Anup Singh, Secretary, National Committee for India's Freedom; and Leonides S. Virata, Executive Officer, Resident Commissioner for the Philippines.  Same as photo 66-3360.

title: President Truman Greets Greek Army Officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) greets Greek Army Chief of Staff General Alexander Papagos (right), Greek Charge D'Affaires Paul Economou-Gouras (left), and one unidentified man at the White House.

title: President Truman with Generals Spaatz and Eaker
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sets the date for the Army Air Forces' 39th Anniversary.  Also pictured are General Carl Spaatz and Lt. General Ira C. Eaker.

title: President Truman greets James Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Secretary of State James F. Byrnes.  A small number of unidentified photographers are visible in the background.

title: President Truman signs British Loan Agreement
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs the British Loan Agreement in the presence of the Rt. Honorable Lord Inverchapel, British Ambassador to the United States and several others.  From left to right:  unidentified, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Lord Inverchapel, Sam Rayburn, and unidentified (with Truman in the foreground).

title: President Truman with Jewish veterans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, center) with representatives from the Jewish War Veterans group on the steps of the White House.  Others in the photo are not identified.

title: Harry S. Truman and Wilson H. Makabe
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is pictured shaking hands with Wilson H. Makabe, who was wounded in World War II. The photo was taken on the White House Lawn during the review of the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, the Nisei (Japanese-American) regiment.

title: President Truman discusses Food Program with youths
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with a young unidentified woman.  President Truman is meeting with the Youth Food Conference called by the Famine Emergency Committee.

title: President Truman with Senators
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown with two Democratic Senators.  From left to right:  Senator Joseph F. Guffey, President Truman, Senator Francis J. Myers, and John Stanley Rice, Democratic Nominee for Governor of Pennsylvania.

title: President Truman shakes hands with British ambassador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with the British Ambassador, Lord Inverchapel.  An unidentified man is also present.

title: President Truman receiving Red Feather
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving the first Red Feather from children representing Community Chest.  From left to right: Bessie Ann Mason; Danny Stallings; President Truman; Sigrid Stengel; Irvin Rallings.

title: Matthew Connelly receives 50-pound cherry pie
Scopenote: Presidential Secretary Matthew Connelly receives a fifty pound cherry pie for President Harry S. Truman. The pie was presented by Adah Allen as a gift from a cherry grower's association.

title: President Truman signs bills with legislators
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs Flood Control and Navigation Bills.  With him are(standing, from left to right):  Senator Hugh B. Mitchell, Representative John E. Rankin, and Senator Warren G. Magnuson.

title: President Truman Signs Revised OPA Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) holds up the OPA price control bill at his desk.  Paul Porter (left) and a group of unidentified OPA Regional Directors are also present.

title: President Truman receives painting
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives an oil painting from Jonkheer O. Reuchlin (right), Counselor of the Netherlands Embassy in Washington, and Herbert Creamer (left), President of the Netherlands American Institute.  The painting, "At the beach of Scheveningen" was painted by Hendrik Willem Mesdag.

title: President Truman speaks to crowd at airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks to a large crowd at the airport as Secretary of State James Byrnes leaves for 21-power Peace Conference in Paris.  Senator Tom Connally (left) James Byrnes (right) are also on the platform.

title: President Truman with Byrnes, Vinson, and Rayburn
Scopenote: From left to right, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, President Harry S. Truman, and Secretary of State James Byrnes.  They are escorting Secretary Byrnes to the airport to leave for the Paris Peace Conference.

title: James Byrnes waves to crowd from airplane
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes waves to crowd as he boards plane to Paris.  Byrnes was leaving to attend 21-power Peace Conference.

title: President Truman signs Silver Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs H.R. 4590, the Silver Bill.  Standing behind President Truman, from left to right: Senator Ernest McFarland; Senator Edwin Johnson; Senator Abe Murdock; Senator Elbert Thomas; Senator Eugene Millikin; Senator Patrick McCarran.

title: President Harry S. Truman and staff on board the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Left to right: Charles Ross, Press Secretary; Harry Vaughan, Military Aid to the President; Ted Marks; Clark Clifford, White House Counsel; President Harry S. Truman; John Snyder, Secretary of Treasury; George Allen, Director, Reconstruction Finance Corporation;  Wallace Graham, White House Physician; and Naval Aide James Foskett, on board the U.S.S. Williamsburg.  This photo was taken while President Truman took a vacation cruise to Bermuda.  Same as 96-31.

title: President Truman signs Surplus Property Act
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the Surplus Property Act in the Oval Office of the White House.  Standing behind President Truman are Senator J. William Fulbright (left) and Assistant Secretary of State William Benton (right).

title: President Truman signs atomic energy bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs an act regarding the control and development of atomic energy.  Standing behind President Truman, from left to right: Senator Tom Connally, Senator Eugene Millikin, Senator Edwin Johnson, Senator Thomas Hart, Senator Brien McMahon, Senator Warren Austin, and Senator Richard Russell.

title: President Truman signs Congressional Streamline Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs Congressional Streamline Bill.  Also present are (from left to right): Representative Everett M. Dirksen, Representative A. S. Mike Monroney, Senator Robert M. La Follette, Jr., Representative E. E. Cox, and Senator Richard B. Russell.

title: President and Mrs. Truman boarding plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman boarding an airplane from Washington D.C. en route to Missouri.  This photo was given to White House staff as Christmas present.  See photo 70-5718 for an autographed version of this photo.

title: President Truman with Representative Edith Rogers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) signs Terminal Leave Bill while Representative Edith Nourse Rogers looks on.

title: President Truman signs Health Legislation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs legislation providing for health programs for government employees.  Standing behind Truman are (left to right): Dr. Thomas Parran, Surgeon General, Public Health Service; Harry B. Mitchell, President, Civil Service Commission; and Watson Miller, Administrator, Federal Security Administration.

title: President Truman signs G.I. Furlough Pay Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) hands a pen to General Omar N. Bradley after signing the G.I. Furlough Pay Bill.  A crowd of unidentified men is in the background.

title: President Truman with Council of Economic Advisors
Scopenote: President Truman meets with members of the Council of Economic Advisors.  From left to right:  Leon H. Keyserling, Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, John Davidson Clark, President Harry S. Truman, and Judge Bennett Champ Clark.

title: President Truman Addresses American Legion Youth Forum
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets a large crowd of the American Legion Boys Nation delegates at the White House.

title: President Truman Signs Air Mail Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs legislation regarding the rate of postage of domestic air mail, with Postmaster General Robert Hannegan looking on.  A group of unidentified men stand behind them.

title: President Truman on a walk in Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and secret service agent James Rowley (right) walk past the General William Tecumseh Sherman Monument equestrian statue during their walk in the President's Park in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman walking near Washington Monument (back to camera)
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) walking with secret service agent James Rowley near the Washington Monument in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman on a walk in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and secret service agent James Rowley (center) walk past a man with a broom on a sidewalk in Washington D.C. A woman looks over her shoulder at the President in the background.

title: President Truman on a walk in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and secret service agent James Rowley (center) on a walk in Washington, D.C. They are walking past a man holding a broom. A small crowd of onlookers has gathered in the background, watching the President walk down the street.

title: President Truman on a walk
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and secret service agent James Rowley (right) walking past a newsstand in Washington, D. C.

title: President Truman on a walk in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and secret service agent James Rowley on a walk in Washington D.C.

title: President Truman and secret service agent walking
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and secret service agent James Rowley walking in Washington, D.C.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walking Near White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) walking with Secret Service agent James Rowley from the White House grounds in Washington, D.C.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walking Near White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secret Service agent James Rowley walking towards the White House.

title: President Truman on walk
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secret Service agent James Rowley (left) walking towards the Washington Monument. Their backs are to the camera.

title: President Truman receiving football pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receives a gold season pass to the games of the All American Football Conference.  The man on the right is possibly James H. Crowley, commissioner of the Conference.

title: President Truman leaving on cruise
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves for a cruise with some of his friends and staff.  From left to right:  Ted Marks, President Harry S. Truman, Matthew Connelly, Harry Vaughan, and Charlie Ross.

title: President Truman with group on White House steps
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, third from the left) meets with a group of Democratic Congressional candidates on the White House steps.  The woman in the back row is possibly India Edwards, Executive Secretary of the Democratic National Committee.

title: President Truman receives gift from Bikini Atoll natives
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives gift from natives of the Bikini Atoll. From left to right: Senator Carl A. Hatch, President Truman, Vice Admiral William H. P. Blandy, and Major General W.E. Kepner.

title: President Truman with Democratic Candidates
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, sixth from the left) stands in the Rose Garden at the White House with thirty unidentified Democratic Congressional candidates from Indiana, Massachusetts, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: President Truman Meets with Delegation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with a delegation representing the National Emergency Committee Against Mob Violence. From left to right: Leslie Perry, Washington D. C. representative of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People; Boris Shishkin, of the American Federation of Labor; Frederick E. Reissig, of the Federal Council of Churches of Christ in America; President Truman; Walter White, Secretary, NAACP; James Carey, Secretary, Congress of Industrial Organizations; and Dr. Channing Tobias.

title: President Truman and the Archbishop of Canterbury
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with the Most Reverend Geoffrey Francis Fisher, Archbishop of Canterbury, at the White House.

title: President Truman and Drucie Snyder
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Drucie Snyder watch the President's Cup Regatta.

title: President Truman and Drucie Snyder
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Drucie Snyder view the President's Regatta.

title: President Truman and Drucie Snyder
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Drucie Snyder view the President's Regatta.

title: President Truman with 1946 Democratic candidates
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) with three unidentified 1946 Democratic Candidates from Missouri at the White House. More unidentified men are visible in the background.

title: President Truman with Robert Hannegan and Richard Nacy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with Robert Hannegan, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, and Richard Nacy.  An unidentified man is in the background.

title: President Truman with 1946 Democratic Candidates
