title: Truman and Cabinet going to State of the Union Address
Scopenote: From left to right: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach. President Truman is preparing to go to Congress to make his annual State of the Union speech.

title: President Truman with Cabinet and Family Leaving the Capitol
Scopenote: From left to right, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, and Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach. They are leaving for the Capitol for President Truman to make his State of the Union speech to Congress.  The photo is autographed by each person in the photo.

title: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivering his State of the Union message to Congress.  President Pro Tempore of the Senate Arthur Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph Martin (right) are in the background.

title: President Truman with members of the Committee on Civil Rights
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the right) with members of the Committee on Civil Rights.  In the back row on the right is Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: Harry S. Truman with the Special Committee on Civil Rights
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman with the Special Committee on Civil Rights. They are posing in the oval office. L to R: Right Rev. Henry Knox Sherrill, presiding bishop of the Episcopal Church; Channing Tobias, of New York City, Director of Phelps-Stokes Fund; Richard Potter, a guest not on the committee; Rabbi Roland G. Gittlesohn, Rockville Center, New York; Francis P. Matthews, Omaha, Nebraska; Morris Ernst, New York City; John S. Dickey (rear), President of Dartmouth College; James B. Carey, Secretary-Treasurer of the C.I.O.; Dr. Sadie Alexander, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; C. E. Wilson, President of General Electric; President Harry S. Truman; Most Rev. Francis J. Haas, Bishop of Grand Rapids, Michigan; Mrs. M. E. Tilly, Atlanta, Georgia; Boris Shishkin, Alexandria, Virginia; Dr. Frank P. Graham, President, University of North Carolina; Charles Luckman, Cambridge, Massachusetts; and Attorney General Tom Clark, not a committee member. (Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jr., a member of the committee, was not present when the photograph was made.) Same as 68-1723, but better print. Donor: Dorothy Girton

title: President Harry S. Truman and Members of the National Defense Research Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Dr. Vannevar Bush and members of the National Defense Research Committee. Seated are Dr. James Conant, President of Harvard University; President Truman; and Dr. Alfred N. Richards, Head of Office of Scientific Research and Development.  Standing are Dr. Karl T. Compton, President of MIT; Dr. Lewis H. Weed, National Academy of Sciences; Dr. Vannevar Bush, Director, Office of Scientific Research and Development; Dr. Frank B. Jewett, New York; Dr. J. C. Hunsaker, MIT; Dr. Roger Adams, University of Illinois; Dr. A. Baird Hastings, Harvard Medical School; and Dr. A. R. Dochez, Columbia University.

title: James Byrnes shakes hands with George Marshall
Scopenote: James Byrnes (right) congratulating George Marshall (left) upon his swearing in as Secretary of State.  President Harry S. Truman stands between them, with Admiral William Leahy (left) and Attorney General Tom Clark (right) in the background.

title: George C. Marshall shaking hands with Tom Connally
Scopenote: George C. Marshall (center) shaking hands with Senator Tom Connally.  Senator Arthur Vandenberg (left), President Harry S. Truman and James Byrnes are in the foreground.  Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder is in the background between President Truman and James Byrnes.

title: George Marshall taking the oath of office as Secretary of State, with guests
Scopenote: George Marshall taking the oath of office with, pictured from left, Arthur H. Vandenberg, Admiral William D. Leahy, Rear Admiral James H. Foskett, General Harry H. Vaughan, John W. Snyder, Tom C. Clark, George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, General Walter Bedell Smith, Clinton P. Anderson, Fred M. Vinson, Julius A. Krug, James F. Byrnes, and Lewis B. Schwellenbach.  Autographed by all present.

title: George C. Marshall takes the oath of office
Scopenote: George C. Marshall takes the oath of office to become Secretary of State from Chief Justice Fred Vinson in the foreground.  In the background:  President Harry S. Truman, General Walter Bedell Smith, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and James Byrnes.

title: George C. Marshall takes the oath of office
Scopenote: George C. Marshall takes the oath of office to become Secretary of State.  In the foreground is (left to right) George C. Marshall and Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson.  In the background, from left to right:  Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom Clark, President Harry S. Truman, General Walter Bedell Smith, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, unidentified photographer, James Byrnes, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.

title: President Truman at his Desk With Others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at his desk.  Standing behind President Truman, from left to right: Attorney General Tom Clark, General Walter Bedell Smith, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, James Byrnes, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.  They are in President Truman's office for the swearing in of George Marshall as Secretary of State.

title: President Truman receives press photographers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receives press photographers from various cities across the nation.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Medal of Honor to Commander Richard Antrim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) awards the Medal of Honor to Commander Richard N. Antrim in a ceremony in the Oval Office at the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Max Gardner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and O. Max Gardner. Gardner is departing for London, England, as the new United States Ambassador.

title: President Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet.  From L to R: Secretary of Agriculture, Clinton P. Anderson; Secretary of Labor, Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Commerce, W. Averell Harriman; Secretary of Interior, Julius Krug; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War, Robert Patterson; Secretary of State, George C. Marshall; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury, John W. Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Secretary of the Navy, James Forrestal.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Governor General Alexander
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, shaking hands with Governor General of Canada Harold Alexander.  First Lady Bess Wallace Truman is standing next to the President.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with Governor General Alexander
Scopenote: From left to right, Harry Vaughan, President Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace Truman, and the Governor General of Canada, Harold Alexander.

title: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with a woman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Lady Margaret Alexander, wife of the Governor General of Canada.  Standing next to President Truman is First Lady Bess Wallace Truman.  On the left, behind President Truman are Harry Vaughan (second from the left), Secretary of State George Marshall (third from the left), and others.

title: President Truman and Vic Housholder
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) with Victor H. Housholder.

title: President and Mrs. Truman honored by the Congressional Club
Scopenote: (From left to right) President Harry S. Truman watches as Mrs. Clifford Davis pins a corsage on First Lady Bess Wallace Truman.  The Trumans are being honored by the Congressional Club.  An unidentified member of the Congressional Club stands next to Mrs. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman receiving a certificate from Broadway stars
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is presented a certificate by Broadway stars Richard Tyler and Joyce Van Patten. The certificate represents a grove of trees planted in President Truman's name in the Children's Memorial Forest in Palestine.

title: President Truman and Archbishop of the Greek Orthodox Church
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) blessed by the Most Reverend Archbishop Athenagoras of the Greek Orthodox Church.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Archbishop Athenagoras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Archbishop Athenagoras of the Greek Orthodox Church.

title: John Snyder and Albert K. Chow
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (extreme left) and Albert K. Chow examining "The Young China Newspaper."

title: President Harry S. Truman with Brigadier General Donald B. Adams and General E.A. Evans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receives an object from members of the Reserve Officers Association. From left to right: Brigadier  General E. A. Evans, Executive Director of the Association; President Truman; and Brigadier General Donald B. Adams, President of the Reserve Officers Association.

title: President Truman at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), Major General U. S. Grant III and Col. Lawrence C. Crawford pay tribute to the memory of Lincoln at the Lincoln Memorial.

title: Charles Ross displays "The Peacemakers" by George P.A. Healy
Scopenote: President Truman's press secretary, Charles Ross (fifth from the left), displays "The Peacemakers" by George P. A. Healy, depicting Lincoln's meeting with General Grant, General Sherman, and Admiral Porter.

title: Truman talking with 4-H club champion
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) talking to 4-H club champion Laverne Hall,(center), 20, from Westby, Wisconsin.  On the right is Rep. William H. Stevenson, from LaCrosse, Wisconsin who said that Hall has earned over $52,000 in nine years on the farm.  Similar to 68-1274 and 59-1256.

title: Truman and President-Elect of Uruguay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) with Tomas Berreta (seated, right), the President-Elect of Uruguay.  Standing (left to right) are Spruille Braden, the Assistant Secretary of State, and Dr. Juan Carlos Blanco, the Ambassador of Uruguay.  Similar to 66-2565.

title: Truman with 4-H club champion and William Stevenson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with 4-H Club All-Around Champion Laverne Hall (center) and Rep. William S. Stevenson from Wisconsin (right).  Similar to 68-1284 and 59-1372.

title: Margaret Truman celebrates 23rd Birthday
Scopenote: Margaret Truman celebrated her 23rd birthday by attending a performance of H.M.S. Pinafore, starring John Charles Thomas at Constitution Hall.  From left to right are Jane Lingo, Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and Bess Wallace Truman.

title: Actors portraying President Roosevelt and Vannevar Bush
Scopenote: Actor Godfrey Tearle (seated, portraying President Franklin D. Roosevelt) greets actor Jonathan Hale (portraying Dr. Vannevar Bush.)  This is a production still from the movie "The Beginning or the End", about the development of the atomic bomb and its use on Hiroshima.

title: President Truman conferring the Order of the Legion of Merit Degree on Prince Amir Saud
Scopenote: President Truman conferring the Order of the Legion of Merit Degree of Commander, on eldest son of King of Ibn Saud, Prince Amir Saud, of Saudi Arabia.

title: President Truman and Prince Saud
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Prince Amir Saud of Saudi Arabia.

title: Truman with Subversive Activities Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with members of the Subversive Activities Committee, also known as the President's Temporary Commission on Employee Loyalty. They are presenting their report. Seated from left to right are Under Secretary of War Kenneth Royall, President Truman, and Special Assistant to the Attorney General A. Devitt Vanech.  Standing, left to right are Civil Service Commission President Harry B. Mitchell, Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, Acting Assistant Secretary of State for Administration John E. Peurifoy, and Assistant Secretary of the Treasury Edward H. Foley, Jr.

title: Truman Placing a Wreath at George Washington's Tomb
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman placing a wreath at George Washington's tomb at Mount Vernon.

title: Truman with members of United Jewish Appeal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with delegation of leaders of the United Jewish Appeal.  In center, standing next to Mrs. David Levy, is President Truman; standing next to Mrs. Levy on the left is Herbert H. Lehman; standing next to President Truman on the right is former Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Jr.

title: Truman with dignitaries of United Jewish Appeal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with delegation of leaders of the United Jewish Appeal.  From left to right: Herbert H. Lehman, Mrs. David M. Levy, President Truman, and former Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Jr.  Similar to 66-1793 and 66-1794.

title: President Truman congratulates the Greenland Rescue crew

title: President Truman receiving degree from Baylor University

title: President Truman with Senator Connally
Scopenote: From left to right, Senator Tom Connally, General Harry Vaughan (background), President Harry S. Truman, and William Hassett.  They are arriving back in Washington, D. C. from Waco, Texas, where President Truman received an honorary degree from Baylor University.

title: President Truman addresses Congress, the Truman Doctrine speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses a joint session of Congress regarding monetary aid and military advisors for Greece and Turkey.  Behind him (left to right) is President Pro-tempore of the Senate Arthur H. Vandenberg and Representative Joseph W. Martin, Jr. can be seen.

title: President Truman in car in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida on vacation.

title: Truman with military in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) riding in the back of a car with Captain Henry Cooper (Commanding Officer of the Key West Naval Air Station), and Admiral William D. Leahy (right).  President Truman is in Key West, Florida on vacation.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Senator Vandenberg after Truman Doctrine speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, back turned to camera) shaking hands with President Pro Tempore of the Senate Arthur Vandenberg after addressing Congress. Speaker of the House Joseph Martin to the right.  President Truman addressed Congress regarding sending aid to Greece and Turkey.

title: President Truman delivers Truman Doctrine speech before Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing a joint session of Congress asking for $400 million in aid to Greece and Turkey.  This speech became known as the "Truman Doctrine" speech.

title: President Harry S. Truman addressing a Joint Session of Congress, the Truman Doctrine speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing a Joint Session of the 80th Congress, requesting aid for Greece and Turkey (Truman Doctrine).  On the front row, lower right foreground, from left to right are Cabinet Secretaries John Snyder, Dean Acheson, Robert Patterson, Tom Clark, James Forrestal, Clinton Anderson, W. Averell Harriman, and Lewis Schwellenbach.

title: Truman giving Truman Doctrine address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing a joint session of Congress asking for $400 million in aid to Greece and Turkey.  This speech became known as the "Truman Doctrine" speech.
