Also pictured is the President of the United States, President Harry S. Truman (center).

title: Visit of President Aleman to Washington
Scopenote: President Miguel Aleman of Mexico (standing far left in limousine) with President Harry S. Truman (standing in limousine, right) in Washington, D. C.

title: Parade for President Aleman
Scopenote: Welcoming parade for Mexican President Miguel Aleman displaying the Mexican flag in the background.

title: President Truman with press and Highway Safety Conference members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with the managers of the State Press and Publishers Associations, who are working with the President's Conference on Highway Safety.  Front row, left to right: Thomas H. MacDonald, Chairman, Coordinating Committee, President's Highway Safety Conference; President Truman; Major General Philip B. Fleming, General Chairman, President's Highway Safety Conference.  The rest of the men are unidentified.

title: President Truman with One More Club Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman celebrates his 63rd birthday with a cake from the "One More Club".

title: Harry S. Truman and the Vice President of the Philippines
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcomes Vice President of the Philippines, Elpidio Quirino. Left to Right: Ambassador to the Philippines Paul V. McNutt, Quirino, President Truman, and Joaquin M. Elizalde.  In the back row on the left is General Harry Vaughan.

title: The Snyders and Trumans on the White House Grounds
Scopenote: The Snyder family and Truman family standing on the White House grounds as President Harry S. Truman presents a Medal for Merit to Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. From left to right: Miss Drucie Snyder, Secretary of the Treasury Snyder, President Truman, Mrs. Evlyn Snyder, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman.

title: Bess W. Truman Receiving a Gift
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (second from the right) receives a native Philippine dress from Mrs. Helen Bennett-Pollicer (second from the left).  Also present are Miss Vicky Quirino (left), and Angela Valdez Ramos (right).

title: President Harry S. Truman with the President's Advisory Commission on Universal Training
Scopenote: Chairman Karl T. Compton (second from left) gives President Harry S. Truman (seated) the Report of the President's Advisory Commission on Universal Training at the White House as other members of the commission look on. L to R: (standing) The Rev. Edmund Walsh, Vice-President of Georgetown Univ. in Washington; Chairman Compton, President of Massachusetts Institute of Technology; Judge Samuel Rosenman, former special counsel to the President; Mrs. Anna Rosenberg, Industrial Relations Consultant; Truman K. Gibson, Jr., Lawyer; and Dr. Daniel Poling, editor of Christian Herald.

title: President Truman returns to Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) returns to Washington and is greeted by Secretary of State George C. Marshall (left) and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (center).

title: President Truman and Midshipmen
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is presented with a copy of the "Lucky Bag", the yearbook of the United States Naval Academy from two Naval Academy midshipmen. Midshipmen Herbert P. Benton and James R. Bjorge present President Truman with his copy.

title: Harry S. Truman with the Kiwanis International President
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with the Kiwanis International President, J. N. Emerson and Maple Harl, Chairman of Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

title: Harry S. Truman leaving for a 35th Division Reunion
Scopenote: From Left to Right: Admiral William D. Leahy, President Harry S. Truman and General Dwight D. Eisenhower as they prepare to leave for the 35th Division reunion being held in Kansas City, Missouri

title: President Truman in Battery D parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and unidentified men in the Battery D parade.  Occasion is the 35th Division Reunion in Kansas City, Missouri in 1947.  Same as 58-238.

title: Harry S. Truman attending a reunion of the 35th Division
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman attending a reunion of the 35th Division in Kansas City, Missouri.  Admiral William D. Leahy is to the left of President Truman, and French Ambassador Henri Bonnet is to the right of President Truman.    Original photograph is oversized.

title: President Truman Reviewing 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from right), and others, reviewing a 35th Division Parade in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Trumans on the rear of a train at Union Station in Washington
Scopenote: From left to right, Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman on the rear of a train at Union Station in Washington D.C. They are leaving for a three-day visit to Ottawa, Canada, where President Truman will address the Canadian lawmakers.

title: Harry S. Truman receives a bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a bust from the American Legion. Presenting the bust to President Truman is Paul H. Griffith (center), the National Commander of the American Legion and the sculptor Charles Keck (right).

title: President Truman and 4-H Member
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates 4-H Club's Achievement Girl, Miss Maurine Steyer. Left to Right: Representative Carl T. Curtis (Republican-Nebraska); President Truman; Miss Steyer; and F.S. Frisbee, head of the 4-H work in Nebraska.

title: President Truman at Highway Safety Conference
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (center) shaking hands with Major General Philip B. Fleming at the opening of the President's Second Highway Safety Conference at the Department of Interior.  The man on the left is unidentified.  Similar to 66-3022.

title: President Truman with war veteran
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Ercil Mabe, World War II veteran of Star, North Carolina, at the Garden Party for War Veterans on the White House grounds.  Standing next to President Truman is Rear Admiral James Foskett.

title: President Truman speaking on Taft-Hartley Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a radio address regarding his veto of the Taft-Hartley labor bill.

title: Truman unveiling Walter Johnson memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) at the unveiling of a memorial to Walter Johnson, a former pitcher for the Washington Senators.

title: Truman at Walter Johnson memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) at the unveiling of a memorial to Walter Johnson, a former pitcher for the Washington Senators.  The woman with President Truman is unidentified.

title: President Truman awards International Harmon Trophy
Scopenote: In ceremonies on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman awarded the International Harmon Trophy to Major Alexander P. De Seversky, aeronautical engineer. The Ligue Internationale des Aviateurs awarded the trophy to De Seversky for "outstanding leadership, patriotism, and unselfish devotion to the security and aeronautical progress of the United States." From left to right: Mrs. Evelyn De Seversky, Major Alexander De Seversky, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, and President Harry S. Truman.  See photo 58-753-1 and 58-753-2.

title: Harry S. Truman awards the Harmony International Trophy
Scopenote: In ceremonies on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman awarded the International Harmon Trophy to Major Alexander P. De Seversky, aeronautical engineer.  From left to right: Major Alexander De Seversky, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, and President Harry S. Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman accepting a gift from a child
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving a large firecracker with his initials on it, from 3 1/2 year old Michael Dene Condatore. E.F. Harloff, Publicity Chairman, America's Cavalcade of Freedom, 1947, accompanied the youngster.  They are presenting President Truman with a ticket to Washington, D. C.'s Fourth of July fireworks  display.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Alexander De Seversky
Scopenote: In ceremonies on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman awarded the International Harmon Trophy to Major Alexander P. De Seversky, aeronautical engineer. The Ligue Internationale des Aviateurs awarded the trophy to De Seversky for "outstanding leadership, patriotism, and unselfish devotion to the security and aeronautical progress of the United States." From left to right: Mrs. Evelyn De Seversky, Major Alexander De Seversky, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, and President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Theodore Roosevelt III
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Theodore Roosevelt III, Col. J. Callan O'Laughlin, Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, and Theodore Roosevelt IV at the White House. Mrs. Roosevelt, wife of the late General Theodore Roosevelt, Jr., presents special set of 32 poster stamps to President Truman, commemorating the career of General Roosevelt, Jr. Colonel O'Laughlin is the publisher of the Army and Navy Journal. Similar to 68-1263.

title: Harry S. Truman and representatives of the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking with members of the Newspapers, Motion Pictures, and Book Publishers. Left to Right: Front Row: Judge Justin Miller, National Association of Broadcasters; President Truman; Melville Minton, American Book Publishers Council. Second Row: Donald F. Nelson, Society of Independent Motion Picture Producers; William Chenery, Publisher, Colliers Magazine; Harry F. West, American Book Publishers Association. Third Row: Colonel J. Hale Steinman, American Newspaper Association; David Howe, American Newspaper Association. Fourth Row: Paul Miller, Associated Press; A.C. Willand, Jr., National Association of Broadcasters; Colonel Kenneth Clark, Motion Picture Association of America.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks to the Conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Scopenote: President Truman speaks from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial as he addresses the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.  Senator Wayne Morse is seated on the right in the first row.  Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt is seated second from the right on the first row, next to Senator Morse.

title: President Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party pushing an old car while on a trip to Charlottesville, Virginia. President Truman is on the left.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party pushing an old car while on a trip to Charlottesville, Virginia. President Truman is third from the right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party standing outdoors while on a trip to Charlottesville, Virginia.  President Truman is in the white suit in front of the tree.

title: President Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party standing around an old car while in Charlottesville, Virginia.  From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, General Wallace Graham, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and Clark Clifford.

title: Harry S. Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is walking, second from the left, while on a trip to Charlottesville, Virginia.

title: President Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party sitting outdoors while on a trip to Charlottesville, Virginia.

title: President Truman signs International Refugee Organization resolution
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs Senate Joint Resolution 77, "Providing for membership and participation by the United States in the International Refugee Organization." Standing behind President Truman are John H. Hilldring, Assistant Secretary of State; unidentified; and Goldthwaite Dorr, Office of the Secretary of State.

title: Harry S. Truman and the Red Cross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman examining architect's drawing of building plans for the District of Columbia Chapter of the Red Cross, after signing a bill authorizing funds for the construction of the building. Left to right: Mrs. Hazel Vandenberg, Mrs. David Finley, President Truman (seated), General U.S. Grant III, and J. Clifford Folger.  Same as photo 59-1375.

title: President Truman with Red Cross representatives
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman examining architect's drawing of building plans for the District of Columbia Chapter of the Red Cross, after signing a bill authorizing funds for the construction of the building. Left to right: Mrs. Hazel Vandenberg, Mrs. David Finley, President Truman (seated), General U.S. Grant III, and J. Clifford Folger.  Same as 59-1317.

title: President Truman and World War II Veterans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and World War II Veterans.  President Truman is holding an invitation to attend the National Convention of Disabled American Veterans in Las Vegas, Nevada.  Members of the group include: Senator Pat McCarran (third from the right); Congressman Charles H. Russell; Commander Lloyd Olson, Disabled American Veterans; Vivian Corbley, National Adjutant, Disabled American Veterans; Jack Walsh; John Sullivan, National Legislative Director of Disabled American Veterans; and John Henry Feller, Vice President for Public Relations, Disabled American Veterans.

title: Harry S. Truman and the Mayor of Santa Monica
Scopenote: The Mayor of Santa Monica, California, Mark T. Gates (left) presenting President Harry S. Truman (right) with a scroll from the Douglas Aircraft Co., Inc.  The scroll is commemorating construction of the presidential plane, the Independence. The scroll contains the signatures of those who built the plane.

title: President Truman on the White House steps
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the White House steps waving his cane.

title: President Truman being introduced by Frank Houston
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left side of the podium, in white suit) is shown being introduced by Frank K. Houston (behind the podium), President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. This photograph was taken at the Independence Day Celebration at Monticello. Others in the photo are unidentified.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: President Truman speaking at Monticello
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, home of Thomas Jefferson. Left to Right: Governor William M. Tuck, Virginia; Frank Houston, President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation; and President Truman.  Same as photo 59-1303-1 and 59-1313-1.

title: Truman holding a gavel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving a gavel from Frank Houston, President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation, after President Truman's speech at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, on Independence Day. Virginia Governor William M. Tuck pictured center. Same as 59-1314.

title: President Truman speaking to gathering, rear view
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, home of Thomas Jefferson.   Same as 59-1313-2.

title: President Truman speaking at Monticello
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia; home of Thomas Jefferson.

title: President Truman speaking at Monticello
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, home of Thomas Jefferson. Left to Right: Governor William M. Tuck, Virginia; Frank Houston, President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation; and President Truman.  Same as photo 59-1313-1 and 59-1387.

title: President Truman speaking at Monticello
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, home of Thomas Jefferson. Left to Right: Governor William M. Tuck, Virginia; Frank Houston, President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation; and President Truman.  Same as photo 59-1303-1 and 59-1387.

title: Harry S. Truman Receiving Gavel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving a gavel from Frank Houston, President of the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation, after President Truman's speech at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia, on Independence Day. Virginia Governor William M. Tuck pictured center. Same as 59-1388.

title: Harry S. Truman speaking at Monticello
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on Independence Day, at Monticello in Charlottesville, Virginia; home of Thomas Jefferson.

title: President Truman's trip to Charlottesville, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles broadly as he takes the wheel of his new convertible club coupe as he starts on a drive in the Charlottesville, Virginia area during a holiday weekend vacation.  With him are (from left to right, front seat) Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder; Stanley Woodward, State Department Protocol chief and President Truman's host; President Truman; (back seat, left to right) Rear Admiral James H. Foskett, Naval Aide; and Major General Harry H. Vaughan, military Aide.  Same as 68-1297.

title: President Truman with National Association of County Agriculture Agents
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) with representatives of the National Association of County Agriculture Agents.

title: President Truman with officials from Peru
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) holding a silver platter sent to him from Jose Luis Bustamante y Rivero, President of Peru; also pictured is Foreign Minister Dr. Enrique Garcia Sayan and others (unidentified).

title: President Truman with officials from Peru
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) holding a silver platter sent to him from Jose Luis Bustamante y Rivero, President of Peru; also pictured is Foreign Minister Dr. Enrique Garcia Sayan and others (unidentified).

title: Representatives shaking hands
Scopenote: Left to Right: Representative Charles Halleck, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin and Senator Sam Rayburn shaking hands after the passage of the Presidential Succession Bill.

title: President Truman signing a proclamation for Army Air Force Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing a proclamation making August 1st Army Air Force Day. L-R: General James H. Doolittle (seated), President of the Air Force Association; Lieutenant General Hoyt S. Vandenberg (standing), Deputy Commander Army Air Force; President Truman (seated); Major General Lauris Norstad (standing), Director of Plans and Operations, War Department, General Staff; W. Stuart Symington (seated), Assistant Secretary of War for Air.

title: President Truman signing proclamation for Army Air Force Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing a proclamation making August 1st Army Air Force Day. Left-Right: General Jimmy Doolittle (seated), President of the Air Force Association; Lieutenant General Hoyt S. Vandenberg (standing), Deputy Commander Army Air Force; President Truman (seated); Major General Lauris Norstad (standing), Director of Plans and Operations, War Department, General Staff; Stuart Symington (seated), Assistant Secretary of War for Air.

title: President Truman signing Army - Air Force proclamation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing a proclamation making August 1st Army Air Force Day. L-R: General James H. Doolittle (seated), President of the Air Force Association; Lieutenant General Hoyt S. Vandenberg (standing), Deputy Commander Army Air Force; President Truman (seated); Major General Lauris Norstad (standing), Director of Plans and Operations, War Department, General Staff; W. Stuart Symington (seated), Assistant Secretary of War for Air.

title: President Truman and Edward Flanagan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) in his office, with Monsignor Edward Flanagan, founder of Boys' Town.  Same as 59-1292.  Similar to 99-398.

title: President Truman and Monsignor Flanagan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) in his office, with Monsignor Edward Flanagan, founder of Boys' Town. .  Same as 59-1309.  Similar to 99-398.

title: Truman and Mrs. Roosevelt accepting medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) standing next to Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt accepting France's Medaille Militaire, France's highest military medal, posthumously to President Franklin D. Roosevelt. The medal was presented by French ambassador Henri Bonnet. The medal was presented at the French Embassy.   Source, New York Times, 7-15-1947, p. 25.

title: President Truman with season pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) holding a season pass to the games of the Washington Redskins football team.  The pass was presented to President Truman by Bert Bell (center), President of the National Professional Football League and George Marshall (left), owner of the Washington Redskins.  Same as photo 77-3532 and 59-1333.

title: President Truman with season pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) holding a season pass to the games of the Washington Redskins football team.  The pass was presented to President Truman by Bert Bell (center), President of the National Professional Football League and George Marshall (left), owner of the Washington Redskins.  Same as photo 77-3532 and 59-1373.

title: President Truman with Prince Abdullah of Yemen
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meeting with Prince Abdullah of Yemen.  Similar to 66-1699.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Others with a Bushel of Peaches
Scopenote: From left to right: Congressman Pete Jarman, Senator Lister Hill, President Harry S. Truman and Senator John Sparkman.  They presented President Truman with a bushel basket of peaches from the Chilton County Peach Festival in Alabama.

title: President Truman Observes Paraplegic Veterans in the White House Bowling Alley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in light suit) watches Gerald A. Kopp (left) and Leo L. Ladouceur (right) as they bowl in the White House Bowling Alley. The men, along with Gordon W. Scott (center) are winners in the ten pin bowling competition sponsored by the Bowlers Victory Legion and held within the Veterans Administration Paraplegic Centers. In the background, third from the left, is Press Secretary Charles Ross.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Parole Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs H.R. 494, regarding parole of prisoners convicted in the District of Columbia.  Only two of the men standing behind Truman can be identified: Col. Campbell Johnson, Executive Assistant, Director of Selective Service (second from left); and Frank R. Jelleff, Chairman of the Parole Board (left).  Same as 59-1305.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Parole Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing H.R. 494, regarding parole of prisoners convicted in the District of Columbia.  Only two of the men standing behind Truman can be identified: Col. Campbell Johnson, Executive Assistant, Director of Selective Service (second from left); and Frank R. Jelleff, Chairman of the Parole Board (left).  Same as 59-1377.

title: President Truman Poses in the White House Bowling Alley with Paraplegic Veterans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in light suit) poses with a bowling ball with Gerald A. Kopp (seated in wheelchair, left), Gordon W. Scott (seated in wheelchair, center), and Leo L. Ladouceur (seated in wheelchair, right) in the White House Bowling Alley. The men are winners in the ten pin bowling competition sponsored by the Bowlers Victory Legion and held within the Veterans Administration Paraplegic Centers. In the background, second from right, is Press Secretary Charles Ross.

title: President Truman speaking with the Legislative Yuan Mission
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) speaking with the Legislative Yuan Mission.  Dr. V. K. Wellington Koo, Ambassador of China, is third from the right.

title: President Truman signing bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Congressman Francis E. Walter (left) and Ray Sawyer (right), National Commander of American Veterans of World War II.  President Truman signed the AMVETS of World War II bill, granting them a government charter.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Leslie Biffle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Gus Cook (center) and Leslie Biffle (right).

title: President Truman with Freshman Democrat Congressmen
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with the Freshman Democratic Congressmen.  From left to right: Charles B. Deane (North Carolina), Joe L. Evins (Tennessee), President Truman, Monroe M. Reddon (North Carolina), James C. Davis (Georgia).  Second row, left to right: Wingate Lucas(Texas), John F. Kennedy (Massachusetts), John Bell Williams (Mississippi), Laurie C. Battle (Alabama).  Third row, left to right: W.J. Bryan Dorn (South Carolina), Robert E. Jones (Alabama), John A. Blatnik (Minnesota). Fourth row, left to right: Omar Burleson (Texas), and Harold D. Donohue (Massachusetts).

title: President Truman presenting tray to Robert Patterson
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) with President Harry S. Truman (center). President Truman and General Eisenhower are presenting a silver tray and a scroll to retiring Secretary of War Robert Patterson (right).

title: Polish war orphan
Scopenote: Ala Pancewicz Pozan (girl in center of photo) with others.  She was a Polish war orphan visiting an unnamed Baptist orphan's home.  Other people in photo are unidentified.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: President Truman signing H.R. 3309 regarding Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is sitting at his desk signing the House Resolution 3309, "Act to amend the Organic Act of Puerto Rico."  Standing behind President Truman are Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from the right); the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero (second from the right); and the Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico, Dr. Antonio Fernos-Isern (right).

title: American Legion boys Photographing President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in white suit) getting his photograph taken by the American Legion Boys Forum members in the Rose Garden at the White House. Standing to the left of President Truman is "Boy President" of the Boys Forum, Chinese-American Edmond Gong.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Edmond Gong
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Edmond Gong, "Boy President" from the American Legion Boys Forum.

title: President Truman signing a document
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sitting behind a desk is signing document of, "Promotion and Elimination of Officers in the Army, Navy, and Marine Corp."  Standing, from left to right: Col. Joseph Knighton, Frank Schuyler, Commander D.L. Martineau, Captain S.S. Bowling, Rear Admiral Thomas L. Sprague, Brigadier General J.E. Dahlquist, Lieutenant Colonel G.E. Baya, Brigadier General J.E. Upston, and Colonel F.H. Miller.

title: President Truman greeting Marshall
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman greeting Secretary of State George C. Marshall, Senator Arthur Vandenberg, and Warren Austin just arriving from a plane.

title: President Truman greeting men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greeting George C. Marshall, Arthur Vandenberg, and Warren Austin just arriving from a plane.

title: Two men ready the Independence
Scopenote: Two unidentified men are boarding the airplane, "Independence".  The two men are handing each other an object as one stands on a ladder and the other half in the plane.

title: Men showing survival gear
Scopenote: Lt. Col. Henry T. Myers, the navigator Maj. T.J. Boselli, and the co-pilot, Maj. Elmer F. Smith are showing off the survival gear of the airplane, "Independence."

title: Men in front of the airplane, "Independence"
Scopenote: The airplane, "Independence" is in the background with its crew: pilot, Lt. Col. Henry T. Myers; the navigator, Maj. T.J. Boselli; and the co-pilot, Maj. Elmer F. Smith standing in front looking at a map.

title: Truman giving speech aboard U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing behind a podium on the U.S.S. Missouri addressing guests at Rio De Janeiro. Admiral William Leahy and General George Marshall are left of the microphones.

title: Executive Office being re-painted
Scopenote: The Executive Office in the White house is being re-painted by two men on the ground and one on top of scaffolding.

title: Truman addresses aggressors in Rio De Janeiro
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman preparing to address the Brazilian Congress in Rio De Janeiro.

title: President Truman on stairway
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is pictured standing on a stairway while on a trip to Rio De Janeiro.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: President Truman in Brazil
Scopenote: A photograph of Harry S. Truman while on a trip to Rio De Janeiro, Brazil.  This is an enlargement of 59-173-1.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: President Truman exercising
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) standing and bending over to lead a group of men in exercises.  All of them are wearing Truman Athletic Club T-shirts. President Truman is on the U.S.S Missouri returning from his visit to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Bedroom in the White House
Scopenote: A bedroom in the White House

title: President Truman waving his hat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is waving his hat as he returned to Washington today after a 20 day trip to Brazil. The Chief Executive was tanned and appeared rested as he stepped from the presidential yacht Williamsburg at the Washington Gun Factory.

title: Truman's second floor office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's office in the second floor oval room at the White House. Paintings of the Farnsworth portrait of Martha Ellen Truman and Mesdag's "At the Beach of Scheveningen" are hanging in the room.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman debark from U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Debarking from U.S.S. Missouri is Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (front). Behind Mrs. Truman is Commander Harold D. Fuller, and behind him is Margaret Truman. They are all coming home from a trip to Rio De Janeiro with President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman presenting a trophy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), is presenting the Yacht Club trophy cup. The Presidents cup Regatta Cup is being received by Danny Foster, the winner of the race.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents a Trophy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), is presenting the Yacht Club trophy cup. The President's Cup Regatta Cup is being received by Danny Foster, the winner of the race.

title: White House press correspondents
Scopenote: White House press correspondents are scrambling for copies of news release that followed a press conference with President Harry S. Truman concerning the formation of the Citizens Food Committee.

title: President Truman attending swearing in ceremony
Scopenote: From left to right President Harry S. Truman is watching Chief Justice D. Lawrence Groner give oaths of office to Arthur H. Hill, Sidney Souers, and Roscoe Hillenkoetter.  Mr. Hill is being sworn in as chairman of the National Security Resources Board. Mr. Souers is being sworn in as Executive Secretary of the National Security Council.  Mr. Hillenkoetter is being sworn in as head of the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: President Truman addressing the nation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing the nation over the radio for the annual Community Chest Drive.

title: President Truman with Herbert Hoover
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the right is leaning over towards former President Herbert Hoover on the left. This photo was taken during the first meeting of the Commission on the Organization of the Executive Branch of Government, also known as the Hoover Commission.

title: First Meeting of the Hoover Commission
Scopenote: This is the first meeting of the Commission on the Organization of the Executive Branch of Government, also known as the Hoover Commission. Standing, left to right: Representative Clarence J. Brown, James V. Forrestal, Arthur S. Flemming, James K. Pollock, Dean G. Acheson, James H. Rowe, and Representative Carter Manasco. Seated, from left to right: George Mead, former President Herbert Hoover, President Harry S. Truman, Joseph P. Kennedy, and Senator John F. McClellan.  Same as 58-337 but less cropped.

title: President Truman with Gold Star Mothers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Mrs. Mathilda Burling of Richmond Hills, New York, national President of American Gold Star Mothers of the World Wars, Inc.  Members of her organization called on the President today to pay their respects. The Gold Star Mothers are in Washington for a week's convention.

title: Committee on World Food Crisis with President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The Committee on World Food Crisis meeting with President Harry S. Truman.  Seated, left to right: Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, President Truman, and Charles Luckman, Chairman of the Citizens Food Committee.  Standing, left to right: Robert Lovett, Norris E. Dodd, and John Steelman.

title: Committee on World Food Crisis
Scopenote: The Committee on World Food Crisis meeting with President Harry S. Truman.  Seated, left to right: Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, President Truman, and Charles Luckman, Chairman of the Citizens Food Committee.  Standing, left to right: Robert Lovett, Norris E. Dodd, and John Steelman.

title: Truman with Gold Star Mothers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with representatives of the Gold Star Mothers of the World Wars.

title: Harry S. Truman and James O'Neill talking
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) talking with James O'Neill (right), National Commander of the American Legion. This is O'Neill's first meeting with the President since election as Legion Commander at the New York convention.

title: Truman receiving a purple heart viola
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is seen here receiving the first purple heart viola from Carol French (right), who is 3 years old.  This photo was taken to start the fund drive for the Washington, D. C. chapter of the Order of the Purple Heart.

title: President Truman addressing food committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing) addressing the special emergency citizens food conservation committee. Charles Luckman, Chairman of the committee, joins President Truman (right).

title: Truman addressing food committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) addressing the special emergency citizens food conservation committee. Charles Luckman, Chairman of the committee, joins President Truman (right).

title: Truman with Cabinet and Advisory Council
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is seen here with his Cabinet and Special Economic Advisory Council. L-R (seated): Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom Clark. L-R (standing): Leon Keyserling, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, John Steelman, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson,  Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, and General Philip Fleming.

title: Truman with Kon-Tiki expedition
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is receiving a flag from Kon-Tiki Raft expedition group. L-R: Thor Heyerdahl, Knut Haugland, Herman Watzinger, President Truman, Knut Lykke (Counsellor of Norwegian Embassy), Eric Hesselberg, and Torstein Raaby.

title: President Truman Taking a Picture
Scopenote: Close-up of President Harry S. Truman looking through a camera getting ready to take a picture. The President was given this camera by the White House News Photographers Association, and he is taking a photo of the White House press corps gathered on the South Lawn of the White House.

title: President Truman preparing for T.V
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Charles Luckman (right), Chairman of the Citizens Food Committee.  President Truman addressed the nation via television on the need to conserve food to send to Europe.  This marked the first time that television cameras entered the White House to televise an event.

title: Truman with press camera and news photographers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left), holding a press camera, surrounded by unidentified news photographers.

title: President Truman holding a camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), holding two cameras that are being presented to him by the White House Photographers.

title: Truman with press camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with press camera.

title: Truman with news photographers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left), holding a press camera, surrounded by unidentified news photographers.

title: President Truman Using Motion Picture Camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holding a motion picture camera with two hands and looking through the lens. Photographers are in the background. The president was given this movie camera as a gift by the White House Photographers Association and he used it to take movies of the members of the press on the South Lawn of the White House.

title: Truman with press camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holding a press camera, with unidentified people in the background.

title: Truman with news photographers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at left), holding a press camera, surrounded by several unidentified news photographers.

title: Archibald Roosevelt, President Truman and Mrs. Truman Before the Straus Memorial
Scopenote: L to R: Archibald Roosevelt, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman standing in front of the Oscar Straus Memorial Fountain.

title: Business, Labor and Farm Leaders
Scopenote: Various business, labor and farm leaders.  L-R: Charles G. Mortimer, General Foods; Charles Luckman, Citizens Food Committee; Eugene Meyer, World Bank; John Steelman, Assistant to the President; John J. McCloy, World Bank; Harry A. Bullis, General Mills; and Reese H. Taylor, Union Oil Company.

title: Truman receiving report on Civil Rights
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is receiving a report from the Committee on Civil Rights from Charles Wilson.  Standing, from left to right: Roland B. Gittelsohn, Mrs. Sadie T. Alexander, James B. Carey, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jr., Mrs. M.E. Tilley, Channing H. Tobias, Charles Wilson, Boris Shishkin, Charles Luckman, and Francis P. Matthews.

title: Harry S. Truman at a military funeral
Scopenote: In group in center of photograph, first row, left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State George Marshall, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, and three unidentified men. Behind President Truman are Admiral William Leahy and General Harry Vaughan. They are at a joint Interment Service for World War II deceased.

title: Photograph of framed official White House painting of Truman
Scopenote: Painting of President Harry S. Truman by Greta Kempton.

title: Truman tipping his hat
Scopenote: John Ben Sheppard (right) National President of the U. S. Junior Chambers of Commerce, presenting a ten gallon hat to President Harry S. Truman (left) from the Governor of Texas.

title: Truman with President's Committee on National Employment of the Physically Handicapped
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) met with the members of The President's Committee on National Employment of the Physically Handicapped to discuss the employment of physically handicapped throughout the year. Front row, left to right: Secretary of Labor, Lewis B. Schwellenbach; Secretary of the American Federation of the Physically Handicapped, Mildred Scott; Morris S. Frank of the Seeing Eye Dog, Incorporated, with his canine; President Truman; Vice Admiral Ross T. McIntire, Medical Corps U.S. Navy, Retired and Chairman of the President's Committee; and Executive Vice President of Air Transport Association, Robert Ramspeck.

title: Truman laying wreath
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is laying a wreath on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, in Arlington National Cemetery. Truman is surrounded by military officers and other unidentified people.

title: Truman laying wreath
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is laying a wreath on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, in Arlington National Cemetery. Truman is surrounded by military officers and other unidentified people.

title: Truman with University of Missouri student
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) in the White House Office with Franklin S. Riley, Jr., student editor of the University of Missouri newspaper, and Press Secretary Charles Ross, a former professor of journalism at the University of Missouri.

title: President Truman with Arthur M. Hill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Arthur M. Hill of the National Security Resources Board.

title: President Truman with the Federal Loyalty Board
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with new members of the Federal Loyalty Board. Pictured with President Truman (front row, seventh from the right) are Meta Glass (front row, eighth from the right); former Secretary of Labor Francis Perkins (front row, sixth from the right); Chairman Seth W. Richardson (front row, fifth from the right); Harry B. Mitchell (fourth from left); Charles Sawyer (second from left); and Attorney General Tom C. Clark (right).  Others in the group include Dean Harry A. Bigelow; Dr. Aaron J. Brumbaugh; John Kirkland Clark; Tom J. Davis; Dr. Burton L. French; Earl Harrison; Garrett Hoag; Wilbur LeRoe Jr.; Dr. Arthur Macmahon; Dr. Charles E. Merriman; Henry Parkman Jr.; Judge Albert M. Sames; Henry L. Shattuck; and Lawrence V. Melroy.  Same as 59-1393.

title: President Truman with the Federal Loyalty Board
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with new members of the Federal Loyalty Board. Pictured with President Truman (front row, seventh from the right) are Meta Glass (front row, eighth from the right); former Secretary of Labor Francis Perkins (front row, sixth from the right); Chairman Seth W. Richardson (front row, fifth from the right); Harry B. Mitchell (fourth from left); Charles Sawyer (second from left); and Attorney General Tom C. Clark (right).  Others in the group include Dean Harry A. Bigelow; Dr. Aaron J. Brumbaugh; John Kirkland Clark; Tom J. Davis; Dr. Burton L. French; Earl Harrison; Garrett Hoag; Wilbur LeRoe Jr.; Dr. Arthur Macmahon; Dr. Charles E. Merriman; Henry Parkman Jr.; Judge Albert M. Sames; Henry L. Shattuck; and Lawrence V. Melroy.  Same as 59-1420.

title: Korean School children with portrait of Truman
Scopenote: Grammar school children of Seoul, Korea, present a likeness of President Harry S. Truman to Major General William F. Dean for the President. Looking on are L-R: Benjamin B. Weems, Dement O. Cherrin, William Garner and General Dean. At right are children.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Fifth Annual Photo Exhibit Banquet, Harry S. Truman present
Scopenote: Fifth Annual Photo Exhibit Banquet, with Harry S. Truman attending, a dinner of the White House Photographers Association at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D. C.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) giving a speech to Congress. Behind President Truman, seated from left to right, is President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (Michigan) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin.  In his address to Congress President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman with Cabinet Members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman after his speech to a Joint Session of Congress, pictured with Mrs. Truman and select Cabinet members.  Left to right, front row: Secretary of State George Marshall, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, President Truman.  Back row, left to right: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Attorney General Tom Clark and Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) giving a speech to Congress. In his address to Congress, President Truman asked for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, standing) giving a speech to Congress. Behind President Truman, seated from left to right (far upper left corner), is President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (Michigan) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin.  In his address to Congress President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: President Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) giving a speech to Congress. Behind President Truman, seated from left to right, is President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (Michigan) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin. In his address to Congress President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (lower left-hand corner)shown leaving after his speech to Congress. In his address, President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) giving a speech to Congress.  Behind President Truman, standing from left to right, is President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (Michigan) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin.  In his address to Congress, President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back to viewer) shaking hands with President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin (right) after giving a speech to Congress. In his address to Congress, President Truman asked for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) giving a speech to Congress.  Behind President Truman, seated from left to right, is President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (Michigan) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin.  In his address to Congress, President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: A Joint Session of Congress to address price and wage controls
Scopenote: Chaplain of the House, Reverend James Shera Montgomery (right) is offering the opening prayer at the Joint Session of Congress.  House Speaker Joseph W. Martin Jr. pictured in background (right).

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back to viewer) shaking hands with President of the Senate Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin (right) after giving a speech to Congress. In his address to Congress, President Truman asked for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech to Congress. In his address to Congress, President Truman was asking for price and wage controls to reduce the high cost of living for Americans.

title: Harry S. Truman with Sam Rayburn and a Young Democrat Member
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (right) and Roy G. Baker, President of the Young Democrats.

title: President Truman and Sam Rayburn with officers of the Young Democrats
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shown in the oval office with Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (seated). Standing L to R are Young Democrats Mrs. Roy Baker, Roy Baker (President) and Mrs. Theodora Hansen (Vice President).

title: Harry S. Truman and J. Howard McGrath
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Senator J. Howard McGrath at a luncheon.

title: Harry S. Truman with George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) at the airport with Secretary of State George Marshall (right) before the Secretary left for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: Harry S. Truman with George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Secretary of State George Marshall (left) before the Secretary left for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: Harry S. Truman with George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Secretary of State George Marshall (left) before the Secretary left for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: President Truman with Averell Harriman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving his first sheet of Christmas seals of the 1947 Campaign from Averell Harriman, the Secretary of Commerce.

title: Harry S. Truman with Carl R. Gray
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) met with General Carl R. Gray (right), Administrator of Veterans Affairs, in the White House Office.

title: Harry S. Truman and the Disabled American Veterans Fund Campaign of 1947
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving a Forget-Me-Not from Leona "Ginger" Leonard (age 4) to start the Disabled American Veterans Fund Campaign of 1947.

title: President Truman receiving Pan American Society medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receiving scroll and medal from Thomas W. Palmer, President of the Pan American Society of the United States(left) and David E. Grant, Chairman of the insignia committee of the Society (center).  General Harry Vaughan in the background (far right).

title: Harry S. Truman visits the Freedom Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Tom Clark (left) and Fred Vinson (center) view the Gettysburg Address manuscript on the Freedom Train while it was stopped at Union Station in Washington, D. C. The Freedom Train was a seven-car rolling exhibit containing documents of American liberty next to documents of tyranny and despotism.

title: Margaret Truman in rehearsal
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (far left) rehearses for a concert. She is accompanied by flutist L. M. Knowland and pianist Mrs. Frederick C. Shaw.

title: Harry S. Truman at Georgetown University Hospital
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) unveils the Franklin Delano Roosevelt plaque at Georgetown University Hospital. The commemorative gift of $55,000 was given by the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) to equip the Children's wing of the Hospital's new building. Also pictured in foreground from left to right: Elliott Roosevelt, Philip Murray of the CIO, and the most Reverend Amleto Giovanni Cicognani, Apostolic Delegate to the U.S.  See also photo 59-1454.

title: Harry S. Truman being presented a certificate
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) being presented a certificate by a group from the National Association of Retail Clothiers and Furnishers.

title: Harry S. Truman at Georgetown University Hospital
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) unveils the Franklin Delano Roosevelt plaque at Georgetown University Hospital. The commemorative gift of $55,000 was given by the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) to equip the Children's wing of the Hospital's new building. Also pictured in foreground from left to right: Elliott Roosevelt, Philip Murray of the CIO, and the most Reverend Amleto Giovanni Cicognani, Apostolic Delegate to the U.S.  See also photo 59-1429.

title: Harry S. Truman with J. Howard McGrath
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Senator J. Howard McGrath in the White House office.  See also 58-765 and 77-301.

title: Harry S. Truman boarding the Presidential Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Harry Vaughan (at the top of the stairs) boarding the Presidential plane for a vacation to Key West, Florida.  Same as 77-301.

title: Harry S. Truman boarding the Presidential Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front left) boarding the Presidential Plane with General Harry Vaughan (back right) and an unidentified man, while an unidentified soldier stands guard. President Truman was headed to Key West and a brief Florida vacation.

title: Small girl with autograph from Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Small girl in traction with autograph of President Truman: "To Sharon Meenehan. Here's that present you thought you were getting yesterday. Get well in a hurry, Best Wishes to you. Harry S. Truman. The White House Dec. 2, 1947." Sharon was in an auto accident and was visited by President Truman at Georgetown Hospital.

title: Small girl with autograph from Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Sharon Meenehan signs a thank you note with the help of Dr. Vincent Murphy thanking President Harry S. Truman for the birthday gift of a Mother Goose Book. The note says "Dec. 4. Dear Mr. President, I like the Mother Goose book. Thank you for it and visiting me. Love Sharon xx." Sharon was in an auto accident and was visited by President Truman at Georgetown Hospital.

title: President Truman aboard ship
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in white suit) receiving a scroll and other items from the officers and crew of the submarine U-2513, proclaiming him a qualified submariner.  President Truman and other members of his party visited the submarine while on vacation in Key West, Florida.  Standing behind President Truman on the left is Admiral William Leahy.  Also in the photo is Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross (last row, in dark suit, next to naval officer) and Charles Steelman (next to Mr. Ross).  All others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Truman at a ship ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in white suit) receiving a scroll and other items from the officers and crew of the submarine U-2513, proclaiming him a qualified submariner.  President Truman and other members of his party visited the submarine while on vacation in Key West, Florida.  Standing behind President Truman on the left is Admiral William Leahy.  Also in the photo is Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross (last row, in dark suit, next to naval officer) and Charles Steelman (next to Mr. Ross).  All others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Submarine Tie Clasp
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman showing off his new submarine tie clasp.  The officers and crew of the submarine U-2513 presented the clasp to President Truman when he visited them while on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: Harry S. Truman with a movie camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with a movie camera.  Similar to 66-634 and 66-635.

title: Harry S. Truman at a ship ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the submarine U-2513, after receiving a plaque certifying him as a qualified submariner. This event occurred while President Truman was on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: Harry S. Truman at a ship ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in white suit) receiving a scroll and other items from the officers and crew of the submarine U-2513, proclaiming him a qualified submariner.  President Truman and other members of his party visited the submarine while on vacation in Key West, Florida.  Standing behind President Truman on the left is Admiral William Leahy.  Also in the photo is Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross (last row, in dark suit, next to naval officer) and Charles Steelman (next to Mr. Ross).  All others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Truman presented a Seminole shirt with a group of Seminole Indians and dignitaries looking on
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, third from the right) admires the shirt given to him by Seminole Chief William McKinley Osceola at the dedication of the Everglades National Park in Florida. Admiral William Leahy (second from the right)and others are looking on.

title: Harry S. Truman returning from Florida
Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman after returning from Florida.

title: Harry S. Truman returns from Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) returned to Washington after a vacation in Florida.  Left to right with the President: Defense Secretary James Forrestal; Attorney General Tom Clark; President Truman; and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.

title: President Truman presents Collier Trophy to Lewis A. Rodert
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents the Collier Trophy to Lewis A. Rodert (right).

title: President Truman welcomes George Marshall on return from London Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcomes Secretary of State George Marshall on return from London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: President Truman welcomes George Marshall on return from London
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) welcomes Secretary of State George Marshall (right) on return from London after Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: President Truman and Cabinet members welcome George Marshall on return from London Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcomes Secretary of State George Marshall on return from London Conference of Foreign Ministers. L to R: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, President Truman, Attorney General Tom Clark, and Secretary Marshall.

title: Harry S. Truman shaking hands with men who flew around the world
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with two cub fliers who flew around the world.  From left to right, Clifford Evans, Jr., President Truman, and George Truman.

title: President Truman and other Cabinet officers welcome George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcomes Secretary of State George Marshall on return from London Conference of Foreign Ministers. L to R: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson (mostly obscured by President Truman), President Truman, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary Marshall, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of  Commerce Averell Harriman.

title: Bess W. Truman and children at Christmas
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (seated) and others giving Christmas presents to children at the children's emergency home of the Central Union Mission, Washington, D.C.

title: Mr. and Mrs. John Snyder congratulating Margaret Truman on her concert
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (left) and Mrs. Evlyn Snyder (2nd from left) congratulating Margaret Truman (right) on her concert at Washington's Constitution Hall.

title: President Truman receiving 30 lb. dressed turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving 30-pound dressed turkey, winner of the Oregon annual poultry show, from Senator Wayne Morse (right).

title: Christmas tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House
Scopenote: Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House.  Seated in the front row is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (second from the right).

title: Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House
Scopenote: Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House.

title: President Truman shakes hands with members of the military at Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with members of the military at the Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House.

title: Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony on the south lawn of the White House
Scopenote: Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony on the south lawn of the White House.  The Washington Monument is in the background.  Seated on the front row are Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman (left) and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson (third from the left).

title: Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House
Scopenote: Christmas Tree Lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House.

title: President Truman lights the Christmas tree at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) lights the Christmas tree at the lighting ceremony on the south lawn of the White House, while daughter Margaret Truman (right) looks on.

title: Harry S. Truman's dog Feller
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's cocker spaniel dog "Feller" laying outside his shipping crate.

title: The Puppy Feller
Scopenote: This picture was taken when President Harry S. Truman's dog, Feller, arrived at the White House on Christmas Day. He was a gift. The Trumans later gave the dog to Dr. Wallace Graham, their personal physician.

title: Harvard Ellwood Dudley, Jr
Scopenote: A birthday celebration for Harvard Ellwood Dudley, Jr.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the campaign trail in 1948, on train with unidentified men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the campaign trail in 1948, on train with unidentified men.

title: Portrait of Oscar L. Chapman
Scopenote: Portrait of Oscar L. Chapman, Under Secretary of the Interior and later Secretary of the Interior.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Portrait of Clark Clifford
Scopenote: Photograph of Clark Clifford, Special Counsel to the President.

title: Portrait of Frederick Lawton
Scopenote: Frederick J. Lawton, Administrative Assistant to the President, and later Executive Director, Bureau of the Budget.

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz entering car
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz entering car.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Leo Creo
Scopenote: Snapshot of Leo Creo.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Meeting at Truman-Barkley campaign headquarters in Missouri
Scopenote: Pictures of Harry S. Truman and Alben Barkley behind Dan M. Nee, Executive Director; Joseph M. Darst, Club Chairman; and John J. Nangle, Democratic National Committeeman of Missouri at Campaign Headquarters for Truman-Barkley Club of Missouri.  They are in suite 244-246 of Hotel Jefferson in St. Louis.

title: Portraits of President Truman and Alben Barkley
Scopenote: This photographs shows portraits of Harry S. Truman and Alben Barkley on display in the window of the Pickard Insurance Agency in Kennett, Missouri.

title: Round-Up Lodge Tourist Court
Scopenote: The highway tourist trade is an important part of Deming's economic system. The Round-Up Lodge motel with nearby gas station on Highway 80 is typical of the modern tourist courts.

title: Cutting Tape to a New Highway
Scopenote: The opening of a road that connects Deming with Old Mexico, thirty miles to the south. Shown cutting the tape is Governor Thomas J. Mabry, of New Mexico, with Governor Foglio Miramontes of Chihuahua, Mexico, looking on.

title: Irrigating the Fields
Scopenote: A shirtless farmer digs with a shovel as he works to irrigate the fields around Deming, New Mexico.

title: Moss Agate Ring
Scopenote: The mining of agate and semi-precious stones is another business in the Deming, NM, area. The agate is removed from the ground, cut and polished, and the resulting stones are used mainly for jewelry. The colors in this moss agate ring are green and brown on a cloudy white background.

title: Cotton Gin and Weighing of the Bales
Scopenote: A man weighing bales of cotton at the gin near Deming, New Mexico.

title: Bales of Cotton
Scopenote: During cotton picking season the gin, near Deming, New Mexico, is full of wagons bringing the cotton from the fields, as well as the baled cotton that is ready and waiting to be carried away to the nation's markets.

title: Municipal Airport of Deming, New Mexico
Scopenote: One large Air Force plane and several small planes lined up on the tarmac at the Municipal Airport of Deming, New Mexico.

title: Florida Mountains Outside Deming, New Mexico
Scopenote: The Florida mountains outside Deming. This is a view of the mountains from the road that leads to Old Mexico.

title: Meal at Roundup Time
Scopenote: Cowboys crouch and sit on the ground eating their meal during roundup time. Meals are served off tin plates in the chuck tent. The fluffy, light biscuits are turned out by a weather beaten camp cook.

title: Ranchers Inoculating Cattle
Scopenote: Ranchers give shots to inoculate restrained cattle at a roundup.

title: Cattle in Corral
Scopenote: Corrals around Deming, NM, for use by anyone who is shipping cattle. They are built with ramps leading directly into the cattle cars.

title: Ranchers Branding, De-Horning, and Tying up a Calf at a Spring Round-up
Scopenote: Ranchers branding, de-horning, and tying up a calf at a spring round-up near Deming, New Mexico.

title: President Truman on rear of train with two unidentified men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiling and waving on the rear of a train with two unidentified men to the right.

title: Hand Carved Saddle
Scopenote: One of the uses of well tanned hides is the conversion into hand carved saddles. Deming, NM, has two top saddle shops.

title: Cowboy about to fall off a horse at a rodeo
Scopenote: A crowd watches a young cowboy at a rodeo near Deming, NM, as he is about to fall off his horse.

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Group of Men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, center) stands with a group of unidentified men outside the White House.

title: Guest house at Shangri-La
Scopenote: Guest house at Shangri-La.

title: Model of the White House, South Balcony
Scopenote: Model of the south portico of the White House.

title: Truman with unidentified man in White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left, with an unidentified man in the Oval Office.

title: Profile portrait of Truman
Scopenote: Formal head and shoulders portrait of President Harry S. Truman by the Pach Brothers, New York.  This is a semi-profile view.

title: Steel engraving of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Steel engraving of President Harry S. Truman by Harry S. Moskovitz. Original transferred to museum 12/20/73.

title: U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: The U.S.S. Williamsburg entering Havana, Cuba.

title: The exterior of the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Little White House in Key West, Florida. The Truman family and guests often stayed in the Little White House during trips to Key West.

title: A bedroom at the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Two twin beds in a bedroom at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. The Truman family and guests often stayed in the Little White House during trips to Key West.

title: Inspecting bomb damage
Scopenote: An inspection party on one of the islands at Eniwetok views the devastation caused by the blast of an atom bomb.

title: Checking instruments before atomic blast

title: Aerial View of Deming, New Mexico
Scopenote: Aerial view of Deming, New Mexico. Deming is situated on the main southern, east-west, coast-to-coast highway, in a county whose biggest businesses are ranching, farming, and mining. The population of Deming is around 6,000. The altitude is 4,335 feet, and the annual mean temperature is 60 degrees.

title: Mining Operations in Deming, New Mexico
Scopenote: Men are digging out an entrance underground. This is the beginning of a lead mine in the Cook's Peak region. Mining is one of the main industries of Deming, New Mexico.

title: Brahma Calf
Scopenote: Brahma calf near Deming, New Mexico. This type of calf has recently become favored over the Hereford breed in this area.

title: Weighing of Cattle Before Shipment
Scopenote: Before shipping, the cattle are herded into a special weighing shed where they are weighed and checked. Both the buyer and the seller, or their representatives, are present at weighing time.

title: Quarter Horse in Action
Scopenote: A cowboy rides a quarter horse as he tries to lasso a bull during a ranch roundup.
