title: Margaret Truman standing at microphone in 1948 March of Dimes Campaign event
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) standing in front of microphone with others including the 1948 poster boy for the March of Dimes Campaign, Terry Tullos.

title: Margaret Truman with poster boy for 1948 March of Dimes Campaign
Scopenote: Margaret Truman watches as the poster boy for 1948 March of Dimes Campaign, Terry Tullos, drops a coin in a milk bottle.

title: Margaret Truman giving speech for the 1948 March of Dimes campaign
Scopenote: Margaret Truman giving speech for the 1948 March of Dimes campaign.  The unidentified woman next to Margaret is holding Terry Tullos, the poster child for the campaign.

title: Margaret Truman with poster child for March of Dimes campaign
Scopenote: The poster boy for the 1948 March of Dimes Campaign, Terry Tullos, stands next to Margaret Truman with unidentified woman looking on.

title: Margaret Truman giving speech for 1948 March of Dimes Campaign
Scopenote: Margaret Truman giving speech for 1948 March of Dimes Campaign.   The unidentified woman standing next to Margaret is holding Terry Tullos, the poster boy for the campaign.

title: President Truman receiving "Crazy Dog" necklace
Scopenote: Native American Thunderbolt Lefthand (right) presents a "Crazy Dog" necklace to President Harry S. Truman (left).  Joining them is Senator Milton R. Young of North Dakota (center).

title: Harry S. Truman Receives Plaque
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) being awarded a plaque designating him a Life Member of the Florida Wildlife Association. The man presenting the award is unidentified. Same as photo 77-381.

title: Captain Dennison and Rear Admiral Foskett
Scopenote: Captain Robert L. Dennison (left) shaking hands with Rear Admiral James H. Foskett.

title: President Truman presenting Medal of Merit to top officials
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presenting Medal of Merit to top officials. L to R: W. John Kenney, Under-Secretary of the Navy;  W. Stuart Symington, Secretary of the Air Force; President Truman; James Forrestal, Secretary of Defense; and John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy.

title: President Truman signs a proclamation entitled "Prevention and Control of Juvenile Delinquency" with dignitaries
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs a proclamation entitled "Prevention and Control of Juvenile Delinquency." Dignitaries present L to R: Sargent Shriver, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Oscar Ewing, The Hon. G. Howland Shaw, Chairman of National Conference on Prevention and Control of Juvenile Delinquency, Katharine Lenroot, Eunice Kennedy, Frank L. Weil, John W. Andrews, Vice Chairman of National Conference.

title: President Truman with Medal of Merit recipient W. John Kenney and family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) with Medal of Merit recipient W. John Kenney (right), Under Secretary of the Navy and his family.  With Mr. Kenney are his children Elinor M., Priscilla, and David, and his wife, Elinor (second from the right).

title: Harry S. Truman signing Mundt-Smith Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signing the Mundt-Smith bill, which provided additional funding for the Voice of American radio network.  Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right: Senator H. Alexander Smith; Walter Lemon, World Wide Broadcasting Foundation; Howland Sargeant, Inter-departmental Committee on Scientific and Cultural Cooperation, State Department; Congressman Karl E. Mundt; and Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett.  Same as 68-1290.

title: President Truman presenting Medal of Merit to John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) presenting medal of merit to John L. Sullivan (right), Secretary of the Navy.  With the President and Secretary Sullivan are Mr. Sullivan's family: children Patricia, Charles, and Deborah, and his wife Priscilla.  Standing on the right in the background is General Harry Vaughan.

title: President Truman presenting Medal of Merit to top officials
Scopenote: The children of Under Secretary of the Navy W. John Kenney and Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan in the Oval Office while their fathers receive the Medal of Merit from President Harry S. Truman. Secretary of State George Marshall is on the far right. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman presenting Medal of Merit to James Forrestal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presenting Medal of Merit to James Forrestal, Secretary of Defense.  In the background are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (far left) and Admiral William Leahy (between President Truman and Secretary Forrestal).

title: President Harry S. Truman presenting Medal of Merit to top officials
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (middle, third from the right) presenting Medal of Merit to top officials. Standing with President Truman are (from left to right) W. John Kenney, Under-Secretary of Navy; W. Stuart Symington, Secretary of the Air Force; James Forrestal, Secretary of Defense; and John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy. Standing in the back row are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (third from the right); Secretary of State George Marshall (second from the right); and Admiral William D. Leahy (right).

title: President Truman with winners of "Voice of Democracy" Contest
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with the winners of the "Voice of Democracy" Contest. L to R: Commissioner of Education Dr. John Studebaker, Janet Geister (Ohio), Rose Mudd (Montana), President Truman, Alice Tyree (Oklahoma), Lural Shatto (Maryland) and Senator James Murray of Montana.

title: Harry S. Truman with Maple Harl
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Maple Harl (center), Chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and Charles Armstrong, President of the Kiwanis International.  Same as 77-392.

title: President Truman with B'Nai B'rith Executive Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of the B'Nai B'rith Executive Committee.  From left to right: President Truman, Eddie Jacobson, Maurice Bisgyer, and Frank Goldman.

title: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House
Scopenote: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House.

title: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House
Scopenote: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House.

title: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House
Scopenote: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House.

title: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House
Scopenote: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House.

title: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House
Scopenote: Construction of the Truman balcony on the White House.

title: Harry Vaughan, Robert Landry, and Robert Dennison
Scopenote: From left to right, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, and Captain Robert Dennison.

title: Harry S. Truman receiving a plaque
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) receiving the Civic Service Award from the Fraternal Order of Eagles.  Members of the delegation, from left to right: Francis O. Quinn; Matthew Brown; DeVere Watson; President Truman; John Taggert; William Mostyn; Murray Martin; and Norman Gidley.  See also photos 59-1413, 77-407, 60-161-01, and 60-161-02.

title: Harry S. Truman receiving a plaque
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) receiving the Civic Service Award from the Fraternal Order of Eagles.  Members of the delegation, from left to right: Francis O. Quinn; Matthew Brown; DeVere Watson; President Truman; John Taggert; William Mostyn; Murray Martin; and Norman Gidley.  Same as photo 77-407.  See also photos 59-1453,  60-161-01, and 60-161-02.

title: President Truman with Generals Eisenhower and Bradley and Secretary Royall
Scopenote: From left to right: General Dwight Eisenhower, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, and General Omar Bradley.  General Eisenhower is swearing in General Bradley as the new Army Chief of Staff.

title: President Truman with General Eisenhower and General Bradley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with General Dwight Eisenhower (center) and General Omar Bradley (right).  President Truman is shaking hands with General Bradley after the General was sworn in as the new Army Chief of Staff.

title: General and Mrs. Omar Bradley
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley and his wife, Mary E. Bradley.  General Bradley had just been sworn in as the Army Chief of Staff.

title: President Truman with General Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) pinning an Oak Leaf Cluster (Distinguished Service Medal) on General Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: President Truman with bond poster
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (right) holding a "Buy Bonds Today!" poster.

title: President Truman getting a Red Cross pin from Bob Hope
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Joseph C. Grew, and Bob Hope pin a Red Cross on President Truman for the 1948 fundraising campaign.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Boy Scouts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman posed with top-ranking Boy Scouts from all regions of the country in honor of Boy Scout week and was given a parchment and statuette. From left to right: Richard Goodrich, James F. McIntyre, Dale Gallagher, Morris L. Frye, Joseph E. Melton, Jack Brader, Daniel L. Soss, President Harry S. Truman, Myron T. Shervheim, John C. Wyatt, Thomas G. Sage, Reymond W. Schwab and Karl Young.

title: President Truman with horse
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman examines "Honey," one of the horses used for a coast-to-coast horseback ride with riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary.

title: Truman poses with his portrait and Onestus Uzzell, artist
Scopenote: Artist Onestus Uzzell (right) and President Harry S. Truman stand beside a portrait of the Chief Executive in the Cabinet room of the White House, where Harry S. Truman posed for the artist. The painting was commissioned by the Democratic Women of Dallas County, Texas.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with Admiral Leahy
Scopenote: From left to right, Admiral William D. Leahy, President Harry S. Truman and Bess Wallace Truman.  A large crowd of unidentified people is in the background.  Admiral Leahy has autographed the photo.  The Trumans were attending the Lincoln Day observance at the Lincoln Memorial.  See also photo 73-2627.

title: Harry S. Truman in the White House Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Senators, Representatives, Mayors, and other officials from Florida in the White House Office.

title: President and Mrs. Truman attending memorial exercises at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Truman with dignitaries attended commemorative exercises at the Lincoln Memorial, held by the District of Columbia Commandery of the Military Order of the Loyal Legion. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman, and First Lady Bess Truman.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with dignitaries at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Truman with dignitaries attended commemorative exercises at the Lincoln Memorial, held by the District of Columbia Commandery of the Military Order of the Loyal Legion. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, and General Ulysses S. Grant III.

title: Lincoln Day observance at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and dignitaries facing the Lincoln Memorial in the foreground with the crowd in the background. From left to right, (backs to the camera) Ulysses S. Grant III, Mrs. Bess Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan and W. Elkins Reed.

title: President and Mrs. Truman with group facing Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Truman with dignitaries (backs turned) attended commemorative exercises at the Lincoln Memorial, held by the District of Columbia Commandery of the Military Order of the Loyal Legion. L to R: General Ulysses S. Grant III, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan and W. Elkins Reed.

title: Harry S. Truman giving a speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) giving a speech to the Conference of National Women's Organizations. On the left is Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach. In the background on the right is Captain Robert Dennison.

title: Truman being presented a scroll from the National Conference of Christians and Jews
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman being presented with a scroll and medal by the National Conference of Christians and Jews. The award was made in recognition of the Chief Executive's efforts toward racial and religious understanding. Front row, left to right: Thomas Braniff, President Truman, Robert P. Patterson, J. Robert Rubin.  Back row, left to right: William Green, Louis Nizer, Everett R. Clinchy and Marquis Childs.

title: President Truman addressing Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Crowd shot of President Harry S. Truman standing at the podium at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Statler Hotel.  President Truman also spoke at a second Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel later in the evening.

title: Harry S. Truman at a reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner.  From left to right: Senator Alben Barkley; Assistant Secretary of Labor David Morse; Senator and Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath; Perle Mesta, Co-Chairman of the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner Committee; President Truman; Wilson Wyatt, Chairman of the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner Committee; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson.  Same as photo 77-436.

title: Truman being presented with Gold Plaque by delegation from West New York, N.J
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman being presented a Gold Plaque by delegation of the Golden Jubilee for West New York, New Jersey. From left to right, Harry J. Swensen, Mayor Wilbur J. McGowan, former Mayor Joseph Stilz, President Truman, Rep. Edward J. Hart and George Rosenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Attend Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attended a $100 a plate fundraiser dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in honor of Jefferson-Jackson Day. Truman (left) is talking with Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center) and his daughter Margaret Truman (right). Unknown people are seated in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at Jefferson-Jackson Banquet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is speaking at a Jefferson-Jackson banquet in Washington, D. C. Left to right: Mrs. Bess Truman, Wilson W. Wyatt (Chairman of the dinner), President Truman, an unidentified man, Alben W. Barkley, singer Helen Jepson, and J. Howard McGrath.   Donor:  Dorothy Girton. Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Truman addressing Jefferson-Jackson Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the podium waving to the crowd attending the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel with unidentified attendees applauding in the background.

title: President Truman in the crowd of the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (center back, wearing large white corsage) standing at the podium at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel.  A second Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner was also held at the Statler Hotel.

title: Membership plaque from the people of West New York, New Jersey
Scopenote: Solid gold Honorary Membership Card presented to President Harry S. Truman on behalf of forty-one thousand citizens of West New York, N. J. for their Golden Jubilee.

title: Secretary Marshall sees President Truman off on Caribbean trip
Scopenote: Secretary George C. Marshall (at left) seeing President Harry S. Truman (at right) off on a trip to Key West, Florida and the Caribbean.

title: Snow scene
Scopenote: Road leading to the Kodiak Naval Base in Kodiak, Alaska.

title: Snow scene
Scopenote: Road leading to the Kodiak Naval Base in Kodiak, Alaska.

title: President Truman with Governor Pinero and Secretary Krug at La Fortaleza
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the official residence of Jesus T. Pinero, the Governor of Puerto Rico, with Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.  From left to right: Governor Pinero, President Truman, and Secretary Krug.

title: President Truman shaking hands with Governor Pinero at airfield in San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Truman being welcomed by Governor Pinero at Isla Grande airport in San Juan Puerto Rico. L to R: Dr. Francisco M. Susoni, Speaker of the Insular House of Representatives; President of Insular Senate, Don Luis Munoz-Marin; President Harry S. Truman; Governor Jesus T. Pinero; and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: President Truman with Governor Pinero and Secretary Krug
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) in San Juan with the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero (second from the right) and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (right).

title: Truman at podium on airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech on the airfield after arriving in San Juan, Puerto Rico with dignitaries looking on.

title: President Truman with Pinero and Admiral Barbey in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing on the airfield in San Juan Puerto Rico with Governor Jesus Pinero and Vice Admiral Daniel E. Barbey.

title: President Truman and Governor Pinero riding in a car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving his hat while sitting in the back of a convertible in a motorcade while visiting San Juan, Puerto Rico.  With him is the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero.

title: President Truman on the veranda of Hotel Jagueyes, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits on the veranda of Hotel Jagueyes, near Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico with dignitaries. From L to R: Admiral William Leahy, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and President of the Insular Senate, Don Luis Munoz-Marin.

title: Truman at podium on airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech on the airfield after arriving in San Juan, Puerto Rico with dignitaries looking on.

title: Truman at podium on airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech on the airfield after arriving in San Juan, Puerto Rico with dignitaries looking on.

title: Crowd on airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: Crowd on airfield with waving flags listening to President Harry S. Truman's speech at San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: President Truman walking on the airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (holding hat) walking with Governor Jesus T. Pinero (in white suit) on the airfield after arriving in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: President Truman with Governor Pinero and Secretary Krug on the airfield at San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Governor Jesus T. Pinero of Puerto Rico and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug on the airfield at San Juan greeting the people in the crowd.

title: President Truman and Governor Pinero riding in a car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving his hat while sitting in the back of a convertible in a motorcade while visiting San Juan, Puerto Rico.  With him is the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero.

title: Truman at podium on airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech on the airfield after arriving in San Juan, Puerto Rico with dignitaries looking on. Truman from behind facing the crowd.

title: Margaret Truman and Spike Jones at Correspondents Association Dinner
Scopenote: L to R: Spike Jones and Margaret Truman on stage at Correspondents Association Dinner.

title: Harry S. Truman at Correspondents' Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presenting Raymond Clapper Memorial Award to Nat Finney, reporter for the Des Moines Register and the Minneapolis Star-Tribune.  Truman presented the award at the White House Correspondents' Dinner at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D. C.  From left to right are: Ernest B. "Tony" Vaccaro, incoming President of the White House Correspondents' Association; President Truman; Nat S. Finney; and Felix Belair, Jr., outgoing President of the Association.

title: Truman at White House Correspondents' Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the White House Correspondents' Dinner at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D. C.  From left to right are: Ernest B. Vaccaro, incoming President of the Correspondents Association; Felix Belair, Jr., outgoing President of the Association; and President Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is presented with a replica of a medal worn by George Washington, the first President to be a member of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick. From left to right: John J. Reilly, Judge Vincent A. Carroll, President Truman, and John W. Laird.

title: President Truman is presented with his American Red Cross membership card
Scopenote: Herbert N. Wilson, chairman of Jackson County, MO Red Cross presents President Truman with his American Red Cross card.

title: Truman with fish
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receiving a gift of fish from the Guy Rathbun Post of the American Legion in Kelso, Washington. With President Truman are Congressman Russell Mack (left) and Senator Harry P. Cain (right), both of Washington.

title: Harry S. Truman receiving a gift
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receiving a gift of fish from the Guy Rathbun Post of the American Legion in Kelso, Washington.  With President Truman are Congressman Russell Mack (left) and Senator Harry P. Cain (right), both of Washington.

title: Truman and Mrs. Bess Truman with group of people
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right, front row) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (second from right, front row) with Attorney General J. Howard McGrath (front row, fifth from the right), Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (back row, third from the right), Secretary of State George C. Marshall (back row, fourth from the right), and numerous unidentified people.

title: President Truman Receiving Life Membership in  82nd Airborne Division Association
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office being presented life membership in the 82nd Airborne Division Association. L to R: President Truman and Sgt. Leonard Funk, Congressional Medal of Honor winner in foreground. Rear: Charles A. Young, Jr., Rev. Peter Mommersteeg, Hugh Gibson, Major General James M. Gavin, Ambassador Eelco Van Kleffens of the Netherlands, and William F. Jacobi.

title: Harry S. Truman addresses the 80th Congress
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman is addressing the 80th Congress.  Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Harry S. Truman shakes hands with George C. Marshall
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman is shaking hands with George C. Marshall, outside a building.

title: Truman addresses Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing Congress regarding the threat of Communism to freedom in Europe.

title: Truman at St. Patrick's Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is on the reviewing stand shaking hands with unidentified man at New York City's St. Patrick's Day parade. L to R: unidentified, Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, John J. Sheean.

title: Truman with Thomas Dewey at St. Patrick's Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with dignitaries on reviewing stand at New York City's St. Patrick's Day parade shaking hands with Governor Thomas Dewey. L to R: Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, John J. Sheean, and Thomas Dewey. Man on right is unknown.
