title: Cabinet members at Truman's address to Congress
Scopenote: Cabinet members (center, front to back) George C. Marshall, John Snyder, James Forrestal, Tom Clark, Julius Krug, Clinton Anderson, and Averell Harriman, surrounded by other unidentified members of Congress.

title: Truman addresses Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at left, foreground) addresses Congress on the Request for Mobilization.

title: Harry S. Truman addressing Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addressing a Joint Session of Congress on the threat to the freedom of Europe.

title: Truman after his address to Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), surrounded by unidentified members of Congress, following his address to Congress on the Request for Mobilization.

title: Truman with Marshall and Forrestal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) converses with Secretary of State General George Marshall (left) and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (right).  They are leaving the White House and heading for the Capitol where President Truman will address Congress.

title: Sons of St. Patrick Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the Hundred and sixty-fourth Anniversary Dinner of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick at the Hotel Astor in New York City.

title: Truman with Dewey at St. Patrick's Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with dignitaries on reviewing stand at New York City's St. Patrick's Day parade shaking hands with Governor Thomas Dewey. L to R: Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, John J. Sheean, and Governor Thomas Dewey.
Institutional Creator: Keystone Pictures, Inc., New York, NY

title: Truman waving at airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat for photographers while at the airport.  He is leaving for New York City to address the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick.

title: Bowling alley in the White House
Scopenote: Two automatic bowling lanes installed in the White House during the administration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman with Board of Trustees of FDR Memorial Foundation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, center) meeting with the Board of Trustees of the Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Foundation.  Seated, left to right:  Frank C. Walker, President Truman, and Samuel I. Rosenman.  Rear, left to right:  William D. Hassett, Theodore R. Gamble, Grace G. Tully, Isador Lubin, William Green, Robert E. Sherwood, George E. Allen, Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, William Cronin, and Peter H. Odegard.

title: View from the end of the bowling alley in the White House
Scopenote: Long view with the pins in the distance of the two automatic bowling lanes installed in the White House during the administration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Long view of the bowling alley in the White House
Scopenote: Long view facing windows of the automatic bowling lanes installed in the White House during the administration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman with the Board of Trustees of the Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Foundation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with the Board of Trustees of the Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Foundation in the Cabinet Room of the White House.  President Harry S. Truman, seated in the front center, is flanked by Frank C. Walker on the left and Samuel I. Rosenman on the right.  Standing, left to right are: William D. Hassett, Theodore R. Gamble, Grace G. Tully, Isador Lubin, William Green, Robert E. Sherwood, George Allen, Admiral William Leahy, William Cronin, and Dr. Peter Odegard.

title: Major General George A. Horkan, Portrait
Scopenote: Portrait of Major General George A. Horkan.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Truman presenting National Press Club member card
Scopenote: J. Russell Young, a District of Columbia Commissioner (left), receives his life membership card to the National Press Club from President Harry S. Truman (center).  Joseph Short, President of the Press Club, is at right.    Same as photos 77-108 and 77-472.

title: Truman receiving gift from group of men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) accepts a gift (probably a membership card) from member of the Order of Ahepa, the American Hellenic Educational Progressive Association.  From left to right are: Chris Garrison, Secretary of the Kansas City chapter; Thomas Kapsemalis, President of the Kansas City chapter; President Truman; and William Helis, President of the Order of Ahepa.

title: President Truman in Williamsburg, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and others in Williamsburg, Virginia on his visit to receive an honorary degree from the College of William and Mary. Outside the photograph, in President Truman's handwriting, is "Visit to Williamsburg to receive a degree from William and Mary College."

title: Truman reviewing Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right), reviewing the Army Day Parade in Washington, D. C. with, from left to right, Secretary of the Army, Kenneth Royall, Secretary of Defense, James Forrestal, and Vice Admiral Earle W. Mills.

title: President Truman and the Prince Regent of Belgium, Prince Charles
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and the Prince Regent of Belgium, Prince Charles (to the left), saluting.  Behind President Truman, from left to right are General Harry H. Vaughan, Captain Robert L. Dennison, and General Robert Landry.

title: Truman greeting Belgian Prince Regent
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) greeting the Prince Regent of Belgium, Prince Charles (second from left, back to camera).  Standing in the doorway behind President Truman is Harry Vaughan.

title: Prince Regent of Belgium's visit to United States
Scopenote: The Prince Regent of Belgium, Prince Charles, aboard a plane during his visit to the United States.

title: Truman meeting Prince Regent of Belgium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, second from left) meeting Prince Charles, Regent of Belgium (front row, left), at the White House.  Others are Admiral William D. Leahy (second row, left), General Harry H. Vaughan (second row, second from left), and Paul Henri-Spaak.

title: Truman receiving Belgian War Cross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at right) receiving the Belgian War Cross from Prince Charles, Regent of Belgium.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Credentials for 1948 National Convention of the American Legion
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at left) receiving first registration credentials for 1948 National Convention of the American Legion from Representative George A. Smathers of Florida (center) and Leonce R. Legendre (right).

title: Truman congratulates new Administrator for Economic Cooperation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at right), congratulates Paul G. Hoffman (at left) following a White House ceremony at which Hoffman was sworn into office as Administrator for Economic Cooperation. Chief Justice Fred Vinson, center, of the U.S. Supreme Court, administered the oath of office.

title: Truman with Ararat Shriners
Scopenote: Renah Camalier (second from left), Howard Foley (third from left), and Omer Clark (right) present President Harry S. Truman (far left) with tickets to the annual Shrine Circus.  President Truman is shown receiving a bid to open the first performance of the 8th annual Shrine Circus on April 19, 1948.

title: Truman with Shriners
Scopenote: Renah Camalier (second from left), Howard Foley (third from left), and Omer Clark (right) present President Harry S. Truman (far left) with tickets to the annual Shrine Circus.    Similar to 59-1514.

title: Truman receiving annual baseball pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at left), with Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Senators Baseball Club, receiving his annual baseball pass.  President Truman also accepts a handbag and baseball pass on behalf of Bess Truman from Mr. Griffith.

title: Truman receiving baseball passes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is shown receiving his annual baseball pass from Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Senators Baseball Club.  President Truman also accepts a handbag and baseball pass on behalf of Bess Truman from Mr. Griffith.

title: Truman presenting Official Insignia to Blinded Veterans Association
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from right), presenting the Official Insignia of the Blinded Veterans Association, Inc., to the executives of the organization at a White House ceremony.  Left to right are Lloyd M. Greenwood, Harrison King, James W. Hope, Raymond T. Frey, Byrum S. Shumway, President Truman, Irvin P. Schloss, Robert Pistel, Peter J. McKenna, and John F. Brady.

title: Truman presents Blinded Veterans Association, Inc., with official insignia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Official Insignia of the Blinded Veterans Association, Inc., to the executives of the organization.  Included in the photograph from left to right are: Lloyd M. Greenwood, Executive Director, New York; Harrison King, Washington, D.C.; James W. Hope, Gastonia, N.C.; Raymond T. Frey, Past President, Le Banon, Pennsylvania; Byrum S. Shumway, of Board of Directors, Baltimore, Maryland; President Harry S. Truman; Irvin P. Schloss, Baltimore, Maryland; Robert Pistel, Chairman, Baltimore, Maryland, Group; Peter J. McKenna, Jr., Washington, D.C.; and John F. Brady, President, New York City.        Similar to 73-2605a.

title: Truman with cowboy boots
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left, after receiving a pair of Texas cowboy boots.  With the President, left to right, are Representatives George Mahon, W. R. Poage, Ed Gossett, and Lindley Beckworth.

title: Truman with National Boy of the Year
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, left, with 14-year old newsboy, Franklin Harrison, the National Boy of the Year, of the Boys' Clubs.

title: Truman with delegates from the Railroad Fair
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), with C. A. Miller, Executive General Agent of the Chicago and North Western Railroad and Norma Sykes, "Miss Chicago and North Western" at the White House.  The Chicago and North Western brought a replica of their original engine, "The Pioneer" to the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Democratic Members of the House of Representatives
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated), with a group of House Democrats. Left to right, standing are Representatives Harold D. Donohue, Massachusetts; William T. Byrne, New York; Walter B. Huber, Ohio; Clair Engle, California; John Lesinski, Michigan; John R. Murdock, Arizona; Michael Kirwan, Ohio; Antonio M. Fernandez, New Mexico; Aime J. Forand, Rhode Island; and Francis E. Walter, Pennsylvania.

title: Truman inspects baseball during opening game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, standing, fourth from right) holds a baseball presumably given to him by Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Baseball Club (front row, standing, third from right).  Two unidentified baseball players are also present.  Seated in the stands, front row, left to right are: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman.  Seated behind them are, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly.

title: The Trumans Attend the Opening Day Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending the first baseball game of the season with his family and friends.  Front row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, and President Truman.  Second row, left to right: General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly.

title: Truman pitches baseball from stands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tosses a baseball from the stands to open the baseball season.  Two unidentified baseball players are also on hand.  Front row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, and President Truman.  Second row, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly.

title: Bess Truman at Senate Ladies Annual Luncheon
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Truman, center, with Mrs. Emily (Henry Cabot) Lodge, left, and Mrs. Hazel (Arthur)Vandenberg, right, at the Senate Ladies Annual Luncheon.

title: Feller at a Cocker Club Show
Scopenote: Mrs. Velma Graham, wife of the President's personal physician, is shown grooming President Harry S. Truman's dog, "Feller", while her own dog, "Budette," sits in the foreground.  Feller was shown at the Capital city Cocker Club show by the children of Brigadier General Wallace Graham, the White House physician.

title: Truman with V.F.W. member and girl
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) holds Sandra Marie Smith, and orphan of World War II from the Veterans of Foreign Wars Home.  An unidentified V.F.W. member is with her to present the first buddy poppy of the V.F.W. fund drive to President Truman.

title: Young Democratic Clubs national officers and Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with officers of the Young Democratic Clubs of America.  From left to right: Angela Parisi, Secretary; Roy G. Baker, President; President Truman; E. Hoover Taft, Treasurer; and Mrs. Theodora Hansen, Vice President.  Same as photo 77-527. Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used in the Democratic Digest.

title: President Truman with School Patrol students
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with a group of School Patrol Honor Medal Winners in the Oval Office.

title: President Harry S. Truman with boys of Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with boys of Girard College.

title: Truman plants tree during Girard College visit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from right) digs into a mound of earth to cover the roots of a sapling tree.  This event, watched by a large group of spectators, transpires on the Girard College campus.

title: Truman in Ceremony at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in background, second from right) converses with an unidentified military officer during a ceremony at Girard College.  In the foreground, soldiers stand at attention presenting their swords.

title: Truman and young boys at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands amidst a crowd of young, male, boarding school students and their teachers in the courtyard of Girard College.

title: Truman plants tree at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, on right) shovels soil around a sapling on the grounds of Girard College.  Truman is surrounded by a group of unidentified men.

title: Truman inspects cadets at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left, in civilian clothes) parades past cadets assembled for presentation.  Truman is accompanied by an unidentified officer.  Two officers stand to the far left with unsheathed swords.

title: President Truman takes flag from soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (first on right) takes the Girard College flag from an unidentified cadet during a ceremony.

title: Truman arriving Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, standing near convertible) arrives at Girard College and is received by a number of unidentified dignitaries.

title: Truman stands with young boys at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands with a group of young boys at Girard College.

title: Truman shakes hands with young man
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with an unidentified young man (probably a Girard student).  An unidentified man stands between them.

title: Truman waves hat from convertible at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, second row, third from viewer) waves his hat to a crowd of photographers.  Press members, police officers, and secret service agents surround the automobile.  Two unknown dignitaries enter the car and another two are already situated in the back seat beside Truman.

title: Truman seated with men in convertible at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) jokes with members of the press from the back seat of a convertible during his visit to Girard College.

title: Truman inspects troops at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left, in civilian clothes) walks with an unidentified officer across the field at Girard College to inspect the cadets.

title: Truman descends steps at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from right) descends the steps outside a building on the Girard College campus with a group of unidentified men.  Two uniformed police officers also accompany the Truman.

title: Truman gives speech at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium, third from right) addresses a large group from the stage of an auditorium at Girard College.  There are other unidentified men with Truman on the stage.  Photographers and press members capture photos in the foreground.

title: Truman shakes the hand of young man at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) is introduced to an unidentified young man during his visit to Girard College.  Three unidentified gentlemen (two to the left of Truman and one to the right) are also present at this event.

title: Truman shakes hands with Motor Bandit Patrol officer
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) shakes the hand of an unidentified officer of the Motor Bandit Patrol during his visit to Girard College.  Three other unidentified men are also present.

title: Truman waves from convertible before the steps of a Girard College building
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves to onlookers from a convertible which is parked outside the entrance of a Girard College building.  An unidentified man sits beside Truman in the automobile.

title: Truman plants tree before a crowd on the grounds of Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, fourth from right) shovels soil onto the roots of a tree.  A small group of dignitaries and police officers flank him, and a large crowd of people watch in the distance.

title: Truman being transported in convertible around Girard College campus
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) waves at onlookers from a convertible.  Four unidentified men are also seated in the car.

title: Truman seated in convertible with group of men at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, second row, left) is accompanied by a group of four unidentified men in a convertible during his visit to Girard College.

title: Truman and group in convertible at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, second row, third from viewer) waves to photographers and bystanders outside the entrance of Girard College.  Truman is accompanied by four unidentified men in the car.  A group of secret service agents, police officers, and press members are also present.

title: Truman walks with military officer at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothing, front, second from left) walks with an unidentified officer during a ceremony at Girard College.  Cadets stand at attention in the background.

title: Truman observes cadets at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothing, front, second from left) is escorted by a military officer as he inspects the cadets at Girard College.

title: Truman addresses a large group at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center stage, standing at podium) addresses a large group of Girard College students, dignitaries, and visitors in the college's auditorium.

title: Truman stands at attention during procession at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, left) stands at attention during a procession at Girard College.  Truman is accompanied by an unidentified military official.  A large crowd lines the stands in the background.

title: Truman plants tree on grounds of Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) shovels soil atop the roots of a small tree on the grounds of Girard College.  A large crowd watches this event from a distance.  An unidentified man is visible to the left of Truman.

title: Truman watches a military procession
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, front row, second from right) watches a military procession at Girard College.

title: Truman waves from convertible at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, second row, third from viewer) waves to photographers and bystanders outside the entrance of Girard College.  Truman is accompanied by four unidentified men in the car.

title: Truman at podium in auditorium of Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground) stands at the podium of Girard College reviewing his speech.  Two unidentified gentlemen converse behind Truman.

title: Truman delivers speech at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, at podium) at a speech given by him at Girard College.  An unidentified man stands behind Truman.

title: Truman eats cookies with young boys at Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, center) munches on a cookie offered to him by one of the students at Girard College.  The young boys, dressed in what might be Girard College uniform surround Truman as they pose for the photograph.

title: Truman stands with boarders of Girard College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in profile) stands with a group of young boys attending Girard College.  Members of the press are also present.

title: President Truman with Dr. Chaim Weizmann
Scopenote: Dr. Chaim Weizmann, President of Israel, presents a Torah, or Holy Scroll, to President Truman during a visit to the White House.  Donor: Rabbi Phillip S. Bernstein.

title: Truman presenting Medal of Merit and Bronze Oak Leaf Cluster to Conant
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, center, presenting Dr. James B. Conant, at right, with the Medal of Merit and Bronze Oak Leaf Cluster. Dr. Vannevar Bush stands watching at left.

title: Truman at Tomb of Unknowns
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left, at Memorial Day services honoring the war dead at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

title: Truman attending Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, speaking at podium, on Memorial Day for ceremonies honoring war dead at the amphitheatre of Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Truman at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate. Front row, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Colonel Robert Landry, Brigadier General Wallace Graham (physician to the President), Captain Robert Dennison, unidentified officer, unidentified officer, President Truman, unidentified officer, unidentified officer. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman in car at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left in car, with numerous unidentified people, arriving at Arlington National Cemetery for Memorial Day services. Seated next to President Truman is press secretary Charles Ross.

title: Truman at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking at the Amphitheatre of Arlington National Cemetery on Memorial Day.

title: Truman at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman laying wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier for Memorial Day ceremonies.

title: Truman at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: Ceremonies at the amphitheatre of Arlington National Cemetery for Memorial Day.

title: Truman at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, third from right, with others attending Memorial Day services honoring the war dead at Water Gate.

title: Truman at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending Memorial Day ceremonies at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

title: Truman at Memorial Day services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending Memorial Day services for war dead at Water Gate and the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaking at Memorial Day Services
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing) speaking at the Amphitheatre of Arlington National Cemetery on Memorial Day. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman debarking from plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman debarking from plane, evidently after viewing flooding in Washington and Oregon during his western trip.  Military guards are near.

title: Truman and others near plane
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and others in front of plane, evidently to view flood damage in Washington and Oregon.

title: Train crew of Santa Fe No. 26
Scopenote: The train crew of Santa Fe No. 26 from President Truman's western campaign trip.

title: Two members of the No. 26 crew
Scopenote: Two crew members of the Santa Fe No. 26 that President Truman traveled on during his western campaign trip.

title: Margaret Truman on rear of train with President Truman and others in Idaho
Scopenote: Margaret Truman on rear of train with President Harry S. Truman and others during President Truman's campaign visit to Idaho. President Truman is partially obscured.

title: Margaret Truman with group of reporters on train
Scopenote: Margaret Truman talks with reporters on the train during a campaign trip to the West.  This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Truman coming from the train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (holding white hat, face party obscured) and Mrs. Bess Truman walk from the train during a western campaign trip.

title: San Francisco Bay
Scopenote: A view of San Francisco Bay taken during President Truman's campaign trip to California.

title: Truman on the rear platform of a train speaking to the crowd
Scopenote: Truman on the rear platform of a train speaking to the crowd in unknown location during his Western trip.

title: Truman on rear of a train platform speaking to a gathered crowd
Scopenote: Truman (left foreground) on rear of a train platform speaking to a gathered crowd during western trip, probably in Nebraska.

title: A crowd gathers at a railroad station. (Wide View)
Scopenote: A large crowd starts to gather at a railroad station in anticipation of President Truman's visit during his western trip, possibly in Nebraska. (Wide View)

title: Posed shot of President Truman and others near a train in Independence
Scopenote: Posed shot of Truman and others near a train at the Independence, Missouri station.

title: President Truman on the rear platform of train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear of his train with Naval Aide Robert Dennison and other gentlemen. He is traveling on his pre-campaign "western trip" across the United States.

title: Harry S. Truman and others
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and others posing for a blurry picture taken looking up at the second story of unknown building.  This was possibly taken during President Truman's "western trip" to the west coast.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: President Truman Visits Naval Shipyard, Bremerton, Washington, on Western Trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in card, white hat), visits the Naval Shipyard at Bremerton, Washington.  Naval officers greet car; Captain Robert Dennison standing at left. Same as 66-699.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman views the damage of the floods on his western trip to Washington. This is an aerial view of the flood.

title: Crowd in front of Washington Rehabilitation Center.  Truman near doorway
Scopenote: A crowd gathers to greet President Truman during his visit to the Washington Rehabilitation Center.

title: Harry S. Truman shaking hands with man in Washington Rehabilitation Center
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman shaking hands with man in Washington Rehabilitation Center

title: Truman and others near rear of train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with others near the rear of a train in Los Angeles, California on his western trip to the West Coast.

title: Mrs. Truman, Margaret and others on rear of train
Scopenote: Mrs. Truman and Margaret stand with others on the rear of a train during President Truman's western campaign trip.

title: Santa Fe engine crew
Scopenote: The engine crew of the Santa Fe No. 26 from President Truman's trip to the West.

title: Harry S. Truman and Margaret
Scopenote: President Truman and Margaret stand on the back of their train in Idaho during President Truman's western trip.

title: President Truman speaking to reporters and others
Scopenote: President Truman speaking to reporters and others. He is in a residential neighborhood. This photo is from his western trip.

title: Large crowd with police officers, possibly at 35th Division Reunion in Omaha
Scopenote: Large crowd with police officers in forefront, gathers during one of the stops on President Harry S. Truman's western trip. Probably Omaha, Nebraska, where Mr. Truman attended a 35th Division Reunion.

title: Army Recruiters (color guard) marching during a parade for Truman in Omaha
Scopenote: Four army recruiters march during parade in Omaha, Nebraska, for President Truman's visit.

title: President Truman on the rear train platform with a crowd gathered
Scopenote: President Truman on the rear train platform with a crowd gathered.  Another man is speaking while President Truman looks on.  This photo is from President Truman's 1948 western trip.

title: Cake with Piano Model at Sun Valley
Scopenote: A fancy cake with a model of a piano, at the Sun Valley Lodge, in preparation for the visit of President Harry S. Truman.  President Truman was taking his western trip and stopped at Sun Valley.

title: President Truman Inspects Troops in Los Angeles
Scopenote: A photo of President Harry S. Truman inspecting troops in Los Angeles, California during his western trip.

title: A Photo of the San Francisco Skyline
Scopenote: This black and white photo is of the skyline of San Francisco. This was taken during President Truman's western trip.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman views the damage of the floods on his western trip to Washington.  This is an aerial view of the flood.

title: The Truman family on the rear of a train
Scopenote: President Truman, Mrs. Truman and Margaret stand on the back of their train during a campaign visit to Idaho. (see also, 2012-366)

title: Truman in car with others, rear view
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman shown from rear, sitting in the backseat of a car with others. They are at a railroad stop, during the western trip, at Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Four military men firing salute in Omaha, Nebraska during visit of President Truman
Scopenote: Four military men firing salute as crowd watches in background. They are in Omaha, Nebraska, during visit of President Truman to attend 35th Division Reunion.

title: President Truman with crowd at Arco, Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) greeting a crowd in Arco, Idaho, by a Recreation Hall.  He is on his western trip. Military Aide General Harry Vaughan can be seen on lower steps of the building in his uniform. Same as 66-682.

title: Lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho
Scopenote: Lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho, taken during President Harry S. Truman's visit there during his western trip.

title: President Truman visits the Naval Shipyard, Bremerton, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), accompanied by Naval Officers, visits the Naval Shipyard, Bremerton, Washington, on his western trip.

title: View of swimming pool at Sun Valley Resort
Scopenote: View of swimming pool at Sun Valley resort in Idaho.  President Harry S. Truman stopped here on his western trip (not pictured).

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (not visible in photo) views the damage of the floods during his western trip to Washington.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (not visible in photo) views the damage of the floods during his western trip to Washington.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (not visible in photo) views the damage of the floods on his western trip to Washington.

title: Truman debarking from plane
Scopenote: President Truman debarks from a plane, evidently after viewing flood damage in Washington and Oregon during his western trip.

title: Truman on rear of train with others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear of his train surrounded by a crowd and newsmen during a western trip.

title: Truman, Harry Vaughan, and naval officer with others near rear of train
Scopenote: President Truman stands with others near the rear of a train on one of his campaign trips to the West while Harry Vaughan and naval officer salute.

title: Santa Fe Engineer
Scopenote: The engineer of Santa Fe No. 26 from President Truman's campaign trip west.

title: Margaret Truman on rear of train with others
Scopenote: Margaret Truman on rear of train with others that are unidentified, during President Truman's campaign visit to Idaho.

title: Captain Robert Dennison shaking hands with a man as President Truman watches
Scopenote: Naval aide Captain Robert L. Dennison shakes hands with a man as President Harry S. Truman stands in the left foreground.  This was taken during President Truman's western trip, probably Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Posed shot of Truman and others near a train in Independence
Scopenote: Posed shot of Truman and others near a train at the Independence, Missouri station, apparently around the time of his western trip.

title: Truman in crowd at railroad station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, lower right) wandering into the large crowd and shaking a woman's hand at a railroad station.

title: Independence train station photographers waiting for President Truman
Scopenote: This photo was taken at the Independence train station with Vernon Galloway and James W. "Bud" Porter, local photographers. Several people, including some reporters, are waiting at the rear of the train.

title: Charlie Ross with others on the presidential train
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross in presidential train state room, exchanging a package with an unidentified man.  This was taken during President Harry S. Truman's western trip.

title: President Truman and two other men walking toward boats, inspecting flood in Vanport Oregon
Scopenote: President Truman and two other men walking toward boats.  This photo was taken during President Truman's western trip.  He is viewing flood damage from the Columbia River in Vanport, Oregon.

title: Two unknown servants of God
Scopenote: Two unknown servants of God and Peace Be to You. These were written on the back of this photograph of two religiously garbed men. This photograph taken sometime during President Harry S. Truman's 1948 western trip, probably in California. From: O.F. 299E, Trip Number 1, "L"
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Mr. Red Skelton Near a Car
Scopenote: Mr. Red Skelton near a car. It is June of 1948. The photo is from the Truman Library Collection.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (not visible in photo) views the damage of the floods during his western trip to Washington.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman views the damage of the floods during his western trip to Washington.

title: Flood scene
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman views the damage of the floods on his western trip to Washington.

title: Santa Fe Engineer
Scopenote: The engineer of Santa Fe No. 26 from President Truman's western trip.

title: Man at teletype
Scopenote: Man at teletype.  This was with a group of photographs relating to President Harry S. Truman's western trip.

title: Harry S. Truman waves from a car during a parade on his Western trip
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman waves from a car during a parade on his Western trip.

title: Crowd near train
Scopenote: A group of mean congregated around the rear of the train in which President Harry S. Truman is traveling on his western trip.  The location is unknown.

title: Military personnel
Scopenote: This photo contains unidentified five military personnel.  It was taken on President Truman's western trip.

title: Crowd of people
Scopenote: Crowd of people in unidentified location, taken during President Harry S. Truman's western trip.

title: President Truman, with cabinet members, prepares to depart for his western trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left), preparing to depart for his western trip.  Others with the President are, from left to right, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, unidentified, Democratic National Chairman J. Howard McGrath, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, and Secretary of Defense James V. Forrestal.

title: President Truman waving from a train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman departing on his western trip.

title: Rose Conway and Members of the White House Secretarial Staff
Scopenote: Rose Conway, President Harry S. Truman's personal secretary, is seated on a sofa with three other members of the White House secretarial staff prior to accompanying President Truman on his Western trip.  The women in the photo are, left to right: Shirley Green, Myra Houck, Rose Conway, and Myrtle Bergheim.

title: President Truman waving his hat from his train platform as he leaves Chicago
Scopenote: President Truman waving his hat from his train platform as he leaves Chicago.

title: Truman in car with miners around him
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in back seat of car, left) rides in a car with an unidentified man while miners walk along side of the car in Butte, Montana.  President Truman visited Butte while on his tour of western states.

title: World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman spoke at the dedication while on his western trip.

title: Boy's Town church
Scopenote: Church on the campus of Boys Town in Nebraska.  President Harry S. Truman visited Boys Town while on his western trip.  See also 66-662.

title: Rear view of parade on Truman's Western trip in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: Rear view of parade on Truman's Western trip in Omaha, Nebraska.   This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: Parade scene from Truman's Western trip, Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: Parade scene from Truman's Western trip, Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Lobby of Hotel Fontenelle with sign for President Truman
Scopenote: Lobby of the Hotel Fontenelle in Omaha, Nebraska, with hanging sign reading, "Hotel Fontenelle Welcomes President Truman".  This photograph is from a series of related pictures of President Truman's western trip.

title: World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman spoke at the dedication while on his western trip.

title: Hotel Fontenelle with welcoming sign for President Truman
Scopenote: Front of Hotel Fontenelle, in Omaha, Nebraska, with a sign on the marquee reading "Welcome Mr. President to the White House for a day."  This is from a series of photographs relating to President Truman's western trip.

title: World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: Soldiers standing at parade rest while at the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman attended the dedication while on his western trip.

title: President Truman walks in parade in Omaha during his Western trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks in parade in Omaha during his Western trip.  He is attending the reunion of the 35th Division.  This is from a series of photographs relating to President Truman's western trip.

title: Harry S. Truman on the steps of the First Baptist Church in Kearney, Nebraska
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman on the steps of the First Baptist Church in Kearney, Nebraska where he attended services.  This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: First Baptist Church in Kearney, Nebraska
Scopenote: First Baptist Church in Kearney, Nebraska, where President Truman attended services.  This is from a series of photographs relating to President Truman's western trip.

title: Crowd at Kearney, Nebraska
Scopenote: A crowd gathering for the arrival of President Truman at the train tracks in Kearney, Nebraska.  This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: People in front of Kearney, Nebraska Railroad Station
Scopenote: People gather in front of the Railroad Station in Kearney, Nebraska to hear President Harry S. Truman speak from the train.

title: President Truman in an Open Car in Sun Valley, Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) in an open car. Two unidentified men are in the car. They are in Sun Valley, Idaho.  See also 66-672.

title: Truman in car, escorted by miners
Scopenote: This is a picture of miners escorting President Harry S. Truman (behind the front right miner) in a car in Butte, Montana.  President Truman visited Butte while on his tour of western states.  See also 66-688.

title: Truman with officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits the Naval Ordnance Depot in Arco, Idaho. Standing beside the car, from left to right are: General Wallace Graham, Captain Robert Dennison, Captain C.H. Roper, President Truman, and Colonel Robert Landry. President Truman stopped in Arco while on his western trip. See also 66-684 and 2015-2171.

title: President Truman visiting Arco, Idaho
Scopenote: A crowd gathers to greet President Harry S. Truman (in white car, center) as he makes a visit to Arco, Idaho during his western trip (same as 2012-194).

title: President Truman in a Lift in Sun Valley Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat as he rides a lift at a resort in Sun Valley, Idaho. He is on his western trip through the United States.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides in Car in Butte, Montana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in back seat of car, left) rides in a car with an unidentified man while miners walk along side of the car in Butte, Montana.  President Truman visited Butte while on his tour of western states. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd gathered around Truman (in center of photo) in city street
Scopenote: Crowd present while President Harry S. Truman visited Blackfoot, Idaho during his western trip. See also 66-681 and 2012-352.

title: Upriver view of Grand Coulee Dam, looking north
Scopenote: The upriver side of Grand Coulee Dam, looking north. The thin straight line to the right of center is the top of the dam. A little bit of the town of Grand Coulee, Washington can be seen above the dam. This was probably taken during President Truman's western trip.

title: Columbia River flooding
Scopenote: A view of the Columbia river, taken from the bridge that goes across the top of the Grand Coulee Dam, looking north. This is the Columbia River during the 1948 flood. The flood is mentioned in President Truman's speech of June 9, 1948.

title: Crowd at Railroad Station in Washington State
Scopenote: A crowd gathers at the railroad station in Wenatchee, Washington to see President Harry S. Truman during his visit to Washington State. All are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman and Margaret at Dry Falls Overlook near Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman on a mountain observation platform with others at Dry Falls Overlook near Grand Coulee Dam. Margaret has back turned.

title: Harry S. Truman and Margaret at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman on a bridge in front of the Grand Coulee Dam in Washington. Margaret is second from left talking to Charles Ross; Bess is fourth from left; President Truman (back to camera) is at the right.

title: Truman During Visit to Grand Coulee Dam Area
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman traveling (sitting on back of seat, back turned) in his official car during his visit to the Grand Coulee Dam area. The President's car is headed northwest on Spokane Way in Grand Coulee, Washington. The car is approaching the intersection of Spokane Way and Main Street.

title: Truman's car on bridge of Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's official car on the bridge of the Grand Coulee Dam, taken during the President's visit to the dam. President Truman is not in this picture.

title: Harry S. Truman with Bess, Margaret, and others at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: During their visit to the Grand Coulee Dam, the Trumans stop on a bridge. This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman at Dry Falls Overlook
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) and his daughter, Margaret Truman (fourth from right, back to camera) and unidentified others take in the view on an observation platform at Dry Falls Overlook, near the Grand Coulee Dam, a stop on Truman's trip to the West Coast. This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: Banks, Wallgren, and Truman at the Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman points to the Grand Coulee Dam as he, Washington Governor Mon Wallgren (center) and Manager of the Columbia River District of the Bureau of Reclamation Frank A. Banks (left) view the dam from a bridge. The Dam was a stop on Truman's presidential campaign trip to the West Coast.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman and others at Dry Falls Overlook
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat as he, Margaret Truman (left) and unidentified others take in the view on an observation platform at Dry Falls Overlook, near the Grand Coulee Dam, a stop on Truman's trip to the West Coast. This is from a series of photographs of President Truman's western trip.

title: Truman Family and others on Bridge at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Washington Governor Mon Wallgren, and Manager of the Columbia River District of the Bureau of Reclamation Frank A. Banks bunched together on the right stand on a bridge overlooking the Grand Coulee Dam, Washington. Margaret Truman signs autographs near Charles Ross, and First Lady Bess Truman is at left. The visit to Grand Coulee was one of Truman's West Coast Presidential Campaign stops.

title: President Truman and Governor Wallgren on Bridge with Grand Coulee Dam in background
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Washington Governor Monrad Wallgren (both shown from behind) on a bridge with the Grand Coulee Dam in the background.

title: President Truman and Margaret Truman at the Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his daughter Margaret Truman are visiting the Grand Coulee Dam in the state of Washington on President Truman's western trip across the United States. An unidentified individual is between them on the observation platform.

title: Harry S. Truman and others on bridge of Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and others on bridge during his visit to the Grand Coulee Dam.

title: Harry S. Truman with others during visit to Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: Governor Mon Wallgren of Washington (left), President Harry S. Truman (second from left), Frank Arthur Banks (third from left, Manager of the Columbia River District of the Bureau of Reclamation), and other unidentified men are shown standing before the Columbia River during President Truman's visit to the Grand Coulee Dam, a stop on his presidential campaign trip to the West Coast.

title: Harry S. Truman and others on bridge at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others on bridge during his visit to the Grand Coulee Dam in Washington.

title: President Truman Harry S. Addresses a Crowd in Bremerton, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) addresses a crowd in front of the Elk's Club in Bremerton, Washington.  Same as 66-698.

title: President Truman campaigning in Seattle, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in car, closeup, Seattle, Washington, while on campaign tour.

title: Truman and others enter Washington Rehabilitation Center
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) holds a pair of scissors after participating in a ribbon-cutting ceremony at the Washington Rehabilitation Center in Seattle, Washington. General Wallace Graham in on the right. Governor Mon Wallgren is second from the right. All others are unidentified.

title: View of speakers platform and seats
Scopenote: View of speakers platform and seats from Memorial High School Stadium in Seattle, Washington. People in left and right backgrounds in bleachers.  President Harry S. Truman spoke at the stadium while on his tour of western states.  See also 66-709.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman in Seattle, Washington
Scopenote: Bess Wallace Truman and Margaret Truman in a car while with President Truman in Seattle, Washington on his Western Trip.  (L-R) Bess Wallace Truman; Mrs. Mabel Wallgren, wife of Washington Governor Mon C. Wallgren; Margaret Truman.

title: President Truman in a Parade in Seattle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in an open car in a parade in Seattle, Washington. A Secret Service man is in the front seat.  The President is on his western trip across the United States.  Same as 66-745.

title: President Truman in a Parade in Seattle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in an open car in a parade passing the Fourth and Pike Building in Seattle, Washington, during his western trip across the United States.

title: President Truman in a Parade in Seattle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in an open car in a motorcade in Seattle, Washington. He is traveling down 4th Avenue, with Hotel Mayflower, Sherman Clay & Co., and the Hotel Ritz visible on the street. He is on his western trip across the United States.

title: President Truman in a Parade in Seattle, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in an open car in a parade in Seattle, Washington. He is on his western trip through the United States.  Same as 66-706.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Seattle, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated on back of car) rides in an open-topped car during his West Coast Trip in Seattle, Washington. Also present, seated in the seat, is William F. Devin, Mayor of Seattle (center). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Viewing Flood at Vanport, Oregon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is with members of the press and military, viewing the Columbia River flood at Vanport, Oregon. The President is on his western tour of the United States.  Same as 2012-262.

title: President Truman Inspecting Flood Damage in Oregon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in Oregon inspecting flood damage. He is with a group of men who are not identified. President Truman is on his Western Trip.

title: President Truman In Oregon Inspecting Flood Damage
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, along with members of the press and military, inspect flood damage in Oregon.  President Truman is on his western trip.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman at a Train Station at Berkeley, California
Scopenote: Margaret Truman and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman are at a train station in Berkeley, California. Other people in the photo are not identified.  President Truman is to receive an honorary degree there.

title: President Truman Receives a Degree from The University of California at Berkeley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives his degree from the University of California at Berkeley in the football stadium. The President is wearing a cap and robe and approaching the podium. He is on his Western Trip.

title: Truman on rear platform of train as crowd watches
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on rear platform of train with people gathered around Roseville, California Railroad Station and train.

title: Margaret Truman at University of California, Berkeley Stadium
Scopenote: Miss Margaret Truman strikes a pose at an athletic field. Others in the photo remain unidentified. The photo is from the Truman Library Collection.

title: President Truman Receives a Degree from the University of California at Berkeley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is wearing a cap and gown to receives his degree from the University of California at Berkeley, in the football stadium. He is on his western trip.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Harry Vaughan, and Robert Dennison on the Rear Platform of a Train
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, General Harry Vaughan, and Naval Commander Robert Dennison stand on the rear platform of a train in Roseville, CA. They are traveling on President Truman's western trip. See also 2012-272.

title: President Truman Speaking at Berkeley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is speaking at the University of California at Berkeley, where he received an honorary degree in the football stadium.

title: President Truman In a Parade in Berkeley, California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in a parade in an open car. The parade is in Berkley, California during the President's western trip.

title: A Young Man Holding Political Buttons
Scopenote: A young man is being held aloft by his friends in Berkeley, California at the train station. He is holding buttons that read: "We Want Truman To Nominate Ike." President Harry S. Truman (not in photo) is visiting Berkeley during his western trip across the United States.  See 66-727 for same photo.

title: President Truman Receives A Degree From the University of California at Berkeley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a degree from the University of California, Berkeley. They are in the football field. First Lady Bess Truman can be seen in the photo. President Truman is on his western trip.

title: Truman on Rear Platform of Train in Davis, California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on the rear platform of a train in Davis, California. A crowd has gathered. See also 66-723, 98-1256.

title: President Harry S. Truman in motorcade in California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on back of a car in a motorcade, in front of a business named Harry's. He is in California during his western trip.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Crowd at Flag Day Ceremonies at Golden Gate Park
Scopenote: A large crowd is assembled in to hear President Harry S. Truman (not visible) speak at Flag Day Ceremonies at Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. President Truman is on his Western trip.

title: President Truman Speaking at Golden Gate Park
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, California during Flag Day ceremonies. He is on his western trip.

title: President Truman Addresses Flag Day Ceremonies at Golden Gate Park
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, California, speaking during Flag Day ceremonies. He is on his western trip.

title: A Group of News Personnel at Golden Gate Park
Scopenote: This photo shows a group of reporters at Flag Day Ceremonies in Golden Gate Part in San Francisco, California. President Harry S. Truman (not in photo) is attending the ceremony during his Western trip.

title: President Truman Speaking at Greater Los Angeles Press Club Banquet
Scopenote: This photo shows President Harry S. Truman addressing an audience at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Banquet. He is on his Western Trip.

title: President Truman and First Lady Bess Truman at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess Truman at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Banquet at the Ambassador Hotel. A large cake is being presented to them (they are seated at table).  They are on President Truman's Western trip.

title: President Truman at Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (waving) at a luncheon of the Greater Los Angeles Press Club at the Ambassador Hotel. First Lady Bess Truman is at left.

title: President Truman at Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman Leaving a the table at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club luncheon.  He is on his western trip through the United States.

title: President Truman's Motorcade in Los Angeles
Scopenote: Motorcade escorting President Harry S. Truman down Wilshire Blvd. in Los Angeles, California. President Truman (not visible in photo) is on his western trip through the United States.  See also 66-740.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reviews Troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviews troops in Los Angeles. He is on his Western Trip.

title: President Truman and Family Greet Officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman greet officers while on a trip to Los Angeles, California. All three are difficult to see in this photo. Margaret Truman's face can be seen between the fourth and fifth officers.  Harry and Bess can be seen standing between the third and fourth officers. President Truman is on his western trip.

title: General Mark Clark at the Press Club Banquet
Scopenote: In this photo of one of the tables at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club luncheon, General Mark Clark (center) stands with other dignitaries. The luncheon was held in the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles. President Truman, on his western trip, spoke at this luncheon.

title: President Truman at Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses an audience at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon. He is in San Francisco California, at Golden Gate Park. This photo is from the Truman Library Collection.

title: President Truman in a Group of Officers
Scopenote: A group of officers with President Harry S. Truman (not visible) in Los Angeles, California. He is on his Western trip.

title: Greater Los Angeles Press Club Cake and Baker
Scopenote: This is a photo of the Greater Los Angeles Press Club luncheon cake and it's baker. The photo was taken in at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles,  California. President Truman addressed the luncheon during his western trip.

title: President Truman at the Los Angeles Press Club Banquet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) chats with a fellow attendee of the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Banquet. The President's daughter, Margaret Truman can be seen at right.

title: President Truman Reviews Troops in Los Angeles
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on his trip to the West Coast participates in a parade and inspects troops in Los Angeles. This is view from the back.

title: President Truman at a Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) at a luncheon with the Greater Los Angeles Press Club at the Ambassador Hotel. First Lady Bess Truman is at left.  Others are unidentified.  This was taken during President Truman's western trip through the United States.

title: Rose Conway, Harry Vaughn and Others at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Luncheon
Scopenote: Staff of President Harry S. Truman at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club luncheon.  They accompanied the President on his western trip.  Left to right, far side of table:  General Robert Landry; the President's personal secretary Rose  Conway; Clark Clifford; (around table counter clockwise) Press Secretary Charles Ross (partially obscured); two unidentified women; General Wallace Graham (the President's physician); General Harry Vaughan; and political associate Albert Chow.  See also 66-757.

title: President Truman in a Parade in Los Angeles
Scopenote: Rear view of the motorcade with President Harry S. Truman (not visible), apparently through Los Angeles, California.  This visit was during President Truman's western trip.  See also 59-303.

title: Margaret Truman at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club Banquet
Scopenote: Margaret Truman seated at the head table at the Greater Los Angeles Press Club luncheon. The luncheon was held at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles. The men are unidentified.  She is accompanying her father on his western trip.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Navajo Rug from Chief Joe Deerfoot
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives Navajo rug from Chief Joe Deerfoot on a whistlestop in Gallup, New Mexico.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Harry S. Truman and Clinton P. Anderson campaigning
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Clinton P. Anderson campaigning at Gallup, New Mexico.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Harry S. Truman in Car in Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat while standing in a car. A crowd gathers in the background.  President Truman is stopping in Kansas City, Missouri on his route back to Washington, D. C. from his western trip.  See also 66-770.

title: Crowd around train in Warrensburg, Missouri
Scopenote: A crowd has formed around President Truman's train in Warrensburg, Missouri.  This photo is from his western trip.

title: President Truman on the rear platform of his train in East St. Louis, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of his train in East St. Louis, Missouri.  He is speaking, with others, to a crowd gathered around the train.  This photo is from President Truman's western trip.

title: Truman waving from a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) waves from the back of the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948.  The man standing next to President Truman on the right General Wallace Graham.  All other men are unidentified.    Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Truman on the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) speaks to other (unidentified) passengers on the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948.  The man next to President Truman on the right is General Wallace Graham.  Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Truman waves from the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) waves from the back of the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948.  Standing next to President Truman on the right is General Wallace Graham.  Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Crowd meeting train in Warrensburg, Missouri
Scopenote: Crowd meeting train at Warrensburg, Missouri.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Crowd in Indianapolis, Indiana
Scopenote: Crowd in Indianapolis, Indiana, waiting for President Harry S. Truman's appearance.  This photo was taken during President Truman's western trip.

title: Truman on the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) on the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948.  All other men unidentified.  Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Truman on the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) speaks from the back of the Presidential train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948.  On the right is President Truman's physician, General Wallace Graham.  Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Crowd in Indianapolis, Indiana
Scopenote: Crowd in Indianapolis, Indiana, awaiting President Harry S. Truman's appearance.  This photo was taken during President Truman's western trip.

title: Truman speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana, from the back of a train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left, speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana, from the back of a train, with several unidentified men.

title: Truman in Terre Haute, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, foreground, speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana, with unidentified man behind him.

title: Truman speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at left, speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana.  Edward E. Everette stands at the right.

title: Crowd gathered around President Truman's train in Jefferson City, Missouri
Scopenote: Crowd gathered around President Harry S. Truman's train in Jefferson City, Missouri.  This was taken during President Truman's western trip.

title: President Truman speaking on the rear platform of his train in East St. Louis, Illinois
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking on the rear platform of his train in East St. Louis, Illinois.  There are several gentlemen with him on the platform. This photo is from his western trip.

title: Crowd gathering at railroad station behind the fence
Scopenote: A large crowd starts to gather at a railroad station in anticipation of President Truman's visit during his western trip.

title: Truman in Terre Haute, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, second from left, speaking in Terre Haute, Indiana.  Others in the photo are Edward E. Everette, third from left, and Miss Dolores Letzkus, along with two unidentified men.

title: Truman on the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) waits to speak from the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948. The man behind President Truman on the right is General Wallace Graham. Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Truman on the back of a train in Sedalia, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) stands on the back of the Presidential Train at a stop in Sedalia, Missouri, June 1948. All other men are unidentified. The man in the hat on the right (party obscured) is General Wallace Graham. Donor: Sam Highlyman, Sedalia Lodge No. 125, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Sedalia, Missouri.

title: Smith, Flack and Evans
Scopenote: Standing from left to right: Bryce Smith (former mayor of Kansas City, Missouri), Joseph Flack and Tom Evans.

title: Truman shakes hands with Gallegos
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) shakes hands with Romulo Gallegos, President of Venezuela (fourth from left).  First Lady Bess Truman looks on (second from left).  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos meeting at an airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) speaks with Romulo Gallegos (left), President of Venezuela, at an airport in 1948.  First Lady Bess Truman (fourth from right) speaks with others behind.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos stand at attention at an airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front right) and Romulo Gallegos (front left), President of Venezuela, stand at attention while others salute.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Military parade with Truman looking on
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (first person to the right of the podium) looks on while the United States flag passes in front of a grandstand.

title: Truman and Gallegos walk in front of military units
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) and Romulo Gallegos (fourth from left), President of Venezuela, review troops at an airport on July 1, 1948.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos stand at podium in front of a plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center-right) and Romulo Gallegos (center-left), President of Venezuela, prepare to speak at an airport on July 1, 1948.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos wait to speak at airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center-right) stands beside Romulo Gallegos (center-left), President of Venezuela, as he speaks at an airport, July 1, 1948.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos ride in car at airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Romulo Gallegos (left), President of Venezuela, ride in the back of a car at an airport on July 1, 1948.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Officers at Airport
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom Clark (fourth from left); Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (third from right); Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (second from right) and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (right) outside an airport, July 1, 1948.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Parade Queen sits in a chair in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: A young woman, evidently the queen of the parade, poses for a photo with flowers and a crown in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Statue of Simon Bolivar
Scopenote: A photograph of the statue of Simon Bolivar which stands in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: A couple dances at a celebration in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: A young couple dances as others look on while at a celebration in Bolivar, Missouri.  All in photograph are unidentified.

title: President Truman giving a speech in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving a speech in Bolivar, Missouri, at the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Gallegos speaks in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: Venezuelan President, Romulo Gallegos, speaks in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman at a Parade in Bolivar
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, on stage - front right, and Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, on stage - front left, watch a band pass during a parade in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Presidents Romulo Gallegos and Harry S. Truman Hold Ceremonial Keys
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) and President Harry S. Truman (right) hold ceremonial keys while on the back of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri. Second from the left is Governor of Missouri Phil Donnelly. Second from the right is Dr. Doyle C. McCraw, Mayor of Bolivar, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman in an Open Car in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in back seat of car, right) riding in an open car during a stop in Bolivar, Missouri, where he spoke at the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar. With him is the President of Venezuela, Romulo Gallegos (back seat, left), and the Mayor of Bolivar, Dr. Doyle C. McCraw (center). All others are unidentified.

title: Statue of Simon Bolivar at Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: Statue of Simon Bolivar at Bolivar, Missouri. Autograph at bottom says:  "To the President:  Statue of Simon Bolivar, dedicated at Bolivar, Mo., July 5, 1948, Simon Bolivar Memorial Foundation housing [?] in D. C., March 1, 1950, John H. Crane, Historian."

title: View from Presidential Train in Willard, MO
Scopenote: The view from President Harry S. Truman's train as it travels through Willard, Missouri.

title: View from Presidential Train in Willard, MO
Scopenote: The view from the Presidential Train as it travels through Willard, Missouri.

title: Truman walks beside train in Willard, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, second from right, walks beside the Presidential Train in Willard, Missouri.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos Stand on the Back of the Presidential Train in Bolivar
Scopenote: Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, left, and President Harry S. Truman, second from right, stand on the back of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri.  On the right is Major General Harry Vaughan. Second from the left is Dr. Doyle C. McCraw, Mayor of Bolivar.

title: Truman Stands With Gallegos at a Dedication Ceremony in Bolivar
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, second from left, stands with Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, left, at a dedication ceremony for a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri in July 1948.

title: Truman stands at attention in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, left, stands at attention while at a ceremony in Bolivar, Missouri. Also present are Mayor of Bolivar, Dr. Doyle C. McCraw (center rear); and Governor of Missouri, Phil Donnelly (right rear). President Truman is in Bolivar for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Crowd in Bolivar, Missouri gathered for President Truman's campaign speech
Scopenote: Crowd in Bolivar, Missouri gathered for President Harry S. Truman's campaign speech.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman and Others in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (standing, left), Margaret Truman (seated, left), and Mary Jane Truman (seated, right) attend a luncheon in Bolivar, Missouri, in honor of the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar. All others are unidentified.

title: Simon Bolivar statue is unveiled in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: A statue of Simon Bolivar is unveiled at a ceremony in Bolivar, Missouri in July 1948.  Onlookers include Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, left of statue with back turned.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos Sitting in a Convertible
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left), and Mayor Doyle C. McCraw of Bolivar, Missouri (center) are sitting in a convertible, with other cars and a crowd in the background in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman speaks with an unidentified man in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, right, speaks with an unidentified man at a ceremony in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman is in Bolivar for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: President Truman and Romulo Gallegos on the Rear of the Presidential Train
Scopenote: From left to right, President of Venezuela Romulo Gallegos, First Lady Bess Truman, unidentified woman, and President Harry S. Truman, wave from the back of the Presidential Train.  They are in Bolivar, Missouri, for the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: President Truman and two unidentified gentlemen on the Presidential train in Willard, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the Presidential train at a campaign stop in Willard, Missouri.  The other gentlemen on the train platform with him are unidentified.

title: President Truman in Willard, Missouri
Scopenote: President Truman on the Presidential train at a campaign stop in Willard, Missouri.

title: Twirlers march in a parade in Bolivar, MO
Scopenote: Baton twirlers march in a 4th of July parade in Bolivar, Missouri, 1948, during the festivities surrounding the dedication of the Simon Bolivar statue.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos at a Ceremony in Bolivar
Scopenote: Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, left, and President Harry S. Truman, right, stand at attention at a ceremony in Bolivar, Missouri.  The man in the center is Dr. Doyle C. McCraw, Mayor of Bolivar.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos with Keys
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) and President Harry S. Truman (right) hold ceremonial keys while on the back of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri. Standing in the middle is Dr. Doyle C. McCraw, the Mayor of Bolivar.

title: Man Speaks at a Ceremony in Bolivar
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at a ceremony in Bolivar, Missouri, while Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, front row second from left, and President Harry S. Truman, front row third from left, look on.

title: Overview photograph of the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia at which President Harry S. Truman spoke
Scopenote: The Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia at which President Harry S. Truman spoke.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Truman addresses Democratic Party Convention in 1948
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, center, delivers his acceptance speech at the Convention Hall in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 1948.

title: Harry S. Truman, George Harrison, and J. Howard McGrath

title: President Truman greets and thanks representatives of the CIO Executive Board
Scopenote: President Truman greets and thanks representatives of the CIO Executive Board which endorsed his candidacy for re-election in November.  L to R:  [front] James B. Carey, Secretary Treasurer of CIO; President Truman; Philip Murray, CIO President; [rear] Emil Mazey, Secretary-Treasurer, UAW; Jack Kroll, PAC Director; and Emil Rieve, President of Textile Workers Union.  Mazey and Rieve are partially hidden.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton  Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Harry S. Truman, Adolf A. Berle, and Alex Rose
Scopenote: Left to Right:  President Harry S. Truman, Adolf A. Berle (Chairman of the Liberal Party of New York, standing) and Alex Rose with the American Federation of Labor and the Liberal Party. They watch Truman sign a document in the oval office.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Harry S. Truman, John Nance Garner, and Farmer with a Goat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with former Vice President John Nance Garner seated in a car during a campaign visit to Uvalde, TX. Donor: Dorothy Girton. Used by Democratic Digest.

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Girl Scout in Yonkers, New York
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) with eleven-year old Girl Scout Carol Bayerschmidt (foreground, right) in Yonkers, New York.  Carol pins a red feather on the President's lapel at Larkin Plaza, in connection with the Community Chest drive. All others are unidentified.
