title: Truman with a child at campaign celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman bends down to shake hands with two-year-old Walter S. Hummel of Independence, Missouri, upon the President's arrival at the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence to be the guest of honor at a victory rally staged by his fellow townsmen.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri for Victory Celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing on the steps of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri for the 1948 presidential victory celebration. It was held in the evening. President Truman is at the microphone in the center. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman shaking hands with small child
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman bends down to shake hands with two-year-old Walter S. Hummel of Independence, Missouri, upon the President's arrival at the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence to be the guest of honor at a victory rally staged by his fellow townsmen. Donor: Dorothy Girton.

title: Crowd in front of the north portico of the White House, waiting for President Truman to return to the White House after the 1948 election
Scopenote: Crowd in front of the White House, with band on the front lawn, waiting for President Truman and Vice President Barkley's motorcade to return after the 1948 election. This photograph was part of a series of related photographs described as "President Harry S. Truman on the campaign trail in 1948."

title: President Harry S. Truman in motorcade in Washington, D. C., passing the Capitol Building
Scopenote: President Truman in motorcade in Washington, D. C. with Alben Barkley beside him, and their families in the car.  This was taken during their return to Washington, D. C. after the election.  This is part of a series of related photographs described as "President Harry S. Truman on the campaign trail in 1948."

title: Truman Family in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman outside on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. President Truman is on vacation after winning the 1948 presidential election.

title: Truman family in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace Truman, and Margaret Truman outdoors in Key West, Florida.  From left to right: Bess Truman, President Truman, and Margaret.  In the lower right corner are the backs of the heads of other photographers.

title: Kyril Vassilev painting Mr. Truman's portrait
Scopenote: President Truman is posing for artist Kyril Vassilev on a porch of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Bess Wallace Truman autographed portrait
Scopenote: Autographed portrait of Bess Wallace Truman.

title: W.B. Miller, Boonville, Missouri, with turnips
Scopenote: W.B. Miller with turnips. Mr. Miller sowed his turnip seeds on July 26, 1948, after President Truman declared "turnip day" and called the 80th Congress back into session.  These are his crops.  Mr. Miller is from Boonville, Missouri.

title: Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman, 1948
Scopenote: Informal portraits taken of First Lady Bess Wallace Truman and daughter Margaret Truman at the Blair House in 1948.

title: Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman, 1948
Scopenote: Informal portraits of First Lady Bess Wallace Truman and daughter Margaret Truman at the Blair House in 1948.

title: Harry S. Truman with Members of the Press
Scopenote: The Truman Early Risers Walking Society of Independence, Missouri. Harry S. Truman with Milton Freier, Arthur E. Scott, Jack Bernett, Bill Chaplin, Joe Fox, Warren Duffee, Frank Rowyhaltzen, James Porter, Tony Vaccaro, and Felix Cotten.  They are members of the press who covered President Truman's Christmas trip to Independence, Missouri.  Signed by all members of the group.   Original Photograph Oversized.

title: Harry S. Truman and others, including Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn
Scopenote: Seated, in the oval office, looking at a document are, left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Congressman John W. McCormack (standing), Senator Scott Lucas, and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn.    Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Portrait of Matthew J. Connelly, Secretary to the President
Scopenote: Portrait of Matthew J. Connelly, Secretary to the President.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Portrait of General Wallace H. Graham, Physician to the President
Scopenote: Portrait of General Wallace H. Graham, Physician to the President, U.S. Air Force Reserve.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Military family
Scopenote: This a photograph of a military family standing in front of their housing unit in Anchorage, Alaska. The house has no plumbing or running water.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Rental dwelling in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, an officer lives in one-fourth of the basement of this house in a room 12' by 13'.  The rent is $60.00 per month with no privileges.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Shack and trailer in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, this shack and trailer are occupied by two separate military families.  There is no running water or plumbing in either place.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Officer's house in Alaska
Scopenote: In Nome, Alaska, this house is occupied by an officer, his wife and two children.  There is no plumbing and the rent is $50.00 per month plus utilities.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Apartments in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, this building, occupied mostly by military personnel, contains 13 apartments: 6 rent for $85.00 (2 rooms), 1 rents for $70.00 (2 rooms), 1 rents for $75.00 (2 rooms), 2 rent for $80.00 (2 rooms), 3 rent for $90.00 (3 rooms) making a total of $1085.00 per month plus utilities.  There is only one toilet per floor and the building has been condemned three different times by the city of Anchorage.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Library of Congress
Scopenote: The Library of Congress, located on Capitol Hill, adjacent to the Supreme Court building. Created originally to provide specialized reference service for the members of Congress, the institution, because of its vast resources, has developed into the National Library of the United States.

title: Portrait of Raymond M. Foley
Scopenote: Portrait of Raymond M. Foley, Administrator, Housing and Finance Agency.  Original photograph oversized.

title: Portrait of Walter Bedell Smith
Scopenote: Portrait of General Walter Bedell Smith, Ambassador to Union of Soviet Socialist Republics and the Director of Central Intelligence.   Original photograph oversized.

title: Broken Beam Under Margaret Truman's Sitting Room
Scopenote: A photograph of a split beam under the room Margaret Truman occupied as a sitting room while in the White House.  From the "Report of the Commission on the Renovation of the Executive Mansion."

title: Portrait of John Steelman
Scopenote: Portrait of John R. Steelman, Assistant to the President.

title: Retail coal yard of Schaefer Suhr Coal Company
Scopenote: Photograph of the retail coal yard of the Schaefer Suhr Coal Company in Cleveland, Ohio.  This photograph was taken during the coal strike of 1949.

title: Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman with others
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman standing with unidentified people at an unknown event.  They are probably attending a Democratic party function, as Dorothy Girton was a member of the Democratic Women's Committee.    Donated by Dorothy Girton.

title: Apartments housing officers in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, these are three surplus military buildings converted into 26 apartment units of two rooms each.  Two-thirds of the apartments are occupied by military personnel, mostly captains, majors, and lieutenant colonels.  The rent is $125.00 per month plus utilities.  To secure one of these apartments it is necessary to pay a $750.00 guarantee.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Lieutenant's house in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, this two room plywood house is occupied by an 1st Lieutenant, his wife and child.  Rent is $60.00 per month plus utilities. The woman and child in the photo are unidentified.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Log cabin in Alaska
Scopenote: In Anchorage, Alaska, this one room log cabin with a false front, occupied by military personnel, rents for $60.00 per month.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

Scopenote: Harry S. Truman is having lunch with various members of his cabinet.  L to R:  James Forrestal; Dean Acheson; unidentified man; Harry S. Truman; unidentified man, with back to camera; Julius Krug.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used by Democratic Digest.

Foley of the United States State Department Treaty Affairs Department, stand watching him.  People in the background are not identified.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.

title: Dean Acheson speaks at opening of North Atlantic Treaty Organization signing ceremony
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson speaks at the opening of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization signing ceremony in Washington, D.C.  Seated in semi-circle behind him are foreign ministers (first row), and ambassadors of signing countries.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.

Scopenote: Ernest Bevin signs North Atlantic Treaty as Harry S. Truman and Dean Acheson look on.   Donor:  Dorothy Girton

title: President Harry S. Truman throwing the first baseball on opening day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throwing the first baseball on opening day at the game between the Washington Senators and Philadelphia Athletics.  Joe Kuhel, baseball player, is at right.  Vice President Alben Barkley is at far left; Bess Truman is third from left.

title: Visit of President Aleman to Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: President Miguel Aleman of Mexico at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Centennial Banquet and the Trumans

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives the Key to the City of Little Rock, Arkansas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives the key to the city of Little Rock, Arkansas from Arkansas Governor Sid McMath (center) and an unidentified man on the right. This event probably took place while President Truman was in Little Rock for a 35th Division Reunion.  The unidentified man is likely Sam Wassall, the Mayor of Little Rock.

title: General Marshall with namesake
Scopenote: Pictured are an unidentified woman, unidentified man, George Marshall Tarapata, unidentified woman, and General George C. Marshall.

title: Joe Guilfoyle, Harry S. Truman's godson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's godson, Joe Guilfoyle, 20 months. The age typed on the photograph is incorrect; Joe Guilfoyle was born on December 5, 1947.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing the Armed Forces Unification Bill with guests. From left to right, Senator Richard B. Russell, unidentified admiral, General Omar Nelson Bradley, Louis A. Johnson, General Hoyt Sanford Vandenberg, Senator Styles Bridges, unidentified male, unidentified male, Fred M. Vinson, Stuart Symington, Stephen T. Early, and John W. Snyder.

title: Speakers on the nation-wide Democratic Women's Day broadcast
Scopenote: Speaking on the nation-wide Democratic Women's Day broadcast were Mrs. George London, Mrs. Albert C. Hulihan, President Harry S. Truman, and Mrs. Elsie West.  Donor:  Democratic Digest

title: Sam Rayburn, Harry S. Truman, Alben Barkley, and William Boyle
Scopenote: Left to right:  Sam Rayburn, Harry S. Truman, Alben Barkley, and William Boyle.  Truman has his hands on the arms of Rayburn and Barkley. This was taken at the dinner in honor of William Boyle in Kansas City.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.

title: Harry S. Truman at the testimonial dinner for William Boyle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman applauding at the testimonial dinner for William Boyle, seated next to him, in Kansas City, Missouri.    Donor: Dorothy Girton.

title: Sherman Minton is Sworn in as Associate Justice of the Supreme Court
Scopenote: Sherman Minton shakes hands with President Harry S. Truman and Chief Justice Fred Vinson after being sworn in as Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. People in background are unidentified. Donor: Dorothy Girton. Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Truman speaking at United Nations General Assembly cornerstone ceremony
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman is addressing the first outdoor session of the 59-nation United Nations General Assembly during the cornerstone ceremony for the building in New York City. Seated, left to right: Wallace K. Harrison, United Nations Director of Planning; Ambassador M. C. de Freitas-Valle of Brazil; Dr. Tingfu F. Tsiang of China; Jean Chauvel of France; Sir Mohammed Zafrulia Khan of Pakistan; Governor Thomas Dewey of New York; Mayor William O'Dwyer of New York City; Andrei Y. Vishinsky of Russia. Donor: Dorothy Girton. Used by Democratic Digest.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Others on Truman Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) shakes hands with three people at a Truman Day celebration in Minneapolis, Minnesota. With him is Orville Freeman (second from left), State Chairman of the Democratic-Farm-Labor Party. Others are unidentified. Two of the people are wearing Truman Day ribbons.  Donor:  Dorothy Girton.  Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Harry S. Truman speaking at Woman's National Democratic Club Banquet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is speaking at a Woman's National Democratic Club banquet.  Six people are at the head table.  Bess Wallace Truman is second from the left.  Mr. Truman is third from the right.  The others are unidentified.  People in the audience are also unidentified. Donor:  Dorothy Girton. Used by Democratic Digest.

title: Mary Jane Truman at a Scottish Rite Reunion

title: Part of Kitchen Garden at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Part of the large kitchen garden at Mount Vernon, Virginia. This the home of George Washington, the first President of the United States. The fig bushes along the North wall were planted by Washington.

title: Washington Monument
Scopenote: The Washington Monument, a towering marble obelisk 555 feet high. The cornerstone was laid in 1848; the obelisk was completed in 1855. At the height of 504 feet the walls are pierced with eight windows, two in each face. This observation deck can be reached by a stairway of 900 steps or by an elevator.

title: Supreme Court Justices photograph with autographs
Scopenote: Supreme Court Justices pictured in the front row, left to right, are Felix Frankfurter, Hugo L. Black, Fred M. Vinson, Stanley F. Reed, and William O. Douglas.  Justices pictured in the back row, left to right, are Tom Clark, Robert H. Jackson, Harold H. Burton, and Sherman Minton.

title: Hildegarde and Eddie Cantor - National Fire Prevention week, 1950
Scopenote: Hildegarde and Eddie Cantor - National Fire Prevention week, 1950

title: Tomb of Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. The tomb erected in 1931, holds the body of an unidentified soldier who gave his life in World War I. It is cut from a single rectangular block of marble, 16 feet in length, 9 feet in width, and 11 feet in height. On the rear panel is inscribed "Here rests in honored glory an American Soldier known but to God."

title: Department of State Building
Scopenote: Originally designed as the headquarters for the Department of the Army, the building has been occupied by the United States Department of State since 1947.

title: Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: The Lincoln Memorial, a tribute to Abraham Lincoln, 16th President of the United States. The roof is supported by 36 fluted Doric columns of white marble representing the 36 states which constituted the Union at the time of Lincoln's death.

title: Photo of a "Presidential Suite" plaque at the Hotel Muehlebach
Scopenote: Photo of a "Presidential Suite" plaque at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri. Harry S. Truman is pictured on the plaque. The plaque commemorates the ratification of the Bonn Convention which opened the way for German participation in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. The ratification occurred in the Penthouse Suite of the Hotel Muehlebach on August 2, 1952. Donor: Robert T. Weatherford
Institutional Creator: Randazzo & Morrison, Inc., Kansas City, MO

Donor: Robert T. Weatherford

title: The Blair House
Scopenote: The Blair House, located adjacent from the White House, is the official guest house of the United States. It was the former home of the Blair family who occupied it for over one hundred years. It was purchased by the Blair family in 1836 from the Lovell estate. Doctor Lovell was the first Surgeon General of the Army. The Blair House was the temporary home of President Truman while the White House was undergoing repairs.

title: President Truman meets with Anthony Eden, Dean Acheson, and Winston Churchill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) meeting with, from left to right, Anthony Eden, Dean Acheson, and Winston Churchill.  They are having a conference on board the U. S. S. Williamsburg.

Leahy; Bucky Harris, manager of Senators; Lou Boudreau, manager of the Red Sox.

Scopenote: Polish-American leaders presenting plaque to President Truman at the Hotel Biltmore in New York. L-R: Reverend Joseph Swaltek, Right Reverend Felix Burant, Congressman Alfred Sieminski, President Harry S. Truman, Alexander Sudnik, and Thaddeus Maliszewski.
Related Collection: White House Central Files: Official File

title: Harry S. Truman playing the piano in the Presidential Penthouse of the Hotel Muehlebach
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman playing the piano in the Presidential Penthouse of the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri. Donor: Robert T. Weatherford

title: Loading truck for food/toy drive
Scopenote: Students from Moscow High School in Moscow, Idaho load boxes of food and toys to be sent to Korean orphanages and children's hospitals onto a truck.  Pictured are Jerry Knapp, Mickey McCarty, Richard Koster, and Don Bellomy.

title: Packing gift boxes for Korean children
Scopenote: Students from Moscow High School in Moscow, Idaho pack boxes of toys and food for shipment to Korean orphanages and children's hospitals. Pictured are, in front, Garry Stubbs, Shermin Snow, Don Miller, Jack Reams, and Mickey McCarty. In the background, Theodora Smith.

title: Loading truck for food/gift drive
Scopenote: Students of Moscow High School in Moscow, Idaho load a truck full of gifts for children in Korean orphanages and hospitals. Pictured are Mickey McCarty in the truck and unidentified students.

title: Packing gifts for Korean orphanages
Scopenote: Armistice Day food and toy drive for Korean orphanages and children's hospitals held by Moscow High School in Moscow, Idaho. Pictured are, in front, Karen Lee, Sharon Johnson, and Freddy Nordby. In rear, Ernest Lee, Clarence Johnson, and Theodora Smith.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Painting of Harry S. Truman by Arthur E. Scott.    Donor: Dorothy Girton.

title: The Wishing Tree
Scopenote: The famous 'Wishing Tree,' the only tree of its kind in the world, made of over 1,000 'wish bones' of various fowl consumed by the family during the past 50 years.  Harry Kleine is standing by the tree.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: Harry S. Truman's arrival in Independence, Missouri after he left office
Scopenote: This photo shows the arrival of Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri after he left office.  Donor:  Robert T. Weatherford, Mayor of Independence

title: Captain Dennison
Scopenote: Captain Robert L. Dennison is shown in uniform on board a battleship.  A hand-written note reads "To the honorable Harry S. Truman with deep respect and warm regard from Robert L. Dennison U.S.S Baltimore 16 April 1953".

title: Former President Truman at ribbon-cutting ceremony, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Independence, Missouri Mayor Robert P. Weatherford, at the microphone, and Harry S. Truman at the ribbon-cutting ceremony opening a new section of Truman Road, at the corner of Truman and Main.

title: Harry S. Truman at ribbon-cutting ceremonies opening a new section of Truman Road at the corner of Truman Road and Main
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman at ribbon-cutting ceremonies opening a new section of Truman Road at the corner of Truman Road and Main.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: President Harry S. Truman and Robert Weatherford at ribbon-cutting for Truman Road
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman cutting ribbon and Mayor Robert P. Weatherford to his immediate right at ribbon-cutting ceremonies opening a new section of Truman Road through Independence, Missouri.  They are at the corner of Truman and Main.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Truman with O'Connor
Scopenote: A photograph of former President Harry S. Truman (right) with Basil O'Connor (left) touring the construction grounds at the future home of the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Aerial view of Truman Library site
Scopenote: This photo is an aerial view of Slover Park in Independence, Missouri, site of the future Harry S. Truman Library.  Donor:  Robert T. Weatherford, Mayor of Independence

title: Aerial view of Truman Library site
Scopenote: This photo is an aerial view of Slover Park in Independence, Missouri, the future site of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Donor:  Robert T. Weatherford, Mayor of Independence

title: Former President Truman at Battery D Meeting
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman attending Battery D 36th Anniversary meeting at Muehlebach Brewing Company, Cypress Room.  Mr. Truman is likely the fifth person from the left in the back row.
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Harry S. Truman observing Churchill's photo in exhibit case at Westminster College
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman observing Winston Churchill's photo in an exhibit case; photo is autographed by Winston Churchill "To Harry S. Truman from his comrade in the war and his friend and advisor. Winston Churchill, May 1954." This photo was taken at Westminster College, Fulton, Missouri, while Mr. Truman was in the Churchill Room at the college library. Mr. Truman was giving a lecture at Westminster College.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Syngman Rhee
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) is shaking hands with the first President of the Republic of Korea (South Korea) Syngman Rhee. Mrs. Bess Truman can be seen standing beside her husband.  They are at the Truman home in Independence, Missouri. Others in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman, Stevenson, and others on porch
Scopenote: From left to right, Adlai Stevenson, Stanley Woodward, former President Harry S. Truman, Charles S. Murphy, and Stephen Mitchell on the front porch of Truman home in Independence, Missouri.

title: Adlai Stevenson, Mr. and Mrs. Truman
Scopenote: From left to right, Adlai Stevenson, Bess Wallace Truman, and former President Harry S. Truman in back seat of a car in Independence, Missouri.

title: Truman seated with Stephen Mitchell and Adlai Stevenson
Scopenote: From left to right, Stephen Mitchell, Harry S. Truman and Adlai Stevenson sitting on a couch, probably in Kansas City.

title: Truman and Stevenson at Truman home
Scopenote: From left to right, former President Harry S. Truman and Adlai Stevenson at the Truman home in Independence, Missouri.

title: Truman, Averell Harriman and Paul M. Butler at Muehlebach Hotel
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) with Averell Harriman (left) and Paul M. Butler (right). This was taken at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. They are going to attend a Democratic dinner.

title: Tom Evans and Averell Harriman alighting from car
Scopenote: Averell Harriman (right) exiting a car with Tom Evans. They are at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri and will be attending a Democratic dinner.

title: Truman, Acheson, and Basil O'Connor at Truman Library site
Scopenote: A smiling former President Harry S. Truman (center) with Dean Acheson (left) and Basil O'Connor (right) at the future home of the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Truman, Acheson and others at Truman Library construction site
Scopenote: From left to right, Basil O'Connor, Alonzo Gentry, former President Harry S. Truman, Dean Acheson, and David Lloyd are seen listening to Mr. Gentry explain something to the group while they visit the future home of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Mr. Gentry is one of the architects who helped design the Truman Library.

title: Harry S. Truman, Dean Acheson and Others at Truman Library Site
Scopenote: David Lloyd (second from left), Dean Acheson (third from left), Basil O'Connor (fourth from left), Alonzon Gentry (third from right), Tom Evans (second from right), and former President Harry S. Truman (right) are gathered in a semi-circle talking at the construction site of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Mr. Gentry is one of the architects who helped design the Library.  The first man to the left is unidentified.

title: Truman, Acheson, and Others touring Truman Library construction site
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor (front of line), former President Harry S. Truman (second), Dean Acheson (third in line), Tom Evans (following Acheson, head is down), David Lloyd (left of Acheson), and Alonzo Gentry (following Mr. Lloyd) walk on some boards at the construction site of the Harry S. Truman Library. Mr. Gentry is one of the architects who helped design the Library.  The photographer on the left is unidentified.

title: Truman, Acheson, and others at Truman Library site
Scopenote: From left to right, Dean Acheson, David Lloyd (behind Acheson), Tom Evans, Basil O'Connor, former President Harry S. Truman, and Alonzo Gentry at the construction site of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Mr. Gentry is one of the architects who helped design the Library.

title: Truman and others at Truman Library site
Scopenote: Dean Acheson (left), former President Harry S. Truman (center), and Basil O'Connor (right) looking around the Harry S. Truman Library construction site.

title: Tom Evans, Stuart Symington, and others near flag at Truman Library ground breaking
Scopenote: Tom Evans (standing at right), Stuart Symington (standing next to Mr. Evans), and others near flag.  Bess Truman and Robert P. Weatherford with their backs turned.  This appears to be the ground breaking event for the Harry S. Truman Library at Slover Park in Independence.   Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Former President Truman and family at the ground breaking of Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace Truman, Margaret Truman, Mary Jane Truman (Mr. Truman's sister), and Basil O'Connor on platform near shelter house in Slover Park, during ceremonies for the ground breaking of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Former President and Mrs. Truman and Robert P. Weatherford at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Bess Wallace Truman and Robert P. Weatherford (backs turned)and Harry S. Truman near microphone (back turned).  This is the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library in Slover Park, Independence, Missouri.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Red Cross truck and people at the ceremony for the ground breaking for the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Red Cross truck and people at Slover Park, the scene of the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library, in Independence, Missouri.    Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Basil O'Connor at microphone during ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor at microphone during the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library at Slover Park in Independence, Missouri.    Donnor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Robert P. Weatherford at Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Mayor Robert P. Weatherford at microphone, at ground breaking for the Harry S. Truman Library.  This was held at Slover Park in Independence.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: General scene at old shelter house in Slover Park during ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: General scene at old shelter house in Slover Park during ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library.    Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Truman family and others at Library groundbreaking
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Bess Wallace, and Robert P. Weatherford in background. Alonzo Gentry left foreground.  The event is the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library at Slover Park in Independence, Missouri.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Former President and Mrs. Truman sitting on platform in Slover Park for the ground breaking ceremony for the Truman Library
Scopenote: From left to right, former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mary Jane Truman sitting with others on platform in front of Shelter House in Slover Park.  Donor:  Kenneth Thompson

title: Harry S. Truman in his Office at the Federal Reserve Bank
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman holding tear sheets from his book, "Memoirs," in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Harry Truman at autograph party for his Memoirs
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing in foreground, right) with others at an autograph party for Truman's Memoirs at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri.  Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Harry Truman, Gene Bailey, and Mike Westwood at party
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, Gene Bailey, and Mike Westwood with others at an autograph party for Truman's Memoirs at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. Sitting at table left to right: Gene Bailey, Harry S. Truman, Paul "Mike" Westwood.

title: Harry Truman and Gene Bailey with others
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman with Gene Bailey and others at an autograph party for Truman's Memoirs at Muehlebach Hotel. Mr. Truman at center sitting at the table, Gene Bailey to his right.

title: Harry Truman and Gene Bailey with others
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Gene Bailey with others at an autograph part for Truman's Memoirs held at the Muehlebach Hotel. Harry Truman at center sitting at the table, Gene Bailey on the left.

title: Harry Truman and Gene Bailey at autograph party
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, Gene Bailey with others at an autograph party for Truman's Memoirs at the Muehlebach Hotel. Sitting at table left to right: Gene Bailey, Harry S. Truman.

title: Harry Truman and Gene Bailey with others at party
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Gene Bailey with others at an autograph party for Truman's "Memoirs" at the Muehlebach Hotel.  Mr. Truman sitting at table, behind lower arrangements; Gene Bailey on his right.

title: Margaret's wedding announcement
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman announces Margaret Truman's wedding. He is seated behind a desk at his office in the Federal Reserve Bank Building in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Harry S. Truman with Averell Harriman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman with Averell Harriman and another unidentified man. Left to Right: Averell Harriman, Harry S. Truman, unidentified man.

title: Clifton and Margaret Truman Daniel
Scopenote: Clifton and Margaret Truman Daniel during a press conference in Independence, Missouri regarding their upcoming wedding.  Paul (Mike) Westwood and Louis Howell are in background.   Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Margaret Truman and Clifton Daniel, at press conference
Scopenote: Margaret Truman and Clifton Daniel at a press conference in Independence, Missouri, about their upcoming wedding. Paul [Mike] Westwood, Louis Howell, and others are in background.  Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in car
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman in car.    Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Trumans and Daniels at Truman home
Scopenote: Truman home in Independence, Missouri. From left to right, Mrs. Bess Truman, Harry S. Truman, Mr. E. C. and Mrs. Elvah Daniel.  Clifton and Margaret Daniel in the background on the porch.

title: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel arriving in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel at plane arriving in Independence, Missouri for their wedding.    Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Bess Truman, Clifton Daniel, Margaret Truman, Harry S. Truman, Mr. and Mrs. Daniel
Scopenote: From left to right, Bess Truman, former President Harry S. Truman, Clifton Daniel, Margaret Truman Daniel, Clifton Daniel's parents, Mr. and Mrs. E. C. Daniel on the front lawn of the Truman home in Independence, Missouri. They are gathered for the wedding of Margaret Truman and Clifton Daniel.  Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel with others
Scopenote: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel with others.  They are preparing for a press conference in regard to their upcoming wedding.   Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Clifton and Margaret Daniel
Scopenote: Clifton and Margaret Truman Daniel on their wedding day.  Same as 59-615.

title: Wedding Party with Clifton and Margaret Daniel
Scopenote: Wedding Party with Clifton and Margaret Daniel. They are at the stairwell in the Truman house. Left to right: George Backer, Turner Catledge, John Barrow (best man), Clifton Daniel, Margaret Truman Daniel, Drucie Snyder Horton, Mary Shaw Branton. Similar to 97-54 and 85-77-3.

title: Margaret Truman Daniel and Clifton Daniel on wedding day
Scopenote: Margaret Truman Daniel and Clifton Daniel on their wedding day in Independence, Missouri under a canopy in front of Trinity Episcopal Church.  Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Margaret Truman arriving by car in wedding dress
Scopenote: Margaret Truman Daniel alighting from a car on her wedding day. Former President Harry S. Truman stands behind the car.

title: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel at their wedding
Scopenote: Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel at their wedding in Independence, Missouri.  They are posing in the Truman home.  Bridesmaid Drucie Snyder is at right.  Donor:  Harry Barth

title: Church scene of Margaret Daniel's wedding place
Scopenote: Scene of crowds at the church on Margaret Truman Daniel's wedding day.

title: Mr. and Mrs. J. Vivian Truman in front of church
Scopenote: Mr. and Mrs. J. Vivian Truman in front of church at Margaret Truman Daniel's wedding. Donor: Harry Barth

title: Harry S. Truman and Averell Harriman with others
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) and Averell Harriman (front row, second from right) with unidentified others in Kansas City at an airport.

title: Truman with Harriman in Kansas City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front left) walks with Averell Harriman (second from the left) down a hallway in Kansas City, Missouri. Others in the photograph are unidentified.  See also 69-517.

title: Truman with Averell Harriman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from right) in a photograph with Averell Harriman (right) at an airport in Kansas City, Missouri. Mrs. Averell Harriman is next to former President Truman. Others in the photograph are unidentified.  See also 69-517.

title: Harry S. Truman and Averell Harriman with others
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from the right) and Averell Harriman (right)in Kansas City, Missouri.  Mrs. Averell Harriman is to the left of Mr. Truman. Others are unidentified. They are at an airport.

title: President Harry S. Truman in his working office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in his working office at the Harry S. Truman Library. This photo was taken while President Truman was preparing for an interview with Edward R. Murrow. Both President Truman and former Prime Minister Clement Attlee were being interviewed for Murrow's "Small World" program. Several men from the news crew are setting up. Bess Truman is sitting in a chair in the office. See also motion picture MP59-5.

title: Truman speaks at the Dedication of his Birthplace
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony. Row 1: (right to left) Randall Jessee, unidentified, Monsignor L. Curtis Tiernan, Senator Stuart Symington, unidentified.  All others are unidentified.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Speaks at his Birthplace Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony in Lamar, Missouri. Seated, left to Right: Leonard Woodcock, Vice President of United Auto Workers Union; Governor James Blair; Stuart Symington; Randall Jessee. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman inspects hat at Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Truman inspects a hat in one of the rooms of his birth home during the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri. Left to Right: Harry S. Truman; Leonard F. Haslag, Missouri State Park Board Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Crowd gathers at speeches during Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd gathers to listen to speeches during the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman signs guest log in his Birth home
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman signs the guest book in his birth home during the Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri. Left to Right: Harry S. Truman, Leland Cox, unidentified, Rufus Burrus, Joseph Jaeger, Ted Marks, unidentified. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman speaks at his Birthplace Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing) speaks at the dedication of his birth home during the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony.  Seated behind Truman on the left is Randall Jessee.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Crowd lines up to enter Truman Birth home
Scopenote: A crowd gathers to enter the birth home of Former President Harry S. Truman in Lamar, Missouri. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Birthplace Dedication Banquet
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman heads up the table at the Birthplace Dedication Banquet in Lamar, Missouri.  Man on the far right is Rufus Burrus.  All others unidentified.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman and Others Admire Truman Shrine Memorial
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and others look at the Truman Shrine Memorial placed in front of his birth home in Lamar, Missouri. Left to Right: Leland Cox, unidentified, Harry S. Truman. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Two men shake hands at the dedication of Truman's birthplace
Scopenote: Two unidentified men shake hands while Rufus Burrus (in uniform) and others look on at the dedication of President Harry S. Truman's birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.

title: Truman walks at the dedication of his birthplace
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, front row second from right, walks and talks with another man while attending the dedication of his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.  All others in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman and others pray at a ceremony to dedicate his birthplace
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, fifth from left, prays with others at a ceremony held to dedicate his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.  Fourth from the left is Senator Stuart Symington.  Sixth from the left is Truman friend Randall Jessee.  All others in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Truman shakes hands with a man while attending the dedication of his birthplace
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, front seat passenger, shakes hands with a man while attending the dedication of his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.

title: Truman and others at Lamar Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Truman stands in front of his birth home in Lamar, Missouri. Left to Right: unidentified, Leland Cox, unidentified, Former President Harry S. Truman, Ted Marks. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman's Lamar Birthplace Shrine Memorial
Scopenote: 2 unidentified men stand in front of the Truman Shrine Memorial during the Dedication of the birthplace of former President Harry S. Truman in Lamar, Missouri.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman tours his birth home in Lamar, Missouri
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front) tours his birth home during the dedication of his Birthplace in Lamar, Missouri. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman at Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing at counter) signs a document during the dedication of his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.  Standing behind Truman is Rufus Burrus. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman stands with men during birth home dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses at his Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri.  Left to Right: unidentified, Leland Cox, unidentified, unidentified, unidentified, John Panlow, Ted Marks (behind Truman), Harry S. Truman, Rufus Burrus (behind Truman), Charles Holcomb. Rear: Georgia Neese Clark Gray (in white hat). Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Crowd listens to speech at Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd listens to a speech made at the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman greets others at Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) greets others at the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri.  All others are unidentified. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman walks in a parade held for the dedication of his birthplace
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, background- center left, walks in a parade held in his honor at the dedication of his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.  All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: The Truman Memorial Shrine
Scopenote: 2 men stand in front of The Truman Memorial Shrine during the dedication of Former President Harry S. Truman's birth home. Left to Right: William Randall, unidentified. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman proceeding down stairs after Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman proceeds down some steps after attending an event related to the dedication of his birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.  Top: Joseph Jaeger Jr., Missouri Director of Parks; Ted Marks; Rufus Burrus Center: Leland Cox Bottom: unidentified; Former President Harry S. Truman, M. Cowan Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman looks at a room in his birth home
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman inspects a room on his tour through his birth home during the Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri.  Left to right: Leonard F. Haslag of the Missouri State Park Board, Harry S. Truman  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman looks at the Truman Shrine Memorial
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman looks at the marble Truman Shrine Memorial placed in front of his birth home in Lamar, Missouri, during the Birthplace Dedication. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Water well outside of Truman's birth home
Scopenote: The men stand in front of the well outside of Former President Harry S. Truman's Birth home in Lamar, Missouri.  Left to Right: unidentified, Harry S. Truman, Leland Cox Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Crowd at Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: A crowd listens to speeches at the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony in Lamar, Missouri. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Birthplace of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The birth home of Former President Harry S. Truman restored by the United Auto Workers Union. Photo taken during the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication Ceremony in Lamar, Missouri.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Cheerleaders and a band march at the dedication of Truman's birthplace
Scopenote: Cheerleaders and a band march in a parade in a parade held in honor of the dedication of President Harry S. Truman's birthplace in Lamar, Missouri.

title: Truman in a room during his Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman tours the rooms in his birth home during the Birthplace Dedication in Lamar, Missouri. Left to right: Harry S. Truman, Rufus Burrus. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman greets Battery "D" man at Birthplace Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes the hand of a fellow Battery "D" veteran (unidentified) during the Harry S. Truman Birthplace Dedication. Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: Truman Birthplace Dedication Banquet
Scopenote: Birthplace Dedication Banquet held in honor of Former President Harry S. Truman by the United Auto Workers Union-C10.  Photo from Joseph Jaeger, Missouri State Park Board.

title: President Truman's birthday - TV set up
Scopenote: Television crews work in the lobby of the Truman Library to record a special to be broadcast in honor of former President Harry S. Truman's 75th birthday.  This shot is of the admission desk in the Library lobby.  All in the photo are unidentified.

Scopenote: TV crews work to set up in preparation for a recording associated with the celebration of former President Harry S. Truman's 75th birthday.  They are setting up in the lobby of the Truman Library.

title: Japanese artifacts
Scopenote: A photograph of a pair of Japanese vases and a miniature geisha statue sitting on top of a silk Buddhist cloth. The artifacts were placed in the Garden Room of the Harry S. Truman Library. The doll was presented to Margaret Truman from the Mayor of Kobe, Japan in 1950.  The vases were presented to President Truman from the citizen of Kobe, Japan.

title: President Truman's cake
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman's birthday cake.

title: Former President Truman's cake
Scopenote: A picture of former President Harry S. Truman's birthday cake.

title: Cutting birthday cake at Truman Library
Scopenote: Bessie Taylor cuts former President Harry S. Truman's birthday cake while some of the employees of the Harry S. Truman Library watch. Other people identified in the photo, from left to right, are Harry Clark, James R. Fuchs, Jerry Hess, Sgt. Bill Story, John Curry, Milton Perry, and Phil Lagerquist.

title: Cutting a cake at Truman Library
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman Library archivist J.R. Fuchs (left) watches Bessie Taylor (right) cutting former President Harry S. Truman's 75th birthday cake.

title: First Researcher at Truman Library
Scopenote: This photograph was taken in the research room of the Harry S. Truman Library shows Mr. Eugene Schmidtlein (seated behind desk), the first researcher at the Truman Library. With Mr. Schmidtlein are archivist Phil Lagerquist (left) and Joan Allen (right).

title: Researchers in Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: This photograph was taken in the research room of the Harry S. Truman Library shows Mr. Eugene Schmidtlein (seated behind desk), the first researcher at the Truman Library. With Mr. Schmidtlein are archivist Phil Lagerquist (left) and Joan Allen (right).

title: First Researcher at the Truman Library
Scopenote: This photograph was taken in the research room of the Harry S. Truman Library shows Mr. Eugene Schmidtlein (seated behind desk), the first researcher at the Truman Library. With Mr. Schmidtlein are archivist Phil Lagerquist (left) and Joan Allen (right).

title: Former President Truman and Ben Griffith at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, left, stands with Ben M. Griffith, right, head driver of the Oregon Cavalcade, celebrating the anniversary of the Oregon Trail. Ben Griffith of Salem, Oregon, drove the Independence, Oregon wagon. Mr. Griffith is presenting Mr. Truman with a donkey figurine.

title: Former President Truman and Ben Griffith at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, left, stands with Ben M. Griffith, right, head driver of the Oregon Cavalcade, celebrating the anniversary of the Oregon Trail. Ben Griffith of Salem, Oregon, drove the Independence, Oregon wagon. Mr. Griffith is presenting Mr. Truman with a donkey figurine.

title: Schellenberg, Cutcliffe and Brooks stand beside a podium
Scopenote: Dr. Ted R. Schellenberg, left, Ben Cutcliffe, center, and Dr. Philip C. Brooks, right, stand beside a podium.  They are in the auditorium of the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Group of people sitting in an auditorium
Scopenote: A group of people, all unidentified, await a lecture by Dr. Ted R. Schellenberg.  The lecture is taking place in the auditorium of the Harry S. Truman Library.

Scopenote: In this picture is of a place setting from the White House during the Truman Administration. The exhibit was on display in the Garden Room of the Harry S. Truman Library.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Ames Laboratory.   Donor:  Truman Library Collection

title: Cartoon: "See Herman Goering's $300,000 jewel-studded BATON"
Scopenote: Cartoon of "See Herman Goering's $300,000 jewel-studded BATON", advertising one of the exhibits on the Army's Victory Loan Train.

Scopenote: A group of Girl Scouts visit the Truman Library on busses.

title: Inscription on Mantel in West Foyer of Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: The inscription on the mantel in the West Foyer is a copy of an inscription on the White House.  It was displayed in the West Foyer of the Harry S. Truman Library.
